loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Meet Rose, a smallholder farmer with extremely humble beginnings. She is based in Koibatek village in the North Rift region of Kenya. Her upbringing was difficult. She never managed to finish her primary education, but she is very determined to give the best life to her children. Fifteen years ago, Rose started farming on her husband's two-acre farm. She did it mostly for subsistence until recently. She now keeps a dairy cow that gives her ten litres of milk to sell every day. She also grows vegetables that she uses to prepare food and also to sell. Rose is seeking a loan to buy another dairy cow, which will produce additional milk she can sell. This investment will not only double the income that Rose is making from milk, but will also mitigate risks associated with having just one productive cow. The additional income will enable her to comfortably handle her family's food and education costs, which happen to be her highest expenses. Please consider providing a loan to Rose to help her improve her economic activity. 
Support this mother who does the impossible to support her children.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Ana Norma

texts.en:
Ana Norma is 49 years old and a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Ana Norma has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 17,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Ana Norma has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Ana Norma would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Veronica Pilar

texts.es:
Verónica es una joven ecuatoriana de 20 años de edad , es soltera  gracias al esfuerzo de sus padres logró terminar la secundaria  y luego  la falta de recursos económicos lo llevó a trabajar desde muy chica para poder sustentar sus necesidades y poder ayudar en las necesidades de su familia, Verónica es oriunda de la ciudad de Latacunga, viven en un barrio urbano de la ciudad junto a su madre y hermanos en casa propia, por ende no pagan arriendo.
El mayor obstáculo que han tenido ha sido la falta de financiamiento para poder hacer que su negocio crezca, actualmente tiene un  pequeño negocio que consiste en la venta de artículos de aseo como papel higiénico, pasta dental, jabón, cepillos , etc.  aprendio de esta actividad ya que trabajaba con una vecina, trabaja de 8 a 10 horas diarias, le ayuda en ocasiones su mamá.
Requiere el crédito para invertir en la compra  más producto y en estudios,  esto también ayudará a  que Veronica  pueda mejorar sus estilo de vida y la de su familia, dándole la educación que ella no tuvo y la la oportunidad de salir adelante. Además a Veronica le gustaria en un futuro que que su negocio crezca cada día mas. Verónica  agradece a Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador y a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal.
texts.en:
Verónica is a 20-year-old Ecuadorian young woman. She is single and thanks to her parents' efforts, she managed to finish secondary school and then the lack of economic resources led her to work when she was very young to be able to cover her needs and be able to help with the family's needs. Verónica is a native of the city of Latacunga, they live in an urban neighborhood in the city with her mother and siblings in their own house, so they don't pay rent.

The biggest obstacle that they have had is the lack of funding to be able to make her business grow. Currently, she has a small business that consists of selling personal care supplies such as toilet paper, toothpaste, soap, combs, etc.  She learned this work since she worked with a neighbor. She works 8 to 10 hours daily and sometimes her mother helps her.

She needs a loan to invest in the purchase of more products and in education. This will also help Verónica to be able to improve her lifestyle and that of her family, providing an education that she didn't have and the opportunity to get ahead. In addition, in the future, Verónica would like her business to grow day by day. Verónica is grateful to the Fundación Alternativa in Ecuador and to Kiva for making possible the growth in her work and personal life.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise and stock her business; this income will help her pay for her sibling's education.

loans.name: Sonia Monica

texts.es:
Sonia es una mujer de 26 años de edad, casada, tiene 2 hijos varones de 9 y 4 años, y una hija mujer de 7 años, y su negocio es la confección de tejidos artesanales hechos a mano.
Ella es independiente, buena madre, responsable, activa y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la feria de la zona ‘16 de julio’, caracterizada por el comercio informal donde se puede encontrar desde una aguja para coser hasta un tractor. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía entre los 2-18 grados centígrados durante el día y todo el año.
Sonia es de tez morena, cabello negro largo trenzado, baja estatura, su forma de vestir es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), y su lengua materna es el aymará y habla español para el comercio. Su negocio es la confección de tejidos de forma artesanal (a mano), para luego comercializarlas los días jueves y domingos en la feria ’16 de julio’. Sus prendas más solicitadas son; chompas cuello alto, chalecos, bufandas, guantes, gorros y otros. “Aquí hace mucho frío y mis prendas se venden todo el año, por eso tengo un negocio rentable y constante…” comenta. su sueño es tener un taller de confección de tejidos para ampliar su mercado y desea realizar la compra de una máquina de tejer para producir en mayor cantidad. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 10 años que viene realizando esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Sonia solicita un préstamo para la compra de una máquina de tejer industrial para producir en cantidad.
texts.en:
Sonia is a 26-year-old woman, married, has two sons ages 9 and 4, and a daughter age 7, and her business is making knitted crafts by hand. 

She is independent, a good mother, responsible, active, and hard-working. She has her business in the fair in the 16 de julio zone, characterized for the informal trade where one can find everything from a sewing needle to a tractor. It has a cold and dry climate with a temperature that varies between 2-18 degrees centigrade during the day and all year long. 

Sonia is olive-skinned, has long braided black hair, is short, dresses traditionally (hat, blanket and pollera [traditional Andean skirt]), her native language is Aymará and she speaks Spanish for business. Her business is making knitted items by hand to later sell them on Thursdays and Sundays at the 16 de julio fair. Her most requested articles are sweaters with a high neck, vests, scarves, gloves, hats and more. "Here it is very cold and I sell my articles all year long, so I have a profitable and constant business..." she says. Her dream is to have a weaving shop to expand her market and she wants to purchase a knitting machine to make a higher quantity. This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the 10 years that she has been doing this work.

For these reasons, Sonia asks for a loan to purchase an industrial knitting machine to produce in quantity.

loans.use: to purchase an industrial knitting machine.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.es:
La socia Faustina se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de comida, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante, la socia hace paltos como pollo al horno, sopas entre otros, el sueño de la socia es ampliar su negocio de venta de comida. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar verduras, pollo y carne.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Faustina continues working in her business of selling food.  She wants to get ahead through this business.  She makes dishes like roasted chicken and soups, among others.  Her dream is to expand her business of selling food.

She is requesting the loan to buy vegetables, chicken, and meat.  She is happy about the loan, and she pledges to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, chicken, and meat.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is the age of 47. She is the mother of five children and lives in Lahore, Pakistan.

Her husband provides a local rural transport facility in the form of a truck for the people of his society. He has been running the truck as a loader and cargo transport. He has had his own truck for the last six years.

Due to excess and continuous use, it needs some maintenance. He has decided to repair his truck as soon as possible, but due to a lack of finances he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing his truck. Therefore, Nasreen has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing his truck. Nasreen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to cover cost of repairing her husband's truck (vehicle)

loans.name: Joreta

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Joreta works hard to support her family.

She has a personal products business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from frozen foods.  Joreta is borrowing PHP 40,000 through Kiva partner NWTF in order to buy more items such as cosmetics, jewelry and ready-to-wear clothing.

Joreta has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy more items such as cosmetics, jewelry and ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
La socia Marina se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de comida, la socia realiza diferentes platos como pollo al horno, sopas y saltados de carne, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, verduras y pollo.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Marina continues working selling food. She makes different dishes such as baked chicken, soups and meat stir-fries. She works from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm. She has had this business for 8 years now and it is going very well. Her dream is to have a restaurant. She asks for the loan to purchase cooking products such as rice, vegetables, and chicken.

The member is happy for the loan and promises to make the payments.

loans.use: to purchase cooking products such as rice, vegetables, and chicken.

loans.name: Aguptus

texts.en: Aguptus is a 44-year-old hardworking man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in livestock rearing alongside the sale of produce in order to earn him an extra income. He started this business to have a source of income. He hopes to expand his farm however his main challenge is inadequate capital. He is requesting  a loan to buy more cows to add to the farm.

loans.use: to buy more cows to add to the farm.

loans.name: Denys Exequiel

texts.es:
Denys, es empleado como repartidor de cilindros de gas propano de un negocio que vende productos varios y en su tiempo libre se dedica a vender variedad de mariscos; vive con su compañera de vida y un hijo; la venta de mariscos lo aprendió siendo ayudante, actualmente tiene más de tres años de tener su propio negocio y  tiene un año de ser empleado.
Comprará una motocicleta para desempeñar mejor su trabajo y realizar actividades de la venta de mariscos, pretende ampliar su área de atención a los clientes, ser más puntual con las entregas y seguir generando recursos económicos para dar a su familia un mejor estilo de vida y cancelar su deuda.
Sus sueños son establecer mejor su negocio, disminuir las necesidades familiares y ofrecer un mejor futuro a su familia.
texts.en:
Denys is employed as a propane gas tank distributor for a business that sells a variety of products and, in his free time, he works selling a variety of shellfish. He lives with his life partner and a child. He learned how to sell shellfish as an assistant. Currently, he has more than three years of having his own business and has been an employee for a year.

He will purchase a motorcycle to carry out his work better and to sell shellfish. He plans to expand his customer service area, be more punctual with the deliveries and continue generating economic resources to give his family a better lifestyle and pay off his debt. His dream is to establish his business better, reduce his family needs, and offer his family a better future.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle to carry out his work better and to make his shellfish sales.

loans.name: Orlando Jose

texts.es: Hace 25 años que don Orlando inicio en el oficio de Artesanía en la actividad de elaboración de ladrillo de barro. Inicio trabajando con su papá desde niño y a medida que iban creciendo fue aprendiendo, hoy en día sigue trabajando con su papa y administrando el negocio. En las mañanas don Orlando sale a trabajar como taxista y por las tardes se dedica a la elaboración de ladrillos. Solicita el crédito para comprar materiales como: barro, talpuja entre otros. El crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá obtener mayor inventario y satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. Dentro de sus planes futuros está comprar un pequeño lote donde pueda tener más espacio y trabajar el producto.
texts.en:
Orlando started in the field of craftsmanship by making clay bricks 25 years ago.  He started working with his father when he was a boy.  As he was growing, he was learning.  Now, he continues working with his father and running the business.

Orlando goes to work as a taxi driver in the mornings.  In the afternoons he makes bricks.

He is requesting the loan to buy materials like clay and ‘talpuja’ [spongy, white earth], among others.

The loan will be a big help to him.  He will be able to get more inventory and meet his customer demand.  His plans for the future are to buy a small lot where he will be able to have more space and to work the product.

loans.use: to buy materials like clay and ‘talpuja’ [spongy, white earth], among others.

loans.name: Jumelle Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du groupe JUMELLE sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, et ont en moyenne 05 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles traditionnelle à SANOUBOUGOU I un des quartiers populaire de la ville de SIKASSO  3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur dixième prêt solidaire avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Mme AMINATA fait la vente des boissons dans ce groupe de femmes. Elle est première position de la  gauche vers la  droite sur la photo.
 Elle compte acheter avec son prêt 33 casiers de 24 bouteilles de boissons à SIKASSO, sa vente se fait au marché à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 60 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The five members of the Jumelle group are married women who are, on average, 35 years old and have five children. They live mostly in traditional families in Sanoubougou I, one of the popular areas of Sikasso, in the third administrative region of Mali. The group is on their 10th group loan in order to satisfy their customers' needs.

Aminata works selling drinks. She is seated first from the left in the photo. With her loan, she plans to buy 33 cases of 24 bottles of drinks in Sikasso. She makes her sales at the market to male and female customers for cash and credit. 

Aminata hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 60,000 francs CFA, of which a part will be used to pay back [her part of] the loan and its interest and a part will be put in savings.

loans.use: to buy drinks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: A sus 30 años de edad Carlos es un joven casado, tiene un hijo de 4 años que es el primer año que asiste  a la escuela, el se dedica a trabajar lavando carros y también tiene pequeños  corrales donde cría pollos mismos que los cuida su esposa, en la casa donde vive es de su madre, el dinero del crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos para apoyarse en los gastos de su hogar para que a su hijo no le haga falta lo necesario para la educación.
texts.en: At 30 years old, Carlos is a married young man and has a 4-year-old son who is in the first year of attending school. He works washing cars and also has small coops where he raises chickens, which his wife cares for. The house where they live is his mother's. The money from the loan will be invested in the purchase of chickens to help with the household expenses, so that his son doesn't lack anything for his education.

loans.use: to purchase chickens.

loans.name: Vân

texts.es:
Mrs. Vân operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish.

Vân is 25 years old and she is married with 2 children.
Vân lives  in Quang Xuong district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2014, Vân joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Vân has successfully repaid 1 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Vân has been involved in this business for 2 years.
One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having latrine . She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick…to build toilet.

In the future, Vân hopes for her children to do well in school, to maintain  a successful business, and for her business to do well.
texts.en:
Mrs. Vân operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. Vân has been involved in this business for two years. She is 25 years old and married with two children. Vân lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoá province.

In 2014, Vân joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women (FPW) to improve her business. Vân has successfully repaid one loan from FPW.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns Vân is not having a latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet. In the future, Vân hopes for her children to do well in school, to maintain a successful business, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet

loans.name: Las Babys Group

texts.es:
El banco de emprendimiento LAS BABYS compuesta por nueve integrantes de las cuales siete son mujeres y dos varones se dedican a distintas actividades como; tapizado de vehículos, venta de jugos batidos, venta de cubiertas de celulares,  venta de jugo, venta de perfumes, venta de refrescos y venta de ropa, para solicitar un préstamo y ampliar sus negocios.
La presidenta del grupo es la señora Jael es una mujer de 37 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene tres hijos de las edades de 15, 8 y 10 años y su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional.
Ella es buena madre, independiente,  responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona Sur un sitio caracterizado por el comercio en todas las áreas que lo realizan descendiente de mineros relocalizados de occidente, ahora como segunda generación de los originales se dedican al comercio y la manufactura, de clima cálido, tropical y húmedo con una temperatura aproximada de 30 grados centígrados durante todo el año.
Jael es de tez ( morena, alta )su vida la realiza con su pareja que se dedica al transporte y sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa propia que cuenta con agua potable y electricidad. Los deseos de superación para mejorar su negocio la llevaron a conformar una banca de personas que se dedican a diferentes actividades. Su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional como; majadito de charque (carne deshidratada, arroz, huevo frito y plátano frito),locro carretero cruceño (sopa de: carne deshidratada, carne cortada en pedacitos, yuca y huevo), Sopa de Remojado (sopa de huesos), Chicharrón de Taitetu (Chanchitos de monte ”taitetú” frito), Cogote relleno (cuello de gallina criolla, relleno puede ser de papa y churiqui), etc. La comida que realiza es deliciosa por lo que tiene clientes constantes y habituales. Su sueño es tener un restaurante con variedad de comidas. Ella desea ampliar su negocio realizando la compra de una cocina grande y utensilios de cocina como; cucharones, cuchillos, ollas, etc. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Jael solicita un préstamo para la compra de cocina y utensilios para poder cocinar mayor variedad de comidas.
texts.en:
The entrepreneurial bank Las Babys is made up of nine members, of whom seven are women and two are men, who work in different jobs such as vehicle upholstery, smoothie sales, cell phone cover sales, juice sales, perfume sales, soft drink sales, and clothing sales, to ask for a loan and expand their businesses. 

The president of the group is Jael, a 37-year-old woman, who lives with her partner, has three children ages 15, 8 and 10, and her business is the sale of traditional food. 

She is a good mother, independent, responsible and hard-working. Her business is located in the South zone, a place characterized by trade in all areas carried out by the descendants of the relocated miners from the west. Now, as the second generation of the originals, they work in trade and manufacturing. It is a warm, tropical and humid climate with a temperature of approximately 30 degrees centigrade during the whole year.

Jael has tanned skin, is tall, and has her life with her partner, who works in transportation, and her children, who are students. They live in their own house that has drinking water and electricity. The desire to better herself to improve her business brought her to make this bank of people who work in different trades. Her business is selling traditional foods such as majadito de charque (dehydrated meat, rice, fried egg and fried plantain), locro carretero cruceño (a soup of dehydrated meat, chopped meat, yucca and egg), sopa de remojado (egg soup), chicharrón de taitetú (fried Taitetu wild boar pork cracklings), cogote relleno (creole chicken neck filled with potato and chicken liver), etc. The food that she makes is delicious so she has constant and habitual customers. Her dream is to have a restaurant with a variety of foods. She wants to expand her business purchasing a large cooking range and kitchen utensils such and ladles, knives, pots, etc. This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the three years that she has been doing this work.

For these reasons, Jael asks for a loan to purchase a cooking range and utensils to be able to cook a wider variety of foods.

loans.use: to purchase a range and utensils.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe BENKADI ont en moyenne 39 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à TOMINIAN/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des habits, des chaussures, des céréales et des condiments.
Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe BENKADI sont à leur 9ème prêt solidaire. NEMA, 2ème  femme  de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 5 complets de prêt à porter pour les enfants, 10 chemises, 5 robes et 10 foulards. Elle s’approvisionne sur place chez les grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 30 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Benkadi group are, on average, 39 years old and have four children. They all live in traditional extended families in Tominian/Segou (the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). These women know each other through family ties and work buying and selling clothing, shoes, cereals, and condiments.

After having repaid their previous loans correctly, the women of the Benkadi group are now on their ninth group loan. 

Nema, who is standing second from the left in the photo, plans to use her loan to buy five ready-to-wear children's outfits, 10 shirts, five dresses, and 10 scarves. She procures her goods in the area from wholesalers. She makes her sales to male and female customers for cash and often for credit.

Nema hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 30,000 francs CFA, which will be used to cover health, dietary, clothing and school costs. The rest will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Orlando Vicente

texts.es:
Rolando tiene 33 años de edad tiene 4 hijos y vive en San Miguel provincia de Bolivar en la comunidad Salado Chico, pertenece a la ventanilla rural San Francisco.

El se dedica a la agricultura y a la compra de animales como chanchos, vacas, y cuyes para engordarlos y luego venderlos, solicita el credito para comprar animales y el alimento para los mismos. Las comprars realiza en San Miguel cada semana, su sueño es mejorar economicamente gracias al credito. En su tiempo libre le gusta viajar.
texts.en:
Rolando is 33 years old, has 4 children, and lives in San Miguel, Bolivar province, in the Salado Chico community which belongs to the San Francisco rural service area.

He works in agriculture and purchasing animals such as pigs, cows and guinea pigs to fatten them and later sell them. He asks for a loan to purchase animals and the food for them. He does his shopping in San Miguel each week. His dream is to improve economically, thanks to the loan. In his free time, he likes to travel.

loans.use: to purchase animals to fatten.

loans.name: Esmeralda Marisabel

texts.es:
Esmeralda, de 40 años de edad, está casada, tienen dos hijos, uno de 16 años que estudia bachillerato y uno de 7 años que estudia primer grado, ella se graduó de licenciatura en laboratorio clínico, gracias al apoyo de sus padres.- Su esposo tiene un cafetín donde vende comida rápida.  

Esmeralda, tiene un laboratorio clínico donde realiza exámenes básicos, tiene 7 años de dedicarse a prestar este servicio, por lo que tiene una buena clientela.- Nunca pensó en ser empleada, por lo que decidió poner su propio laboratorio, no tiene más actividades a las que se dedique. 

El laboratorio lo tiene en su casa y paga a una asistente para que le ayude con el trabajo, el horario es de las 8 a.m. a 2 p.m.

El préstamo será invertido para comprar equipo clínico para el laboratorio, ya que ha firmado contratos para realizar exámenes a un grupo de niños y necesita tener todo lo necesario para poder realizarlo.

Los sueños de Esmeralda son: poder tener un laboratorio de referencia, donde pueda realizar exámenes a otros laboratorios, también desea que sus hijos puedan ser profesionales al igual que ella.
texts.en:
Esmeralda, age 40, is married and has two children.  One is 16 years old and goes to high school, and one is 7 years old and goes to first grade.  She graduated with a degree in clinical laboratory, thanks to her parents’ support.  Her husband has a snack bar where he sells fast food.

Esmeralda has a clinical laboratory where she does basic tests.  She has been providing this service for seven years, and she has a good clientele.  She never thought about being an employee, so she decided to establish her own laboratory.  She has no other business activities than this one.

The laboratory is at her house, and she pays an assistant to help her with the work.  Her schedule is from 8 a.m. until 2 p.m.

The loan will be used to buy clinical equipment for the laboratory.  She has signed contracts to do some tests on a group of children, and she needs to have everything needed to be able to do so.

Esmeralda’s dream is to be able to have reference laboratory where she is able to do tests from other laboratories.  She also wishes that her children will be able to become professionals like she is.

loans.use: to buy clinical equipment for the laboratory.

loans.name: Rahat's Group

texts.en:
Rahat, aged 42, is a mother of four children who lives in Lahore. Her husband has a garment business where he sells ready made ladies, gents and children's garments. He has 12 years of experience in this business. He has managed a good client base and has many loyal customers. He buys the garments from the wholesale market and then resells it at reasonable profits. Though he is self employed, his income only covers the major family expenses. He wants to improve their living conditions and work hard each day to make his dream come true. In order to enhance his business he wants to buy more stock of garments for his shop. This will help him increase the sales subsequently and earn good profits. 

Rahat has therefore requested for a loan to help her husband buy more stock as he doesn't have sufficient cash required for the purchase. They are pleased and thankful for a Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy more stock of garments for her husband's business.

loans.name: Sinignessigui Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe SINIGNESSIGUI ont en moyenne 39 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à TOMINIAN/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des céréales et des condiments.
Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe SINIGNESSIGUI sont à leur 9ème prêt solidaire. SARAN, 1ère femme debout de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 15Kgs d’oignon, 10Kgs de sel, 1 paquet de Cube Maggi, 10Litres d’huile, 1 panier de choux, 50Kgs de riz, 50Kgs de mil, 10Kgs de fonio,1 carton de Spaghetti et 2Kgs de piment. Elle s’approvisionne sur place chez les grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 30 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Sinignessigui group are, on average, 39 years old and have four children. They all live in traditional extended families in Taminian/Segou (the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). These women know each other through family ties and work buying and selling cereals and condiments. 

After having repaid their previous loans correctly, the women of the Sinignessigui group are on their ninth group loan. Saran, who is standing first from the right in the photo, plans to use her loan to buy 15 kilograms of onions, 10 kilograms of salt, one packet of Maggi cubes, 10 liters of oil, one tray of cabbage, 50 kilograms of rice, 50 kilograms of millet, 10 kilograms of fonio, one carton of spaghetti, and two kilograms of peppers. She procures her goods in the area from wholesalers.

Saran makes her sales to male and female customers for cash and often for credit. She hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 30,000 francs, which will be used to cover health, dietary, clothing, and school costs. The rest will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy condiments and cereals

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is 45 years-old. She is mother of five children and lives in Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her son has been running a General Store in which he sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap biscuits etc. He manages his household necessities from his own store as well and some relatives like to purchase from his General Store. He speaks with monotonous tone which is impressive and he easily wins the trust of others. Due to his behavior and tone; he has built up very good relations with his customers. His general store is very famous in the town that is the reason his business is running well.

Due to good relations his sales have increased a lot but he does not have sufficient stock to cope with the demand. Therefore, Shamim requested a loan for her son so that he can buy more stock of wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits etc. Shamim thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her son's general store.

loans.name: Farkhanda

texts.en:
Farkhanda is 30-years-old and the married mother of two children. 

Her husband is a milkman by profession; the income generated through his present herd is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so he decided to enhance his business of milk sales. He has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in his locality.
 
With the support of BRAC Pakistan, Farkhanda's husband has gradually improved his business. Currently Farkhanda has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase another buffalo. 

This will help her husband to increase his sales, which will ultimately help in generating more income for him. 

Farkhanda thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo for her husband's milk sale business.

loans.name: David Santiago

texts.es:
David junto con su socio (ver foto) están tratando de consolidar y adecuar una tienda de mascotas, un proyecto que nació por un necesidad de trabajo y como necesidad de suplir las necesidades que tiene los dueños con sus hijos peludos.
Como hace poco tiempo inicio todavía están pendientes de realizar varias adecuaciones, publicidad, surtido y estos son los motivos que lo llevaron a solicitar un crédito dando un mejor impacto visual a su negocio, con mayor surtido y buena publicidad para mover su empresa y lograr una sostenibilidad económica.
texts.en: David together with his partner (see photo) are trying to consolidate and adapt their pet store, a project that was born out of necessity for employment as well as the need to supply the owners of the furry friends. As they only started a while ago they still have to make a number of renovations, publicity and build stock. These are the reasons that lead him to request a loan to give greater visual impact to his business with more stock and better publicity to boost the business and obtain  financial sustainability.

loans.use: to consolidate and boost his pet store investing in stock, renovations and publicity.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe DANAYA ont en moyenne 35 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à LAFIABOUGOU l’un des quartiers de SAN/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des produits cosmétiques, des ustensiles de cuisine, du lait et des cartes téléphoniques.
Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe DANAYA sont à leur 4ème prêt solidaire. KOUMBA, 1ère femme à droite sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 50Litres de lait frais et 35Kgs de lait en poudre. Elle s’approvisionne sur place chez les grossistes et chez les bergers. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Danaya group are, on average, 35 years old and have four children. They all live in traditional extended families in Lafiabougou, one of the areas in San/Segou (the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). These women know each other through family ties and work buying and selling cosmetics, kitchen utensils, milk, and telephone cards. After having repaid their previous loans correctly, the women of the Danaya group are now on their fourth group loan.

Koumba, who is the first woman on the right in the photo, plans to use her loan to buy 50 liters of fresh milk and 35 kilograms of powdered milk. She procures her goods in the area from wholesalers and shepherds. 

Koumba makes her sales to male and female customers for cash and often for credit. She plans to earn an average monthly profit of 20,000 francs CFA, which will be used to cover health, dietary, clothing, and school costs. The rest will be reinvested back into her business.

loans.use: to buy milk

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: Jose vive con sus padres y se gana la vida como transportista del servicio publico desde hace dos años Jose trabaja más de 8 horas al día y quiere un prestamo para mantenimiento general de su herramienta de trabajo (vehiculo) de esta manera podra trabajar con mayor seguridad Por motivos economicos Jose tuvo que dejar sus estudios, el cliente espera poder terminarlos a futuro y con la ayuda de su actividad comercial por lo que les agradecerá toda la ayuda que puedan darle
texts.en:
Jose lives with his parents and has made a living for the past two years by providing transportation services to the public. He works more than 8 hours per day and would like a loan in order to maintain his vehicle. This way, he will be able to work more safely.

For financial reasons, Jose had to leave school. He hopes to complete his studies in the future with the help of his earnings from his job. He thanks everyone for any help that they can give him.

loans.use: to maintain his vehicle.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es una mujer de 56 años de edad, casada, con hijos independientes, y su negocio es la elaboración de queso artesanal.
Su negocio lo desarrolla en la comunidad de ‘Cullucachi’ caracterizado por ubicarse en cercanías al lago sagrado Titicaca, área agrícola dónde se cría ganado; vacuno, ovino y camélido, se vive de la pesca y también de la agricultura del lugar, como la quinua, el chuño, la haba, la papa, etc., caracterizada por el clima frío, con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 1-12 grados centígrados y donde los rayos solares golpean fuertemente la superficie.
Juana es de tez morena, cabello negro largo trenzado, baja estatura, su vestimenta es tradicional (sombrero manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Aymará que se habla en el lugar, para realizar comercio en la ciudad habla español. Su vida la comparte con su esposo que se dedica a la agricultura, sus hijos son independientes y viven en otro lugar. Su casa está construida de adobe y tiene techo de paja, cuenta con electricidad y agua de pozo. Su negocio es la elaboración y venta de queso artesanal; la variedad de quesos más producida y consumida en la zona, es el queso fresco, que en términos prácticos, se pueden dividir entre crudos y cocidos, en donde podemos encontrar para el primero la cuajada campesina, obtenida de la pasteurización de la leche, obtención de la cuajada y su posterior salado y moldeado; o el quesillo, el queso doble crema, o el chaqueño, para el segundo caso, que después de la obtención de la cuajada, pasa a cocción, que puede ser en una semiesfera de acero o “paila”, donde la cuajada se cuece en seco, hervida en agua o suero de leche, según la clase de elaboración, ‘mi trabajo lleva mucha pasión, buscamos la manera de estar en constante mejoramiento de nuestros procesos…’ comenta. También se ocupa de la venta; ella transporta en una canasta la producción de queso obtenida hasta la zona del cementerio en una ciudad vecina a dos horas aproximadas de viaje, en ese lugar se sienta en el suelo cerca a la entrada del cementerio y abre su canasta para que en un tiempo de cuatro horas termine de vender hasta el último queso.  Su sueño es tener un establo amplio que brinde todas las comodidades para la producción quesera. Ella desea realizar la compra de ganado lechero para aumentar su producción y generar mejores ingresos. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 11 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Juana solicita un préstamo para la compra de ganado lechero para aumentar la producción quesera y con los beneficios mejorar su establo.
texts.en:
Juana is a 56 year old woman, married with grownup children. Her business is the production of handmade cheese. Her business is located in the Cullucachi community which is known for being located near the sacred lake Titicaca, an agricultural area where cattle, sheep and camelids are raised; people live off fishing and also local farm produce such as quinoa, chuño [freeze-dried potato], beans, potatoes, etc. It is known for its cold climate with a temperature that varies during the day of between 1-12 degrees centigrade and where the sun's rays hit the surface strongly.

Juana has a dark complexion, long braided hair, short stature, wears traditional clothing (hat, shawl and pollera skirt), her mother tongue is Aymara which she speaks locally, but to do business in the city she speaks Spanish. Her life is shared with her husband who works in farming. Her children are grown up and live elsewhere. Her house is adobe [mud brick] and has a thatched roof, she has electricity and water from a well.

Her business is making and selling handmade cheese; the variety of cheese most produced and consumed in the zone is fresh cheese, which in practical terms, can be divided into uncooked and cooked, and this is where we first find the peasant curds, obtained from pasteurising milk, then made from the curds and their salty and moulded coagulum; or the fresh cheese, double dream or chaqueño cheese [a semi-hard, ripened cheese made from whole cow’s milk]. In the second case, after obtaining the curd it is heated which can be in a metal pot, where the curd is heated dry, boiled in water or whey, depending on the type of processing,

"My job takes a lot of passion, we always search for a way to be constantly improving our processes...", she says.

She also works in sales; she transports the cheese she has produced in a basket to the cemetery of a neighbouring city, approximately two hours journey, and she sits on the ground near the entrance of the cemetery and opens her basket so that within four hours she has sold all of her cheese.

Her dream is to have a large barn that contains all the amenities for cheese production. She wants to buy dairy cattle to increase production and generate better income. This is her 2nd loan cycle with the institution in the 11 years she has been working this sector.

For these reasons, Juana is requesting a loan to buy a dairy cow to increase her cheese production and with the profits improve her barn.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Djiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe DJIGUISSEME ont en moyenne 36 ans, 2 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à LAFIABOUGOU l’un des quartiers de SAN/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des produits divers.
Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe DJIGUISSEME sont à leur 7ème prêt solidaire. AICHE, 1ère femme debout à gauche sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une douzaine de boîtes de pommade, 20 poupées, 20 paires de chaussure en plastique, 10 robes de prêt à porter et 10 foulards. Elle s’approvisionne sur place chez les grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 16 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Djiguisseme group are, on average, 36 years old and have two children. They all live in traditional extended families in Lafiabougou, one of the areas in San/Segou (the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). These women know each other through family ties and work buying and selling various goods. After having repaid their previous loans correctly, the women of the Djiguisseme group are now on their seventh group loan.

Aiche, the first woman standing on the left in the photo, plans to use her loan to buy a dozen ointments, 20 dolls, 20 pairs of plastic shoes, 10 ready-to-wear dresses, and 10 scarves. She procures these goods in the area from wholesalers. 

Aiche makes her sales to male and female customers for cash and often for credit. She hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 16,000 francs CFA, which will be used to cover health, dietary, clothing, and school costs. The rest will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy various goods

loans.name: Yovana

texts.es:
La socia Yovana se dedica al negocio de venta de productos de belleza, la socia vende lápiz labiales, cremas y perfumes, por medio de este negocio la socia quiere salir adelante, la socia es una mujer emprendedora y luchadora. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cremas, lápiz labiales y perfumes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member, Yovana, is devoted to her business of selling beauty products. She sells lipsticks, creams, and perfumes. With her business, she hopes to move forward. She is an entrepreneurial and determined woman.

She requests this loan to purchase creams, lipsticks, and perfumes. She is happy to have the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase creams, lipsticks, and perfumes.

loans.name: Erias

texts.en:
Erias is a twenty-nine-year-old hardworking man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in livestock raising along with the operation of a retail shop to earn extra income. He started this business to educate his children. He hopes to become a prominent businessman; however, his main challenge is inadequate capital. 

He is requesting a loan to buy more cows to raise.

loans.use: to buy more cows to raise.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El socio Juan se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de verduras, el socio quiere salir adelante por medio de este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de venta de verduras. El socio solicita el crédito para comprar tomates, cebollas y zapallos.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Juan continues with his vegetable business. He wants to get ahead with this business and it is going very well for him. His dream is to expand his vegetable business. He is requesting a loan to purchase tomatoes, onions, and pumpkins.
He is happy to have this loan and promises to repay his quotas.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, onions, and pumpkins.

loans.name: Wilberto

texts.es:
Wilberto, utilizo el préstamo anterior en comprar insumos agrícolas para realizar los cultivos de granos básicos, su situación económica ha mejorado un poco y ha iniciado a vender fruta de temporada. Su familia cuenta con una vida más confortable.
Opta por un nuevo préstamo para compra abono, fertilizantes, semilla y algunos repuestos para la motocicleta, continuara trabajando en el campo y cancelara su nueva deuda.
texts.en:
Wilberto  used the previous loan to buy agricultural materials to grow basic grains. His financial situation has improved little by little and he has started to sell fruit in season. His family has a more comfortable life.

He has decided to take out a new loan to buy compost, fertilizer, seeds and some motorcycle replacement parts. He will continue working in the fields and he will pay off his new debt.

loans.use: to buy compost, fertilizer, seeds and some motorcycle replacement parts to continue working in the fields.

loans.name: Mirna Esperanza

texts.es:
Mirna, utilizo el préstamo anterior para mejorar la venta de ropa usada, usada y otros productos de uso personal, tiene más clientes satisfechos y mantiene ingresos estables para dar a su familia un nivel de vida más cómodo.
Está época de fin de año las demandas crecen por lo que Mirna solicita un nuevo crédito con el que comprara pantalones, camisas, vestidos, ropa para niños/as entre otras prendas de vestir, de esta manera sacara el mayor provecho de la inversión.
texts.en:
Mirna used her previous loan to improve her sales of used clothing and other personal products. She has many satisfied clients and maintains a stable income to give her family a more comfortable standard of living.
This season means increased demand, so Mirna is requesting a new loan to buy pants, shirts, dresses, children's clothing, and other clothing items. This way, she will get the greatest benefit from her investment.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, dresses, children's clothing and other garments.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is a 36-year-old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of 3 children. Her husband has been running a general store for the past two years. He is the only one responsible for fulfilling the needs of his entire family. 

He wants to purchase different kinds of commodities, such as rice, sugar, tea bags, milk and other consumer items for his business. However, due to financial constraints he is not in a suitable position to buy all of the above products for reselling purposes. 

Therefore, Shazia has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy all these commodities which will help him earn the maximum profitable income to manage his household and business. 

Shazia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's business.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida is a 39-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband owns a depot in which he sells the Holy Quran. The depot is situated near a mosque where children learn and recite the Quran. He offers the Holy Quran to various companies and translated versions also.

He wants to grow his business and wants to buy more Holy Quran books to offer for sale, but does not have a sufficient amount of money to purchase them.

Therefore, Zahida requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy the Holy Quran and easily increase his income. 

She is very glad after taking this loan and gives praise for the lenders who are taking an active part in supporting her.

loans.use: to enhance in her husband's holy book (Quran) sale business.

loans.name: Agnes' Group

texts.en:
Agnes is 39 years old, has 4 children, and lives in Kogola A village in Ndhiwa, Kenya. Agnes works as a commercial farmer for a living. Her community of Kogola A village does not have access to clean water. The water that is used for drinking and cooking is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases. Agnes is a friendly member of the community, and has been elected promoter by her community members to help them obtain safe water.

As a volunteer promoter, Agnes represents the community on Kiva’s website and educates the community on how to protect their families from unsafe drinking water by using a chlorine dispenser. Agnes and 3 other promoters in her community, Rose, Loce and Jared, need a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. Agnes wants to be a promoter because she believes that the chlorine will to prevent water-borne diseases.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. Revenues from the sale of carbon credits to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprints will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Agnes’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To install and maintain chlorine dispensers to provide access to safe drinking water for the community

loans.name: Thomas' Group

texts.en:
In Itongo Central village in Kuria East, Kenya, Thomas has volunteered to be the promoter for a new chlorine dispenser. Thomas is a friendly member of the community with 5 children. Thomas lives with his family in a house with mud walls, a dirt floor and an iron roof.

Itongo Central village does not have a piped water supply, so the community collects their drinking water from Muhutundu spring. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause water-borne diseases. Chlorine dispensers offer a solution to this problem by allowing people to treat their drinking water to make it safe to drink. Thomas’s community using the local water source need a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. 

Thomas has volunteered to be the promoter to encourage the community to use the dispenser and to refill it with chlorine when the tank runs low. Thomas volunteered to be the promoter because through the use of chlorine dispenser the community members will be able to lead a healthy life because chlorine kills bacteria in water. There are also 3 other volunteer promoters from the surrounding community who are part of this group loan: Charles, Joseph, and Margret.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. Revenues from the sale of carbon credits to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprints will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Thomas’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To allow the community to treat their water to make it safe to drink using chlorine dispensers

loans.name: John's Group

texts.en:
John lives in a home with mud walls, a dirt floor and an iron roof in Gwitonyi Kugitimo village in Kuria East, Kenya with his family which includes 3 children. The community of Gwitonyi Kugitimo village collects their drinking water from a local well because there is no piped water supply in this part of rural Kenya. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases often making Gwitonyi Kugitimo’s inhabitants sick and unable to work or attend school.

A new chlorine dispenser program offers a solution to the burden of sickness caused by unsafe drinking water. The dispenser is installed at the local water source where users turn a valve to add chlorine to their jerricans and then collect water as usual. The chlorine disinfects the water and provides residual protection from re-contamination. Gwitonyi Kugitimo community will benefit from having access to the dispenser and safe water. John has volunteered to be the dispenser promoter who is responsible for refilling the chlorine and encouraging the rest of the community to treat their drinking water to keep themselves and their families healthy. There is another volunteer promoter from the surrounding community who is part of this group loan called Teresia.

Gwitonyi Kugitimo community needs a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining the dispenser. John believes that chroline kills germs and bacteria in water and make it safe to drink. The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. Revenues from the sale of carbon credits to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprints will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that John's community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To provide communities with free access to chlorine to treat their drinking water

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is the age of 30 years. She is a housewife and looks after her family consisting of six persons. She is well-trained in cloth stitching. She provides services of stitching to the people at her own house. 

She needs to purchase a sewing machine and a variety of stitching material for her stitching work, including threads, needles, cloth, etc. This is very important for her to continue her work efficiently and professionally. However, due to the lack of money, she finds it difficult. So Sajida is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan. BRAC Pakistan issued her a loan as per her requirement. 

Sajida is very thankful to Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to enhance her own stitching work with a sewing machine and a variety of stitching materials

loans.name: Everline's Group

texts.en:
Everline is 30 years old, has 3 children, and lives in Manyonyi village in Ndhiwa, Kenya. Manyonyi village does not have a piped water supply, so the community collects their water from a borehole. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases, meaning that Everline and her family may fall sick and become unable to work or attend school.

Everline is a business owner, but has also volunteered her time to be the promoter for a new chlorine dispenser program that enables her community to drink safe water and stay healthy. Everline and 3 other promoters in her community, Hellen, Mary, and John, need a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. Everline will encourage the community to treat their water with the dispenser and refill the dispenser with chlorine as needed. Everline wants to be a promoter because she believes that the chlorine will kill bacteria in water and make the water safe for drinking.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. Revenues from the sale of carbon credits to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprints will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Everline’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To ensure that the community has access to safe drinking water via chlorine dispensers

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase seeds and fungicides for their crops.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy materials to make fabrics.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
La socia Elsa se sigue dedicando a al negocio de restaurant, la socia realiza diferentes platos como pollo al horno, sopas y saltados de carne, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, verduras y pollo.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Elsa continues with her restaurant business. She makes various dishes such as roast chicken, soups, and meat dishes. She works from 8 am to 6 pm. She has had this business for 8 years and it is going very well for her. Her dream has always been to have a restaurant. 
She is requesting this loan for the purchase of products for cooking such as rice, vegetables, and chicken.
Elsa is happy about this loan and promises to repay her quotas.

loans.use: to buy cooking products such as rice, vegetables and chicken.

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.en:
Dilbar is a hardworking woman. She was born in 1969. She is from the northern part of Tajikistan. She lives in a village. She is married. She has three children. Her husband works as a constructor. 

She has a goal of being a good entrepreneur. She is one of the participants of “To Get Ahead” training. After doing well with the education in the training, she felt a responsibility to achieve her goal. She decided to open her own business. She wants to buy and sell women's clothes. As a retailer, she plans to have initial capital for starting a business, so Dilbar needs financial support to buy women's clothes for her business.

loans.use: to buy women's clothes for organizing a new business

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Marites works hard to support her family.

She has a buying and selling of fruits business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending.  Marites is borrowing 27,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fruits to sell for her fruit business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Marites has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fruits to sell

loans.name: Fabian Agustin

texts.es: Fabian Agustin, tiene la edad  de 23 años, está soltero, vive con sus hermanos y padres,  que es su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de unos novillos para el engorde y que tengan buenas características en el rápido desarrollo y ganancia de peso en un plazo adecuado para poderlos vender y comprar mas. La idea es aprovechar el espacio que tiene de pasto y las buenas condiciones de terreno y clima fresco que el varano faborece al mejor desarrollo y rendimiento del pasto para poder tener estos animales y desarrollar animales para en el futuro venderlos para carne. Con esta compra podrá desarrollar una actividad más, y a la vez tener un ahorro que le permitirá ir teniendo más animales e invertir más en la propiedad.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Fabian Agustin is twenty-three years old, is single, and lives with his siblings and parents. With this loan, he hopes to buy some steers/bull calves so that he may fatten them quickly, sell them, and then buy  more. He wants to take advantage of his pasture space as well as the good land conditions and fresh climate in these summer months; these conditions support the enhanced development and yield of his  pasture lands, which allow him to raise and fatten his animals so that he can later sell them for meat.

With the purchase of these steers, he will be able to contribute to his savings. In the future, he will be able to have more animals and to ultimately invest more in his property. 

This is Fabian's first loan with FUDECOSUR. He was not able to take out loans from state banks in the past, but FUDECOSUR has offered him a loan with greater ease and much lower interest rates.

loans.use: to buy steers.

loans.name: Kassim

texts.en:
Kassim is a 47-year-old hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in produce, alongside farming for additional income. He started this business so as to generate funds to meet family demands. He hopes to buy a business vehicle to ease his service delivery; however, his main challenge is the high transport costs that limit the level of profits realized. 

He is requesting a loan to buy more bags of coffee and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy more bags of coffee and beans to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Maribel De Jesus

texts.es:
Maribel, es propietaria de una tienda de productos de primera necesidad que está ubicada en su vivienda y una pupusería en el mercado de su localidad, la venta de pupusas está funcionando desde hace 11 años, mientras que la tienda la fundo hace 2 años, atiende a sus clientes de Lunes a Domingo, un riesgo es la delincuencia que existe en la zona.
Invertirá en aceite, granos básicos, quesillo, bebidas, boquitas, etc., para surtir la tienda y tener materia prima para la venta de pupusas, el resto lo utilizara para hacer pequeñas remodelaciones en su vivienda. Espera atender mejor a sus clientes y mejorar las circunstancias de vida.
Maribel anhela mejorar el inventario de la tienda, cancelar su deuda y tener un lugar más seguro en donde vivir.
texts.en:
Maribel is the owner of a basic needs grocery store located in her house. She also owns a papusa-making stand at the local market. She has been making and selling traditional papusas for eleven years, and she has had her grocery store for two years. She attends to her clients from Monday to Sunday. There is a lot of crime in the community where she lives, and this is a risk she takes in having her store open.

She will buy oil, basic grains, cheese, drinks, snacks, etc. to stock her store. These items will also be used as the main ingredients for her business making and selling papusas. A small portion of the loan will also be used for making small infrastructure updates to her home.  She hopes to provide better service to her customers and to also improve her living conditions.

Maribel aspires to increase her store inventory, settle her debt, and to have a safe space to live.

loans.use: to buy oil, basic grains, cheese, drinks, snacks, etc. to stock her store and so that she can make and sell her traditional papusas.

loans.name: Xenia Elizabeth

texts.es:
Xenia, es casada y tiene  un hijo de 21 años de edad, su negocio es atender un salón de belleza, trabaja de lunes a domingo, cuenta con muchos clientes, pues su negocio está ubicado en un lugar  muy estratégico y está funcionando desde hace 5 años, actualmente no representa ninguna dificultad en su negocio.
Con el préstamo podrá comprar tintes, tratamientos, labiales, tijeras, etc., para tener un inventario renovado que le sirva para atender mejor a sus clientes, espera recuperar la inversión con mayores ganancias que serán de mucha utilidad para cumplir con sus compromisos.
Las aspiraciones de la señora Xenia son aumentar la rentabilidad de su negocio y tener clientes satisfechos.
texts.en:
Xenia is married and has a son who is 21 years old. She runs a beauty salon and works from Mondays through Sundays. She has many customers because her business is located in a very strategic place. She has had this business for the past 5 year and does not currently have any challenges with her business. 

With this loan, she will be able to purchase hair dyes, treatments, lipsticks, scissors, etc. in order to refresh her inventory, which will allow her to better serve her customers. She hopes to recoup the investment with higher income, which will help her with her commitments. Xenia's goals include increasing her business's profitability and having satisfied customers.

loans.use: to purchase hair dyes, treatments, lipstick, scissors, etc. in order to update her inventory so that she can better serve her customers.

loans.name: Enefe

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Enefe works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Enefe is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business.

Enefe has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en:
Visitacion works hard to support her family. Visitacion is widowed and has a sewing business in the Philippines.

Visitacion requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more materials like fabric, needles, threads, etc., for her business.

Visitacion has been in this business for six years now.

Visitacion would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more materials like fabric, needles, threads, etc., for her business

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel is 34 years old and married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, noodles, eggs, etc.

Liezel has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, noodles, eggs, etc

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Helen works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Helen is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

Helen has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Las Divas Group

texts.es:
Está conformado por 4 mujeres emprendedoras (Dolía Elizabeth, Merylu Magdalena, Lesbia del Carmen y Estelvina de la Concepción), originarias de la ciudad de Bilwi, municipio de Puerto Cabezas, se unieron hace 2 meses con el propósito de trabajar de manera solidaria para poder acceder a préstamos en Pana Pana,  para tener la oportunidad de mejorar sus pequeños negocios de venta de ropa nueva y pulpería, mejorar sus ingresos y así mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias.

Merylu Magdalena: Es integrante del grupo solidario, tiene 28 años de edad, casada, tiene dos hijos: El mayor de 6 años de edad estudia su primer grado de primaria y un pequeño de 3 años de edad. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos, desde hace 5 años estableció una pequeña pulpería en el corredor de su vivienda construida de madera. Solicita su primer financiamiento para comprar más mercadería para su pulpería y poder tener más ingresos de la venta. Sueña con llegar a ser una comerciante próspera y exitosa.
texts.en:
This group is made up of 4 enterprising women (Dolía Elizabeth, Merylu Magdalena, Lesbia del Carmen y Estelvina de la Concepción), all natives of the city of Bilwi, in the municipality of Puerto Cabezas. They got together two months ago with the proposition of working together in order to access loans from Pana Pana. They want the opportunity to improve their small businesses selling new clothing and corner stores, increase their income, thus improving their quality of living of their families.

Merylu Magdalena is a member of this communal bank. She is 28 years old, married and has two children. The eldest is 6 years old and studies in Grade 1 and the youngest is 3 years old. With the goal of having her own source of income she opened a small store build out of wood, in the veranda of her house 5 years ago. She is requesting her first loan to buy more merchandise for her store and be able to have more income from sales. She dreams of becoming a successful and prosperous businessperson.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Armando De Jesus

texts.es:
Armando, está satisfecho con los resultados que ha tenido al invertir el préstamo anterior en su negocio de cultivo de granos básicos, pues no tuvo que comprar maíz en época de verano para alimentar a su familia y además ya tiene equipo para almacenarlo.
Está optando por un nuevo crédito para pagar los costos de recolección de cosecha y comprar un granero, contara con recursos económicos para desempeñar sus actividades e ir mejorando el inventario de su negocio.
texts.en:
Armando is satisfied with the results that he's had investing the previous loan in his business growing basic grains. He did not have to buy corn in the summer season to feed his family and, additionally, he already has equipment to store it.

He is opting for a new loan to pay for the harvest collection costs and to buy a granary. He will have economic resources to perform his activities and go improving the inventory of his business.

loans.use: to pay for harvest collection costs and to buy a granary.

loans.name: Jorge Eliecer

texts.es:
Jorge es un padre cabeza de familia oriundo de Medellín una zona de difícil competencia para su actividad de transporte de personas, este negocio tan valioso para el representa los ingresos de su hogar conformado por él y sus dos hijos de 7 y 5 años de edad que gracias a sus esfuerzos se encuentran estudiando y gozan de una digna alimentación.
Medellín es bien conocida por su sistema de movilidad Metro, pero es tanto el volumen de personas que transporta que a veces las filas para acceder algún servicio son muy largas y es eso lo que aprovecha gente creativa como Jorge que parquea su vehículo en lugares estratégicos y autorizados para transportar personas que acuden a esta alternativa de movilidad. 
Como Jorge tiene que asegurar siempre el bienestar de sus pasajeros solicita un crédito para realizar algunas reparaciones a su carro y seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Jorge is a father and is the head of the household. He is a native of Medellin, a zone with difficult competition for his business, which is transportation. For him, this valuable business is his household’s income, which is made up of him and his two children of ages 7 and 5. Thanks to his efforts, his children are studying and enjoy a decent diet.

Medellin is well known for its public transportation system, the Metro, but the number of people that it transports is so large that sometimes the lines to use the service are very long. Creative people like Jorge take advantage of this. Jorge parks his vehicle in strategic and authorized locations to transport people who turn to that alternative for transportation.

Since Jorge always needs to ensure the wellbeing of his passengers, he is requesting a loan to complete some repairs for his car and to continue working.

loans.use: to complete repairs for his vehicle, thinking of the wellbeing and safety of his passengers.

loans.name: Baby

texts.en:
Baby is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She lives with her one daughter and husband in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is the guardian of her family. He has been running a mobile shop for the past ten years. 

Baby's husband wants to purchase different types of mobile accessories for his business, but due to insufficient financial means he is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore, Baby has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. 

With the help of this loan her husband would be able to purchase relevant items for his business so that he can earn more income to manage his business and household.

Baby is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to enhance her husband's mobile shop.

loans.name: Nargis

texts.en:
Nargis is a housewife and a mother of 2 children. She requires funds to buy a new rickshaw for her husband. 

The family's income is generated through the transportation business and they barely make ends meet. Nargis's husband is the main earner in the family and generates all his income from driving the rickshaw. 

Unfortunately, the current rickshaw has completely broken down, halting the inflow of income. This has resulted in Nargis's children skipping school due to the lack of resources at their mother's disposal. 

Hence, Nargis wants a loan to help her husband buy a new rickshaw and start generating income once again, which would streamline all her activities and thus send her children back to school to get an education.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for her husband.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 49-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of five children. Her son sells garments in his community; he purchases garments from the market at a low price, then sells them at a higher price from the shop. The crowd in town likes his garment collection and selection a lot. The demand for clothing has increased due to attractive designs and colors. He can afford all the household expenses from his earnings and saves a portion for his savings, as well. 

He wants to increase the variety of clothing on a daily basis; this is the reason Nasreen has requested a loan, so that her son can buy more variety of garments to fulfill the demand. Nasreen wishes for the bright future of her children and her dream is to provide better education to her children. She is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to enhance her son's garment business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy empty crates and to increase her soft drinks stock.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
La socia Andrea se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de verduras, la socia quiere salir adelante por medio de este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de verduras. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar tomates, cebollas y zapallos.
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuot
texts.en:
Andrea continues her vegetable sales business. She would like to move forward with this business and it's going well for her. Her dream is to expand her vegetable sales business. 

She requests a loan to purchase tomatoes, onions, and squash. She is grateful for the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, onions, and squash.

loans.name: Amanecer De Huayna Potosi Group

texts.es:
Sonia es una mujer de 39 años de edad, soltera, tiene 2 hijas de 20 y 13 años, y su negocio es el tejido de mantas de Alpaca y Guanaco.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, alegre, optimista, feliz, de buena actitud, responsable y comprometida con su trabajo. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘villa ingenio’ un lugar caracterizado por el comercio en todas las áreas y por la tradicional feria que se realiza todos los jueves y domingos; donde se puede encontrar desde una aguja de coser hasta un tractor de arado, de clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 2-14 grados centígrados durante todo el año.
Sonia es de tez morena, cabello negro largo trenzado, baja estatura, su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español por cultura general (de pie al lado de la ventana, usa sombrero lila). Su vida la realiza con sus hijas, la mayor estudia en la universidad y la menor estudia en colegio, viven en una casa alquilada construida de adobe que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad, gas natural y alcantarillado.
