Sus deseos por generar mejores ingresos para ayudar a pagar los estudios de sus hijas la llevaron a liderar una banca de personas con actividades comerciales como; puesto de venta de comida, venta de chompas, venta de materiales de construcción tejido de ropa de bebe, venta de papas fritas, venta de ropa deportiva y tienda de barrio, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus negocios. Su negocio es el tejido de mantas de Alpaca y Guanaco, como el Aguayo; que es un tejido hilado a mano, y utilizado por las mujeres del Altiplano de Bolivia cada mujer tiene su propio aguayo. “mis tejidos son de lana de guanaco, alpaca, y algunas veces de oveja y tiño con colores naturales vivos…” comenta. Su sueño es que sus hijas sean profesionales. Ella desea generar mejores ingresos económicos mediante el tejido y venta de aguayos, para conseguirlo necesita realizar la compra de variedad de lana por mayor. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 4 años que viene realizando esta actividad de manera independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Sonia solicita un préstamo para la compra de variedad de lanas por mayor para tejer y con lo beneficios ayudar a pagar los gastos escolares de sus hijas.
texts.en:
Sonia is a 39 year old woman. she is single and has 2 daughters, aged 20 and 13. Her business is weaving blankets made from alpaca and guanaco. She is a good mother, enterprising, cheerful, optimist, happy, with a good attitude, responsible, and committed to her job. She has her business in the ‘Villa Ingenio’ area, a place characterized by commerce in all areas and by the traditional market on Thursdays and Sundays. There you can find everything from a sewing needle to a ploughing tractor. It has a cold and dry climate with a temperature that varies between 2-14 degrees celsius during the whole year.  

Sonia has dark skin, long, black, braided hair, and her mother tongue is Aymará. She speaks Spanish for the general culture. She is standing next to the window, with a light purple hat. She lives her life with her daughters. The oldest goes to college and the youngest is in high school. They live in a rented house built of adobe. It has potable water, electricity, natural gas and plumbing. She wants to generate better income to help pay for her daughters' education. She leads a bank of people with commercial activities such as a food stall, selling sweaters, selling construction materials knitting children's clothes, selling french fries, selling sports clothing, and a neighborhood store. They are asking for a loan to improve their businesses. Her business is selling woven blankets made from alpaca and guanaco, such as aguayo, which is a hand woven fabric used by the women of the Bolivian highlands. Each woman has her own aguayo. “My weavings are made from the wool from guanaco, alpaca, and sometimes sheep, with natural, vivid colors,” she says. Her dream is for her daughters to graduate from college. She wants to generate better income through her weaving and selling of aguayos. To do that, she needs to buy a variety of wool wholesale. This is her first loan cycle with the institution in 4 years that she has been doing this activity independently. 

These are the reasons that Sonia is asking for a loan to buy a variety of wool wholesale to weave so that with the profits she can help pay for her daughters' education.

loans.use: to buy a variety of wool wholesale to knit with and with the profits, help pay for her daughters' education.

loans.name: Anor

texts.en:
Anor is 54 years old. She is married and has 4 children. Since childhood Anor has been busy with feeding cows because her parents were farmers and she helped her parents. 

Now she has had her own business in animal husbandry for more than 20 years. Anor feeds both cows and sheep. She has 20 sheep and some cows. 

She sells sheep in a local market and has regular customers, thanks to the good condition of her sheep. Anor plans to increase the number of sheep she feeds. 

She is asking for a loan of 14,000 Somoni to buy sheep. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy sheep.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
La señora Gladys es una mujer de 36 años de edad, soltera, tiene dos hijos de las edades de 10 y 6 años y su negocio es la producción de queso artesanal.
Ella es independiente, constante, responsable, optimista y Su negocio lo realiza en la comunidad de ‘Huarina’ es una comunidad indígena, situada en la zona altiplánica en sus orígenes fue una hacienda, adoptó este nombre porque, por el lugar de la comunidad existía una carretera, donde transitaban los viajeros y mercaderes con carrozas de Caballo del lado Peruano y trasladarse a la ciudad de La Paz
Gladys es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello negro largo trenzado, su forma de vestir es tradicional (manta, sombrero y pollera) su lengua materna es el aymará que utiliza en el pueblo, para el comercio habla español. Su vida la comparte con sus hijos que estudia en la escuela, viven en una casa de adobe que tiene electricidad. Su negocio es la producción de queso artesanal, y resumiendo el proceso que sigue es; con la leche de vaca que obtiene una parte a la mañana y otra a la tarde le agrega  el cuajo que se elabora extrayendo una parte de la ubre de la vaca, ésta comienza a hacerse parecida al yogurt, la mezcla con un cucharón de madera, luego se asienta, formándose la cuajada: la retira y la pone en otro recipiente para la maduración. Su sueño es mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y desea incrementar su producción quesera mediante la compra de ganado lechero para generar mejores ingresos a fin de año. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 15 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Gladys solicita un préstamo para la compra de ganado vacuno para incrementar su producción de queso para fin de año.
texts.en:
Gladys is a 36-year-old woman. She is single with two children ages 6 and 10. She makes artesanal cheese.
She is independent, constant, responsible, and optimistic. She runs her business in the Huarina community. This is an indigenous community located in the altiplano zone. It was originally farmland and adopted its name because there was a road through the community used by travellers and merchants with horse carts who would travel from Peru to the city of La Paz.
Gladys is dark-skinned and short with long black hair pulled back. She dresses traditionally (shawl, hat, and full skirt). Her mother tongue is Aymara, which she speaks in the village. For commerce she speaks Spanish. She shares her life with her children, who are in school. They live in an adobe home which has electricity. Her business is the production of artesanal cheese. To summarize the process: with cows' milk which she obtains partially in the morning and partially in the afternoon, she gets the curdling agent which is extracted from part of the udder. This starts to look like yogourt. She mixes it in wood and it settles, forming curds. She takes this out and puts it in another receptacle for maturation.
Gladys' dream is to improve her family's quality of life, and she wants to increase her cheese production by buying dairy cows to generate a better income in the new year. This is her first loan sequence with the institution in the fifteen years she has had this business.
For these reasons Gladys is requesting a loan to purchase dairy cows to increase her cheese production for the new year.

loans.use: to buy cattle to increase cheese production.

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
La socia Justina se sigue dedicando al negocio de restaurant, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante, la socia hace paltos como pollo al horno, sopas entre otros, el sueño de la socia es ampliar su negocio de venta de comida. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar verduras, pollo y carne.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Justina continues working in her restaurant. She wants to get ahead through this business. 
She makes dishes such as baked chicken and soups. Her dream is to expand her business. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of vegetables, chicken, and beef. 
Justina is happy to have this loan and promises to repay her quotas.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, chicken, and beef.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is the age of 52, and she is the mother of eight children. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For many days his rickshaw has not been working properly, and as a result he is unable to generate any amount of income. 

He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. Therefore, Razia has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to help her husband cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. 

This will help him to continue his business. Razia is very thankful to Kiva and Brac Pakistan.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Dúo Trabajadoras De Sumpango Group

texts.es: Dúo Trabajadoras de Sumpango Este dúo está conformado por María Luisa ella es originaria de Sumpango es casada y madres de familia se dedica a la preparación de comida típica y a la venta de refacciones es el primer crédito que solicita con kiva ya que necesita de capital ya que gracias Dios en esta temporada las ventas aumentan y es de aprovechar lograr preparar mas platillos típicos para  poder obtener más ganancias y así lograr darles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.desde ya les agradece por su ayuda brindada
texts.en:
The Trabajadoras de Sumpango Duo
This duo includes María Luisa, She is from Sumpando, married, and has children. She makes traditional food and snacks. This is her first loan on Kiva and she needs capital because, thanks to God, in this season sales increase and she needs to take advantage of this and prepare more food to obtain more income. This way, she will be able to give her family a greater quality of life. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy food for making traditional food to sell.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is 29 years old, married, and has two children. In order to supplement her spouse's income, she put up a store selling grocery items to the people in her village. 

Mary Grace wants to increase her merchandise but she has insufficient funds. So, she is now asking for additional capital amounting to P7,000 to buy canned goods, bread, eggs, soft drinks and biscuits to sell. She hopes to keep selling good products and earning profits to help cover her family's daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, bread, eggs, soft drinks and biscuits to sell

loans.name: Pulatkhon

texts.en:
Pulatkhon is a businesswoman. She was born in 1972. She lives in a village. She is from the northern part of Tajikistan. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a constructor. She has had a business for almost twenty years. Her business is keeping cattle. She started her business with a couple of cattle.

 Now she has about 20 cattle and 10 other heads of livestock. She feeds her livestock and sells them in the market. Every year she tries to have the best stock of cattle. She wants to get more revenue from her activity. She needs financial support to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy cattle to enlarge her business

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn is 28 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Jovelyn has a tricycle passenger business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy spare parts for her tricycle.

Jovelyn has been in this business for two years. In the future, Jovelyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her tricycle.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 44 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Elsa is borrowing 13,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Elsa has been farming rice for 10 years and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Maw Bi Village Group 2

texts.en:
Located in Mawbi Village in Myanmar Ayeyarwaddy Delta region, this community consists of 33 village customers (10 male, 23 female) , which includes five CBO (Community Based Organization) members, leading the loans in certain areas.

This loan will help Mawbi Group 2 purchase good quality feed ($22 for a sack, 5 days feed for 100 ducks) and as well to rebuild the whole duck farms (cost $100) that need to be changed out every three years. Some village customers will only change the stage of the duck farm (cost $15).

The villagers mostly are farmers and also raise ducks, pigs, and hens as livestock. The housewives mostly run a small grocery store at home. Fishing isn’t very widespread in the village.

In the above picture are the five CBO members from Mawbi Group 2, named Daw Aye, Daw The, Daw Zin, Daw Khin and U Tine. Daw Aye, the CBO member, isn’t taking out a loan; instead she will be helping the group to get the loan. 

Included in the picture, Daw Khin (second from left) is 33 years old. She is married with two children and her husband is a farmer. As for livestock, she has 100 ducks, 10 pigs and cows to raise in her farm. She thinks, 100 ducks are sufficient for the moment and so, with the loan, she will rebuild the duck farm and buy high quality feed.

loans.use: to  purchase high quality feed for ducks and rebuild their duck farms.

loans.name: Jose Alexis

texts.es: Jose Alexis, tiene la edad  de 38 años, está soltero, vive con sus hijos los cuales son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de unos terneros para el engorde y que tengan buenas características en el rápido desarrollo y ganancia de peso. La idea es aprovechar el espacio que tiene de pasto  y tambien  las buenas condiciones de terreno, agua potable y clima para poder tener estos animales y desarrollar terneros para en el futuro venderlos para carne. Con esta compra podrá desarrollar una actividad más, y a la vez tener un ahorro que le permitirá ir teniendo más animales e invertir más en la propiedad.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Jose Alexis is 38, single, and lives with his children, who are his greatest priority. With his loan he will purchase several calves to fatten. He will buy animals that will grow rapidly and gain weight. The idea is to take advantage of the pasture space he has, and of the good conditions of the land, drinking water, and climate. He will raise the calves to later be sold for meat.
This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR. He has not had previous loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR offered him the loan with greater ease and much lower interest rates.

loans.use: to buy calves.

location.town: Calle Mora Arriba de Río Nuevo

loans.name: Sheila Rose

texts.en:
Sheila Rose is 41 years old and married with two children, who are both in school.

Sheila Rose works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 40,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She has borrowed and paid back 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Sheila Rose aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more crates of beer and  sodas to sell.

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es:
Juan, pide ayuda a los inversionistas Kiva a través de un nuevo préstamo para comprar tierra, arena, leña y repuestos para bicicletas usadas, podrá elaborar la venta de ladrillos y tener bicicletas usadas a la venta en mejor estado para atraer nuevos clientes.
Con la buena administración del préstamo anterior ha mantenido su negocio de ladrillera, venta de bicicletas usadas y mariscos en el mercado, con los nuevos ingresos cubre necesidades de su hogar y paga sus deudas.
texts.en:
Juan is asking for the help of Kiva lenders with a new loan to purchase dirt, sand, firewood, and spare parts for used bikes. He will be able to expand his brick sales and have used bikes in the best condition to sell and attract new clients.
Because of his good use of his previous loan, he has maintained his brick business, bike sales, and shellfish sales. With this new income he covers his household expenses and repays his debts.

loans.use: to buy dirt, sand, firewood and spare parts for bikes.

loans.name: Ana Beti

texts.es:
Ana de 68 años de edad, está casada y tiene tres hijos de 50, 47 y 45 años de edad, estudio solo hasta 1er grado de educación básica debido a la poca capacidad económica que tenía su familia en ese tiempo, su esposo se dedica a la ganadería y a la agricultura, solo él vive con ella.

Ana es comerciante tiene más de 20 años de administrar una tienda en la que vende productos de la cocina (arroz, frijoles, azúcar, etc.) aprendió por iniciativa propia ya que de pequeña su madre su madre la mandaba a vender y desde entonces le gusto el comercio de productos; la tienda la tiene en su casa, no tiene otra actividad económica y cuando está muy ocupada le apoya su esposo. Su horario de atención es de 6:00 am a 6:00 pm.

Solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería para su tienda, en esta temporada es cuando por lo general aumenta la venta de condimentos, granos básicos y otros productos por los diversos platillos navideños que se preparan y quiere abastecer su tienda para no quedar mal con sus clientes. Ana espera mantener siempre fuerte su negocio, ya que es su principal fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Ana is sixty-eight years old, is married, and has three children (ages 50, 47 and 45). She only studied through the first grade of elementary school due to her family's lack of economic resources. Her husband makes a living in livestock and agriculture. Only Ana and her husband still live together.

Ana is a tradeswoman. For more than 20 years, she has managed her store where she sells kitchen and cooking products (rice, beans, sugar, etc.). She desired to have this type of business because her mother had a store like this when she was young, and so Ana has always liked to sell grocery products. The grocery store is located in her house. She doesn't have another means of income. Her husband helps her in the store when she is extremely busy. She attends to her customers from 6am to 6pm every day.

Ana is requesting this loan to buy merchandise to stock her grocery store. At this time of year, she sees an increased demand for the seasonings, basic grains, and other products needed to make the different types of traditional Christmas dishes. She therefore wants to properly stock her store so that her customers do not get upset. 

Ana hopes to always maintain her store, since it is her principle means of income.

loans.use: to buy seasonings, basic grains, and other products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair her husband's taxi

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy items for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Erick Joel

texts.es:
Erick, con ayuda del préstamo anterior tuvo a su alcance los materiales necesarios para cultivar granos maíz y pipían, se ha mantenido su estabilidad económica, su familia goza de buena salud y ya tiene un miembro nuevo.
Desea seguir trabajando en la tierra y progresando para tener un mejor futuro junto a su familia, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para comprar fertilizantes, abono, herbicidas y semilla mejorada de pipían, podrá dar un mejor trato a sus cultivos y tendrá mayor producción para abastecer a su familia y a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Erick, with help from a previous loan, was able to obtain the necessary materials he needed for his maize and pipían (type of squash) crops. He has been able to maintain his economic stability. His family is in good health, and they are enjoying their newest family member.

He hopes to continue working the land and improving so that he can have a better life together with his family. He is requesting a new loan to buy fertilizers, manure, herbicide, and improved squash seeds so that can better care for his crops. This will allow him to ultimately increase his production capacity and to provide for both his family and his customers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure, herbicide and improved pipían seeds so that he can better take care of his crops.

loans.name: Dúo Mariposa Monarca Group

texts.es:
Dúo Mariposa Monarca
Doña Miriam de 33 años de edad, empezó su negocio hace  cuatro años. 
Invirtiendo q.500.00 vendiendo pañales de bebe cremas y así fue como fue creciendo su negocio hasta llegar a tener una tiendita, su mayor anhelo es poder algún día tener un deposito grande con la ayuda de dios y de su familia que la apoya mucho, agradece a dios y a su esposo por el apoyo que le han dado,en esta oportunidad ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de productos comestibles para la venta.
texts.en:
The Dúo Mariposa Monarca
Miriam is 33 years old. She started her business 4 years ago when she invested 500 GTQ buying diapers and baby creams and her business has been growing. Now she has a small store. Her main wish is to one day be able to have a large store with the help of God and her family who help her a lot. She is grateful to God and to her husband for the help they have given her. At this time she is requesting a loan to by food products to sell.

loans.use: to buy food products for sale.

loans.name: Amelia Veronica

texts.es: Amelia es una persona con espíritu de superación es por eso que cursa el tercer año de Enfermería los días sábados. Escogió esta carrera porque le llena de satisfacción ayudar a las personas que más lo necesitan. Aparte de estudiar se dedica a la venta de cosméticos para obtener ingresos y suplir los gastos de sus estudios y su pequeño hijo.  Solicita el crédito para comprar una computadora y realizar los trabajos asignados en su universidad y documentarse mejor. Su plan futuro es graduarse con honores en su carrera. Su meta próxima es hacer una maestría acorde a su carrera.
texts.en:
Amelia is a person with a lot of desire to better herself. She is currently in her third year of her Nursing degree; she takes her classes on Saturdays. She selected this career path because she likes to serve people that most need her help. Aside from studying, she also dedicates herself to selling cosmetics so that she can earn an income and cover expenses for both her studies and her young son.

She is requesting this loan so that she can buy a computer and thereby complete her university work assignments. Her future plan is to graduate with honors and to then go on to earn a Master's degree in Nursing.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Deo

texts.en:
Deo is a well-known fishmonger at Kagere, Kazinga by the lake shores. He started this business in 2009 and he has managed to sustain his family of four children aged 21, 19, 15 and 13 years old. He is married to one wife and he has also involved himself in commercial houses, saloon and he has rentals, all these projects help him to generate incomes. Deo is aged 42 years old, and all his children are schooling. 

Deo has borrowed a loan of UGX 3,000,000 (three million shillings) to buy fishing nets. He  works very hard so that he can get out of the poverty trap and sells his fish to fish traders. He is faced with the challenge of stiff competition and his hope for the future is to be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy fishing nets

loans.name: Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Parveen is a 39-year-old married woman and the mother of six children who all go to school. She is taking a loan for her husband’s tailoring business, which he currently conducts at home. He provides the services of stitching clothing for his customers. He is very expert in his profession and people like his stitched clothes a lot. 

Due to the increase in population there is not enough space at home to further continue his tailoring business. This is the reason he decided to open a new shop in the market so that he can enhance his business. 

Therefore, Parveen requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can rent a shop to continue his business.

She hopes that now her husband can easily increase the number of customers and easily move his business towards progress.

Parveen is very glad after receiving this loan and very thankful to both Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to rent a shop for her husband's tailoring work.

loans.name: Nhóm 1 - Lưu Phương 01 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Bong, pictured first from the left, is 57 years old and has been a member of the Women's Union since 1998. Her family works in the agriculture sector, earning about VND 600,000 per capita monthly ($28). 

Her husband is unable to work due to a severe illness; therefore her family has experienced economic hardship for years. 

The family's latrine has been degraded seriously. With this loan, she will have a sanitary toilet installed in her home, which will improve her family's hygiene and health, and contribute to the sanitation improvement in her community.

loans.use: To pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine with a device with soap for hand-washing.

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar is the age of 45 and she is the mother of three children. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a housewife and looks after her family at home.

Her husband works in dairy products like milk, curd and butter to sell. He owns a small dairy farm which consists of buffaloes and cows. He sells milk daily to different tea stalls. He is an honest man. He manages his household necessities from his earnings from milk sales.  He speaks with a monotonous tone which is impressive and he easily wins the trust of his clients.

He was in need of one buffalo to increase his income through his milk sale business, so Kousar demanded a loan. In this way she can support her husband's business.

She thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to enhance her husband's milk sale business

loans.name: Nhóm 2 - Lưu Phương 01 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tien, pictured first from the left, is 58 years old. She works in agricultural production with a monthly income of about VND 600,000 ($28). She lives with her husband and two children who are attending school. Due to the harsh working environment, Mrs.Tien and her husband get sick frequently. Currently, the toilet in their home has been damaged severely. 

With this loan, Tien will use the funds to build a septic tank to improve living conditions and the health of family members and contribute to environmental protection.

loans.use: To pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine with a device for hand-washing with soap

loans.name: Pheap

texts.en:
Pheap is a married man who lives in a small community of Battambang Province. He has only one child who is currently in school. To make a living and support his family, he manages and operates a rice farming business in farmland that is located near his house. He has been involved with this business since 2000. His is able to earn a daily income of USD 10.00, on average.

Pheap wants to have household energy at a reduced monthly cost by purchasing a solar energy home system. Because there is inadequate money, he has requested a Kiva loan through its partner HKL. After this initial investment, he hopes to have clean energy to power his household lights, TV and radio. He is very happy and thankful because with this loan, HKL has provided him a special interest rate lower than its general loan rates. He awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to pay for a solar energy home system

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.en:
Shahnoza is a cheerful woman. She was born in 1990. She is from the northern part of Tajikistan. She lives in a rural area. She is married. She has two children. Her husband is an entrepreneur. 

For about five years, she has been sewing dresses. Shahnoza is a businesswoman. She makes a business sewing national dresses for women. Shahnoza wants to enlarge her business. She needs to buy additional materials and tools for sewing. She is asking for financial support. She is planning to spend money for making her business better.

loans.use: to buy additional materials and tools for sewing

loans.name: Villa Alegre Group

texts.es:
Elena es una mujer de 24 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo de 5 años y su negocio es la venta de cosméticos.
Ella es buena madre, generosa, amable, independiente, activa, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla de forma ambulante en la zona ‘Sur’ de la ciudad, un área caracterizada por el creciente comercio en todas las áreas en especial la manufactura, de clima cálido, tropical y húmedo, con una temperatura ambiente que varía entre 21-35 grados centígrados durante el día y todo el año.
Elena es de tez trigueña, cabello castaño, ojos obscuros, baja estatura, su lengua materna es el Guaraní y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza (sentada al centro). Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica al comercio y con su hijo que esta por entrar a su 1 año en la escuela, viven en una casa alquilada que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Su deseo por mejorar su negocio para incrementar sus ingresos para costear los gastos escolares de inicios de la escuela de su hijo la hicieron liderar una banca de personas con actividades comerciales como; carnicería,  venta de sándwiches, 
Artesanía en yeso, venta de refrescos, librería, venta de ropa, venta de fruta y venta de tomates, para solicitar un préstamo y ampliar sus negocios. Su negocio es la venta de cosméticos; productos para mejorar la apariencia, especialmente del rostro, su comercio es de forma ambulante, ella se encarga de visitar (cargada de un bolsón y muchas revistas) las comunidades y poblaciones cercanas para ofrecer sus productos a tiendas, oficinas, etc., de marcas como; Yanbal, Avon, Natura y otros, y productos como; mascaras faciales, bases, lápiz corrector, brillos para los ojos, sombras, tonos, labiales rojos, etc. “ la venta de cosméticos es sacrificada por las distancias que se debe recorrer para encontrar  a los clientes…” comenta. Su sueño es tener una tienda de cosméticos. Ella desea aumentar su stock de productos para ofertar mayor variedad a sus clientes. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Elena solicita un préstamo para la compra de variedad de cosméticos para ofertar a sus clientes de temporada.
texts.en:
Elena is a 24 year old woman. She lives with her spouse and has a 5 year old son. Her business is selling cosmetics.  

She is a good mother, generous, kind, independent, active, responsible and hardworking. She carries out her business as a street vendor in the southern part of the city. It is an area characterized by by the growing commerce in all areas, especially manufacturing. lt has a warm, tropical and humid climate with an ambient temperature that varies between 21-35 degrees celsius during the day all year long. 

Elena has light brown skin, brown hair, dark eyes, and short stature. Her mother tongue is Guaraní  and she speaks Spanish for the general culture and for her business, which is located in the center of town. She shares her life with her spouse and with her son who is about to start his first year of school. They live in a rented house which has potable water, electricity and plumbing. Her wish to improve her business to increase her income to pay for her sons education expenses was what got her chosen to lead a bank of people with commercial activities such as butchering and selling sandwiches, plaster crafts, selling beverages, selling books, selling fruit and selling tomatoes. They are asking for a loan to expand their businesses. Her business is selling cosmetics. These are products to improve appearance, especially of the face. She sells as a street vendor, and visits nearby communities and towns (carrying her bag and a lot of magazines) to offer her products to stores, offices, etc. She sells brands such as Yanbal, Avon, Natura and more. She sells products such as facial masks, bases, concealers, eyeshadows, eyeliners, red lipsticks, etc. "Selling cosmetics is hard work because of the distances necessary to travel to find the customers," she says. Her dream is to have a cosmetics store. She wants to increase her stock of products to offer more variety to her customers. This is her first loan cycle in the institution in the year she has been doing this activity.  

It is for these reasons that Elena is asking for a loan to buy a variety of cosmetics to offer her customers for the season.

loans.use: to buy a variety of cosmetics to offer her customers for the season.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa works hard to support her family. Elsa is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Elsa requested a 29,500 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like shampoo, soft drinks, coffee, canned goods, spices, etc.

Elsa has been in this business for 30 years now.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Elsa would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like shampoo, soft drinks, coffee, canned goods, spices, etc.

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en:
Dinah is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice and pig fattening. Dinah is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF to buy additional utensils and ingredients for her food business.

Dinah has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF, and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional utensils and ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Zenna

texts.en:
Zenna is single and has a room rental business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 6 years now.

Zenna requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy materials like wood, nails, paint, etc. for her business.

In the future, Zenna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials like wood, nails, paint, etc. for her business

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Carmen works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending and pig fattening. Carmen is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell for her general store business.

Carmen has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Emily works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buy and sell charcoal and buy and sell nipa roofing. Emily is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Emily has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college and save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
María, tiene una propiedad que muchas personas utilizan como parqueo y por lo cual cancelan cierta cantidad, además tiene una venta de productos de primera necesidad, vive con una hija quien es mayor de edad, ella tienen en total tres hijos, algunos le ayudan en ocasiones a trabajar o económicamente, trabaja de tres de la mañana a siete de la noche, en sus inicios solamente ofrecía el servicio de parqueo en su propiedad posteriormente tuvo la iniciativa de abrir una tienda para tener más ingresos y salir adelante con su familia, le apoya su hermano para atender a los clientes en las primeras horas del día.
El préstamo le servirá para comprar bebidas, boquitas, granos básicos, jabón, especias, etc., con la inversión tendrá más mercadería para generar ingresos, los cuales utilizara para ser puntual en el pago de su deuda y seguir cubriendo las necesidades de su familia. Espera tener nuevos clientes y satisfacer sus necesidades.
Su aspiración es comprar el local en el que actualmente tiene  ubicada la tienda y mejorar la situación financiera.
texts.en:
María has a property that many people pay to use to park. She also sells basic staples. She lives with an adult daughter and has a total of three children. Some of her children sometimes help her economically or with her work. She works from 3 am to 7 pm. In the beginning she only offered the parking service but later she took the initiative to open a store in order to have more income for her family. Her brother helps her to tend to the customers in the first hours of the day.
Maria will use this loan to purchase drinks, finger foods, basic staples, soap, spices, etc. She will have more merchandise to generate an income, which she will use to repay her debt punctually and to support her family. She hopes to have new clients and to satisfy their demand.
Maria's goal is to buy the space where she currently has her store, and to improve her financial situation.

loans.use: to buy drinks, sandwiches, basic staples, soap, spices, etc.

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en:
Musarat is a 55-year-old woman, living with her eleven children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her son has been driving an auto rickshaw for many years. It has been depreciating with the passage of time. He sold his old rickshaw and wants to buy a new rickshaw. 

He belongs to an ultra-poor family and his income has been feeding his children. Now his children are growing older, as are their needs. 

Musarat has been making savings for many days to buy a new auto rickshaw for her son, but at the time of purchasing her money was not enough. 

Therefore, Musarat has requested a loan for her son so that, with the contribution of her savings, he can buy a new rickshaw.
 
She hopes that now her son will be able to generate more income. She is very happy after taking this loan. She thanks Kiva and its field partner, Brac Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for her son.

loans.name: Amtul

texts.en:
Amtul is 34 years old and living in a populated area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is a housewife and a mother of four children. 

Her husband does tailoring work in Lahore. He gets orders for making different types of products, like bags, purses, covers for different items, etc. He is hardworking and his clients are happy with the end product that he makes.
 
However, he is the sole earner in the family, and his income being low, he manages his expenses with difficultly. Recently he got an order for making leather bags but he is short of funds to buy raw material, like leather, to make them.

Amtul has therefore applied for a loan from Brac Pakistan to help her husband. They are pleased with the loan and dream to give their children a higher education.

loans.use: to help her husband buy leather pieces for his school bags stitching work.

loans.name: Nhóm 3 -  Lưu Phương 01 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hoa, pictured second from the left, has no land to cultivate and works as a handicraft woman with a monthly income of about VND500,000 ($24). Her family is listed as a poor household. She has two young children, one of whom is in kindergarten. She has been an active member of the local Women's Union since 2011. 

With this loan, Hoa will be able to build a sanitary latrine that will improve her family's health and quality of life by helping them avoid diseases and infections commonly associated with unsafe latrines.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine with a device for hand-washing with soap

loans.name: Nhóm 4 - Lưu Phương 01 Group

texts.en: Mrs. Ha, pictured first on the right, is 42 years old. She works in agricultural production and earns a monthly income of about VND 600,000 ($28). Her husband does not have a stable job and her children are still in school. Her household does not currently have a hygienic toilet. Ha is requesting a loan to install a hygienic toilet to improve their living conditions, and contribute to the sanitary improvement of the entire community.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine with a device for hand-washing with soap

loans.name: Dúo Luz De San Lorenzo Group

texts.es: Dúo Luz de San Lorenzo está integrado por doña Gabina de 44 años quien posee una pequeña tienda hace mas de 7 años donde vende productos de granos básicos (frijol, sopas, gaseosas, jabón. Etc.) y también se dedica a la distribución de gaseosas en algunas tiendas de san Lorenzo ya que ella compra todo por mayor y luego lo distribuye y esto le genera mayor ingreso, ella solicita su crédito para comprar granos básicos (frijol, arroz, queso, sopas instantáneas, jabón, azúcar, gaseosas. etc.) ya que es una buena temporada donde sus clientes la visitan con mas frecuencias y solicitas mas sus productos y necesita surtir mas su negocio para que ellos vean que tiene todo lo que sus  clientes le solicitan, su meta a corto plazo es poder tener un deposito de gaseosas y poder distribuirlos a las tiendas de su comunidad ya que actualmente lo hace pero desea ampliarlo más y con esto darles un mejor futuro a sus hijas y mejor educación.
texts.en:
Sabina, 44, belongs to Luz de San Lorenzo Duo.  For more than seven years she has had a small store where she sells basic staples (beans, soup, soda, soap, etc.).  She also distributes soda to some stores in San Lorenzo.  She buys everything wholesale, then distributes it, which earns more income for her.

She requested her loan to buy staples (beans, rice, cheese, instant soup, soap, sugar, soda, etc.).  It's a good time of year, when her customers visit her more frequently to request more of her products.  She needs to stock her store so they see that she has everything they're requesting.

Sabina's short-term goal is to have a warehouse to distribute to stores in her community.  Currently she does that, but she wants to expand so she can give her children a better future and a better education.

loans.use: to buy food products to sell

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Lorna works hard to support her family. She has a clothing sales business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  Lorna is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to buy more clothing to sell to customers.

Lorna has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca, from Kosachi Self Help Group in Kapsowar, applauds the initiative for transforming her life*. She is a loving mum to three angel-looking children and has been farming for the past 10 years. Her primary sources of income have been milk, eggs, maize, crops and some small business ventures that help her make ends meet. Rebecca is very passionate about farming and loves cultivating her farm. That is why, every day, she wakes up very early to go to her farm to plow. 

Although she makes profits from farming, she is not comfortable and has always wanted to increase her income by selling cereals. That is why she is seeking this loan to buy cereals. Kenya's Kapsowar area, one of the county's populated regions, has a high demand for cereals. This means that Rebecca could increase her income and satisfy the demand that is there. 

Accessing funds has been a challenge for Rebecca, but she now feels relieved because Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva lenders to help aspiring women farmers like her turn their farming dreams into reality through training and loan financing. Rebecca believes that this loan will be of much help, and that she will be able to satisfy the demand for cereals. She also believes that the extra income she earns will enable a permanent change in her life and increase her business. Increased profits will allow Rebecca to repay this loan and secure the future of her school-going age children.

All that Rebecca awaits is your kindness

* For years rural women have lived poor lives due to disinheritance, patriarchal systems and lack of mentors. In addition, in some parts of Kenya like Kapsowar, more women were rendered poor by the clashes that followed disputed presidential elections of 2007. Their men were killed and property destroyed leaving women who were once financially stable, and even of middle income bracket, vulnerable to poverty. Years later, Juhudi Kilimo, a micro finance institution that concentrates on small holder farmers, came to their rescue, training marginalized women from rural areas on how to do agriculture better, advertise and sell their farm produce directly to the market.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Shahida's family is poor. She lives with her spouse and five children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.
 
Her husband is a blacksmith. He manufactures the iron accessories for doors and windows in houses. A few days ago his welding plant overheated and needs to be replaced with a new one. He wants to buy a new welding plant but does not have the cash in hand due to lot of household expenses.  Therefore, Shahida requested a loan from BRAC, who is an active field partner of Kiva, so that her husband would be able to buy welding a plant and raw material for manufacturing.
  
Shahida thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new welding plant and raw material for manufacturing.

loans.name: Fernanda

texts.en:
An 800 USD loan is offered to Fernanda to improve her business. She has a kiosk and she is selling in the market so many people come to buy. She will use this loan to buy some additional supplies to add with her goods such as slippers, hair ties, bags, belt sides, scissors and other things to sell. Fernanda has been involving herself in business activities since 2012 with her own working capital of 450 USD. She feels so comfortable to run her business because she can earn a good income. She hopes to run a bigger store in the future, so she has one idea to take a loan from Tuba Rai Metin. 

Fernanda also cultivates animals like buffalo, cows, pigs, goats and chickens.

loans.use: To buy slippers, hair ties, bags, belt sides, scissors and other things to sell.

loans.name: Saroern's Group

texts.en: Saroern’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Saroern makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as a tailor to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Dora Eleticia

texts.es:
Dora de 29 años de edad estudio hasta 6° grado de educación básica, está acompañada y tiene dos hijas de 9 y 3 años de edad solo la mayor estudia 2nd grado. Su pareja es agricultor y solo él y sus hijas viven con ella.

Dora es comerciante, tiene un negocio en el que vende pupusas y cuenta con tres años de experiencia, su madre le enseño este trabajo ya que ella se dedicaba a lo mismo y tomó  a bien poner en práctica lo aprendido. No tiene otra actividad económica, el puesto de venta lo tiene afuera de su casa, le paga a una hermana para que la ayude todos los días y atiende de 2:00 pm a 9:00 pm.

Solicita el préstamo para remodelar el local donde realiza las ventas, está deteriorado y quiere reconstruirlo para que sus clientes se sientan más cómodos cuando degusten su producto. Dora espera le resulte la inversión para beneficio de su familia.

Los sueños que tiene es poder crecer siempre en las ventas y con eso tener mejores ingresos, con lo que les dará una mejor estabilidad para sus hijos. Las ganancias serán invertidas en el pago de la cuota y ampliar el negocio.
texts.en:
Dora, 29, left school after the 6th grade.  She is partnered and has two daughters, 9- and 3-years old.  Her oldest daughter is in the second grade.  Her partner is a farmer.  The family live together.  

Dora has made a living making and selling pupusas for three years.  She learned the business from her mother who had a similar business.  She took to it and has used what she learned from her mother to make her own living.  The business is her only source of income.  She operates the business from just outside her house and pays her sister to help her.  She normally works from 2:00pm to 9:00pm.  

Dora is applying for a loan that she will use to remodel the space that she uses for the business.  It's falling apart now and she wants to rebuild it so her customers have a comfortable place to enjoy her pupusas.  

Dora hopes the investment will lead to more sales and, in turn, more income for supporting her family.  She will use the extra income to repay the loan and expand the business.

loans.use: to remodel her business space.

loans.name: Fareeda

texts.en:
Fareeda’s husband has been driving an auto rickshaw and pays a daily rent because this rickshaw does not belong to him. He is part of an ultra poor family and has been feeding his children. Now his children are growing older and their needs have increased. He has been worried for many days about how to avoid paying the daily rent and has decided to buy his own rickshaw.

Fareeda has been saving for many days to buy a new auto rickshaw for her husband, but at the time of purchasing she did not have enough money. 

Therefore, Fareeda has requested a loan so that her husband can buy a new rickshaw with the contribution of savings. Fareeda is a 30-year-old woman, living with her two children and her spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She hopes that now her husband will be able to generate more income because now he will not pay daily rent to anyone. She is very happy after receiving this loan. She thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for her husband

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es:
José de 29 años de edad, acompañado y tiene dos hijos de 12 y 9 años de edad, ambos asisten a la escuela, él estudió hasta bachillerato, su pareja es ama de casa y solo ella y sus hijos viven con él.

José es carpintero desde que tenía 12 años, oficio que aprendió de su padre que siempre se dedicó a elaborar cajas fúnebres en la comunidad y José trabaja como empleado en este oficio, pero en su casa tiene un taller de carpintería donde elabora todo tipo de muebles y le apoya su padre. Su horario de trabajo es de 7:00 am a 4:00 pm elaborando cajas fúnebres y de 4:00 pm a 7:00 pm en su taller.

Solicita el préstamo para comprar la madera que necesitan para elaborar dos camas y una juguetera que les han pedido y quieren cumplir con la demanda de esta época que es bastante buena. Sueña con independizarse y trabajar el mismo con la elaboración de caja, ya conoce el negocio y sabe que da muy buenos resultados.
texts.en:
José is 29 years old, in a relationship and has two children aged 12 and 9 who both attend school. He studied until he finished high school. His partner is a housewife and only her and his children live with him.

José has been a carpenter since he was 12 years old. He learned from his father who has always made funeral caskets in the community and José works as an employee in this business. In their house they have a carpentry workshop where he makes all kinds of furniture and José helps his father. His timetable is from 7am to 4pm making caskets and from 4pm until 7 pm in the shop.

He is requesting this loan to buy wood that he needs to make two beds and a toy that have been ordered from him and he wants to fill the order at this time which is fairly good. He dreams of becoming independent and working at the same time making caskets as he knows the business and knows that he can produce good results.

loans.use: to buy wood.

loans.name: Nhóm 6 - Lưu Phương 01 Group

texts.en:
Tuyet, pictured first from the left, is a 30-year-old farmer who earns about VND 600,000 monthly. Her husband died years ago and left her with a small child who is still in school. She has been a member of the local Women's Union since 2012. Her family does not have a hygienic toilet.  

With this loan, Tuyet will install a toilet that will help to improve the quality of life for her family and the community, and avoid the diseases and infections commonly associated with unsanitary toilets.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine with a device for hand-washing with soap.

loans.name: Nhóm 7 - Lưu Phương 01 Group

texts.en: Mrs. Thoa, pictured first from the left, is a 30-year-old mother with a child currently in school. As the bread winner in the family, Thoa supports her child and a husband who suffers birth defects with a monthly income of 600,000 VND from her farm work. She has been a member of the Women's Union since 2010. With this 8 million VND loan, she will build a hygienic toilet that will help to improve her family's hygiene and health and contribute to sanitary improvement in her community.

loans.use: To pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine with a device for hand-washing with soap

loans.name: Celso

texts.es:
Celso es un hombre de 54 años de edad, casado, tiene un hijo de 14 años, y su actividad es la tapicería.
Él es una persona, responsable y trabajadora. Su trabajo lo realiza en la localidad de Sacaba, un área rural caracterizada por el comercio agrícola por mayor, transportan sus productos hasta el lugar para que sean adquiridos por comerciantes mayoristas para distribuirlos en ferias, mercados y supermercados por ser un lugar transitado es que tiene mucho trabajo ya que de el es arreglar los asientos de los autos los forra con cuerina, embellece los autos por dentro y es una actividda que le gusta mucho porque aprendio de sus pade quien era tambien tapicero, Sacaba es de clima templado durante todo el año pero no tiene agua y la poblacion busca alternativas para bastecerse de este elemento. 
Celso es de tez morena, cabello negro corto, estatura mediana, ojos obscuros, su lengua materna es Quechua que se habla en el lugar, y habla español por cultura general y por el trabajo que realiza. Vive con su esposa y su hijo  en una casa en construcción, hecha de ladrillo, que cuenta con electricidad. Una vez a la semana pasa por el lugar el camión cisterna que vende agua por litros, los pobladores del lugar la compran algunos en sus tanques de agua otros en bidones y botellas, el problema frecuente es perder al camión cisterna y quedarse sin agua por 1 semana hasta que retorne la siguiente semana. Su sueño es ver terminada la construcción de su casa. Él desea realizar la instalación de agua potable en la cocina, el baño y la lavandería para dejar de comprar agua en bidón al camión cisterna. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución 
Es por esos motivos que Celso solicita un préstamo para la instalación de agua en su cocina, baño y lavandería para dejar de comprar agua en bidón al camión cisterna.
texts.en:
Celso, 54, is married and has a son, 14.  He's a responsible and hardworking person. He works in an upholstery shop in the town of Sacaba, a rural area known for wholesale agricultural commerce.  Products are transported there for purchase by wholesale vendors to sell at street fairs and in markets and supermarkets.

It's a well-traveled area so Celso has a lot of work fixing seats: He upholsters them with faux leather and decorates the cars inside.  He likes the work a lot because he learned from his father, who was also an upholsterer.

Celso is dark and of medium build and has short black hair and dark eyes.  His native language is Quechua, which is spoken in the area, and he speaks Spanish through general knowledge and for work.  He lives with his wife and his son in a brick house that's under construction and has electricity.

Sacaba has a temperate climate year-round, but there's no water, so the residents look for alternatives to supply themselves with that element.  Once a week the water-tank truck that sells water by the liter passes through town.  The residents buy some water for their tanks and some water in drums and bottles.  A frequent problem is missing the truck and being without water until the truck returns the following week.

Celso wants to install running water in the kitchen, bathroom, and laundry.  That's why he's requesting a loan to install water so he doesn't have to buy water in drums from the water-tank truck.

His dream is to finish construction on his house.

loans.use: to install water in his kitchen, bathroom, and laundry

loans.name: Marío Dagoberto

texts.es:
Mario es empleado y trabaja en la alcaldía de su municipio desde hace más de 10 años se desempeña en un cargo administrativo, todos los días camina cerca de 500 metros desde su casa para llegar a su trabajo y labora de 8:00 am a 4:00 pm. 

Solicita el préstamo para comprar arena, cemento y pagar mano de obra para hacer unas reparaciones a su casa y mejorar su condición de vida, Sueña con que Dios le preste vida para seguir trabajando para mantenerse y  que cuando ya no pueda sus hijos se acuerden y velen por él.
texts.en:
Mario has worked for the city for more than 10 years.  He has an administrative job there.  Every day, he walks the 500 meters from his house to his job.  His normal hours are 8:00am to 4:00pm.

Mario is applying for a loan that he will use to buy materials--sand, cement, etc.--and pay workers to make repairs to his house.  He hopes that God will allow him to continue working so that he can support himself and that his children will help him when he can no longer work.

loans.use: to buy materials and pay for labor to make repairs to his house.

loans.name: Alegre Group

texts.es:
Está conformado por  cuatro mujeres luchadoras (Medolina, Isolda, Sonia y Eteldina) que se organizaron hace 6 meses, con el propósito de acceder a financiamiento para mejorar sus condiciones de vida, poder cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hogar, asegurar la educación de sus hijos y ampliar sus negocios.

Isolda: Es integrante del grupo solidario, es una mujer alegre, originaria de Waspam Rio Coco, llegó a vivir a Bilwi en el período que evacuaron a toda la población del Río Coco en los años 80. Tiene 32 años de edad, es casada, tiene cinco hijos: tres adolescentes que estudian su secundaria y un pequeño de 3 años de edad. Su esposo trabaja como buzo en los barcos pesqueros. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos, desde hace 3 años estableció su pequeña pulpería, en el corredor de su vivienda construida  de madera. Está solicitando financiamiento para comprar mercadería para su pulpería, lo que le permitirá vender más y generar más ingresos. Ella sueña con tener un negocio grande y próspero.
texts.en:
This group is made up of 4 determined women (Medolina, Isolda, Sonia y Eteldina) who got together 6 months ago with the purpose of accessing loans to improve their living conditions, pay for the basic needs of their households, assure the education of their children and expand their businesses.

Isolda is one member of this communal bank. She is a native of Waspam, Rio Coco and came to live in Bilwi in the period in the 80's when all the residents of Río Coco were evacuated. She is 32 years old, married and has 5 children. Three are adolescents who study in Secondary school and the youngest is 3 years old. Her husband works as a diver on fishing boats.

With the goal of having her own source of income she opened a corner store on the veranda of her house made out of wood. She is requesting this loan to buy merchandise for her store which will allow her to sell more and generate more income. She dreams of having a large and prosperous business.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, toilet paper, snacks, soft drinks, pasta, toothpaste, amongst other products.

loans.name: Nhen's Group

texts.en: Nhen’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Nhen makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Len's Group

texts.en:
Len’s Group lives in a rural village in Battambang province, in Cambodia. Len works as farmer to support his family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean, drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these men and women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Djiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe DJIGUISSEME ont en moyenne 40 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à MEDINE l’un des quartiers de SAN/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des habits, des produits divers et des boissons.
Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe DJIGUISSEME sont à leur 5ème prêt solidaire. AWA, 1ère femme assise à droite sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 10 complets de prêt à porter pour les enfants, 10 chemises, 5 robes et 3 pièces de Wax. Elle s’approvisionne sur place chez les grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 25 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en: The women of the DJIGUISSEME group are on average 40 years old, have five children, and all live in enlarged traditional families in MEDINE, one of the neighborhoods in SAN/SEGOU (fourth administrative region of the republic of Mali). These women met each other through relatives and buy and sell clothing, diverse products, and beverages. After having properly repaid their preceding loans, the women of the DJIGUISSEME group are on their fifth group loan. AWA, the woman sitting on the far right in the photo, plans to use her loan to buy 10 ready-to-wear children's outfits, 10 shirts, 5 dresses, and 3 pieces of Wax (a type of pagne cloth). She stocks up locally at wholesalers. She makes her sales to a clientele composed of women and men for cash and often for credit. She foresees earning an average monthly profit of 25,000 FCFA, which will be used towards expenses related to health, food, clothing, and schooling, with the rest reinvested into her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Nona

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Nona works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from pig-fattening. Nona is borrowing PHP 12,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy more groceries to sell through her general store business.

Nona has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Daulnara's Group

texts.en: Daulnara’s group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Daulnara works as a farmer to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these men to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Nhóm 8 - Lưu Phương 01 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Cu, 51, is a farmer who earns about VND 350,000 monthly. With an extremely low income and a sick husband to support, her family is listed as a poor family in the community. The family does not have a hygienic latrine. 

 A portion of Group 8 - Luu Phuong 01's loan will help Cu as well as other group members to build a septic tank and a hand-washing device with soap. This will not only help to improve the living conditions and health of the community, but also contribute to environmental protection. In the picture Mrs. Cu is the first person from the left.

loans.use: To pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine with a device for hand-washing with soap

loans.name: Domingo Porfirio

texts.es: Don Domingo nació en una comunidad llamada el sardinal en el año de 1956, El toda la juventud lo vivió con su madre y padre, pero que actualmente ya no viven sus padres pero los recuerda mucho. Don Domingo no pudo estudiar comenta que para esos tiempos era bastante difícil estudiar, recuerda que para los tiempos de guerra él se escondía y tenía que dormir en el campo fuera de la casa ya que llegaban a reclutar a los jóvenes de noche a las casas pero que una de esas veces lo agarraron y tubo que cumplir en esos tiempos de guerra, don Domingo le da gracias a Dios que no le paso nada ya que esos tiempos eran bastante difíciles el recuerda que tuvo que sacar a muchos compañeros heridos y a veces sin vida, luego que termino o salió de la guerra se dedicó a sembrar café en un área que le dejo el padre antes de morir y otra parte de tierra que el compro. el corta su café con su familia y también comenta que como Dios le da fuerzas para trabajar el también se va a cortar café con la familia a fincas cercanas. él dice que la vida es difícil pero con la ayuda de Dios todo sale bien y pidiéndole de corazón las cosas, Don Domingo pudo hacer su casa con bastante esfuerzo y se siente bien con su familia. en la comunidad no hay luz eléctrica es por eso que solicita un préstamo para la compra de un sistema solar y este sistemas si le dan el préstamo lo instalara en la casa de habitación ya que será de gran beneficio para toda la familia ya que una hija está en clase y ya se podrá alumbrar por las noches para hacer las tareas además comenta que es un bien de gran uso y provecho que llegara al hogar, el estaría muy agradecido si le brindan la oportunidad de este préstamo para la compra de este sistema solar.
texts.en:
Don Domingo was born in a community known as El Sardinal in 1956. During the whole of his childhood he lived with his mother and father, who are no longer living, although he thinks about them often. 

Don Domingo was not able to study as a child. He says that during that time it was quite difficult to study. He remembers that during the war in Nicaragua he had to hide himself and sleep in the fields outside his house, because during the night people would come to recruit young men from their houses. On one occaision they caught him and he had to go along with them. Don Domingo thanks God that nothing bad happened to him during those difficult times but he remembers having to help injured and, at times, lifeless comrades. 

Later, after the war had finished, he began to earn a living growing coffee on some land that his father had left him before he died, as well as on another piece of land that he bought. He harvests the coffee with his family. He also says that, as God gives him the strength to work, he and his family help to harvest coffee crops on neighbouring farms too. 

Domingo says that life is difficult but with the help of God everything turns out all right. Don Domingo was able to build his house with a lot of effort and he feels good with his family. In his community there aren't electric lights, and so he is asking for a loan in order to buy a solar energy system. If he receives the loan, he will install the system in his home and it will be of great benefit to all of his family, especially as his daughter is a student and so needs to have light at night in order to do her work. He adds that he would be very grateful to be given the opportunity to buy a solar energy system.

loans.use: to buy a solar energy system.

loans.name: Nhóm 11 - Lưu Phương 01 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Quy, 58, has been an active member of her local Women's Union since 1996. Her family's monthly income mainly comes from agricultural production with the total amount of about VND 700,000.  She has bad health and gets sick frequently. Her household does not have a hygienic toilet. 

With this VND 8 million loan, she will have a hygienic toilet installed in her home. This will improve the health or her family members and contribute to environmental protection. In the picture, she is the first person from the left.

loans.use: To pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine with a device for hand-washing with soap

loans.name: Ines

texts.es:
Ines  es separada  tiene dos hijos, viven en casa de su ex pareja, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Villa Bautista Saavedra de la ciudad de El Alto.
Ella estudio hasta el nivel primaria y se dedica a la eventa de sombreros  de tela  y mimbre para señora y niñas.
El crédito lo requiere para incrementar el numero de sombreros que vende para poder tener buenos ingresos aprovechando la epoca navideña, Ines tiene mucha fe en este credito y ha probado ser una persona bastante responsable en anteriores prestamos, po lo que agradece la ayuda recibida y la que puedan darle ahora Ines ha estado recibiendo ayuda de su madre pero ahora quiere que su madre descanse
texts.en:
Ines is separated and has two children.  They live in her husband's house in the Villa Bautista Saavedra neighborhood of El Alto.
Ines left school early.  She has her own business now, making and selling sombreros.  The hats are made of cloth and wicker and she makes them for both men and women.  
Ines needs a loan to increase her production.  She wants to make the most of the holiday season.  She is confident that she can repay the loan and has proven in the past to be a reliable borrower.  She is grateful for your past loans and for this one too.
Ines has had help from her mother in the past but she wants her mother to take a break now.

loans.use: to grow her sombrero business.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is 32 years old and has six children. She is married, and three of her children are currently in school.

Estrella is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Estrella has been in this business for ten years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Sajida's Group

texts.en:
Sajida, aged 36, is a married woman and mother of three children. 

Sajida's husband has been running a small toys shop in his community. He offers a variety of toy items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who often shop at his store. Mostly children are attracted to his shop; they insist that their parents buy toys. 

To fully stock his shop, Sajida requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, which her husband will use to buy more toys to sell. In this way he would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. 

Sajida wishes to use part of her revenue to increase her business capital. She thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more toys to sell to enhance her husband's toys sale business.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Marites works hard to support her family.

She has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising livestock. Marites is borrowing PHP 22,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy more stocks of charcoal to sell.

Marites has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Nhóm 9 - Lưu Phương 01 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Cuc, 53, works with her husband in agricultural production. They earn a monthly income of VND 600,000. She has been a member of the local Women's Union since 1992. Cuc is a member of Nhom 9 - Lu'u Phuong 01 Group.

With this VND 8,000,000 loan, she will have a hygienic latrine installed in her home. This addition will improve the quality of life for her family and will help her family and the community avoid diseases and infections commonly associated with unsanitary toilets. 

In the picture, she is the first person from the left.

loans.use: To pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine with a device for hand-washing with soap

loans.name: Nhóm 1 - Kim Định 01 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Dung, 52, works in agricultural production with a monthly income of about VND 600,000. She has been a member of the Women's Union since 1983. She is married with two grown children and one younger child who is still in school. Her husband has bad health and gets sick frequently. 

Dung's family does not have a sanitary toilet. With this loan, they will be able to install one to help improve their health and quality of life by preventing diseases commonly associated with unhygienic toilets. In the picture, she stands in the top row, first from the right.

loans.use: To pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine with a device for hand-washing with soap

loans.name: Dúo Kairos Group

texts.es:
Dúo Kairos
Integrado por las señora LEDY 
Quien es propietaria de una sala de belleza desde ya hace 19 años  y la cual tiene a cargo una hija aun. En esta ocasión ella toca las puertas de  FAPE para la adquisición de un crédito para su negocio ya que por la época hay una demanda bastante grande de clientes que desean hacerse cambios en su personalidad  y ella tiene el deseo de invertir en mercadería y equipo nuevo para su Salon de Belleza por lo que agradece que se le tome en cuenta dicha solicitud
texts.en:
Dúo Kairos
Our member, LEDY, has operated a beauty salon for 19 years.  She has one daughter still living at home.  She is applying to FAPE for a business loan.  Her customers, she says, want whole new personas this time of year and come to her salon to get the changes they hope for.  She will use part of the loan to buy new salon equipment and the rest to buy merchandise for resale.

loans.use: to buy salon equipment and other supplies.

loans.name: Dúo Fe En Cristo Group

texts.es: Dúo Fe en Cristo Doña Gloria consuelo de 48 años de edad empezó su negocio hace ocho años vendiendo comida  invirtiendo, q.100 vendiéndoles a sus vecinos y luego  a una fábrica. Su mayor anhelo es que su negocio crezca cada día mas agradece a dios  y sus hijos por la ayuda que le han dado, en esta oportunidad ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de productos comestibles para la elaboracion de comidas para la venta.
texts.en:
Dúo Fe en Cristo 
Doña Gloria Consuelo, 48, started her food business 8 years ago.  Her customers are her neighbors and her greatest wish is to see the business grow.  She is grateful, she says, to God and her children for the support she has received.  She is applying for a loan that she will use to buy supplies for making the food that she sells.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her food business.

loans.name: Ignacia

texts.es:
En una comunidad pequeña pero muy agradable viven Doña Ignacia y Don Pedro, ellos están casados desde hace 35 años, ambos son mayores de edad; juntos formaron una familia con 11 hijos de los cuales dos aún dependen de dicha pareja ya que todavía se encuentran estudiando la preparatoria. Además, también se hacen cargo de dos nietas, una estudia la preparatoria y la más pequeña, la primaria.  

Hace 35 años Don Pedro heredó la tienda de su padre y Doña Ignacia se ha dedicado a atenderla para que prospere; ha hecho un muy buen trabajo porque ahora demás de tienda de abarrotes ha acondicionado una sección para vender productos de papelería. 

La pareja se ha acercado a VisionFund y KIVA para solicitar un préstamo el cual será utilizado para a completar el pago de un taxi que están por adquirir, ellos han ahorrado un poco de dinero pero les hace falta una parte. Don Pedro quiere comprar otro auto aparte del que ya tiene para que darle empleo a su hijo. Don Pedro tiene 2 años trabajando como taxista, cambió el trabajo del campo por el volante “Las ganancias que se obtienen de la venta de maíz ya no son muy buenas y de alguna manera yo necesitaba buscar algún ingreso extra para solventar los gastos de los estudios de mis hijas y nietas” comentó Don Pedro. Por el momento, también necesitan conseguir los permisos adecuados para ofrecer su servicio de taxi.

De esta manera, la pareja sigue trabajando en equipo, su sueño es poder hacer crecer sus negocios la tarea de Don Pedro es conseguir placas y permiso de ambos taxis y la de Doña Ignacia, incrementar las ganancias de su tienda de abarrotes para seguir solventando los gastos de educación de sus hijos y nietas. "Queremos verlos realizados profesionalmente para que no sufran lo que nosotros estamos careciendo por no estudiar” comentó Ignacia.

*En la fotografía aparecen Don Pedro, Ignacia y el taxi.
texts.en:
