Ignacia and Pedro live in a small but pleasant community.  They have been married for 35 years; both are older.  They have a family of 11 children, two of whom are still dependent because they're still in high school.  Two grandchildren are also dependent on them; one in high school and the other in elementary school.

Pedro inherited a store from his father 35 years ago, and Ignacia has worked to tend to it so it will prosper.  She has done a very good job because now she has added a section to sell paper products in addition to groceries.

The couple turned to VisionFund and Kiva to request a loan to finish paying for a taxi they're about to acquire.  They have saved a little money but they're lacking some.  Pedro wants to buy another car besides his current one so he can employ his son.  Pedro has been working as a taxi driver for two years.  He changed from agricultural work to the wheel: "The earnings from selling corn are not very good, and I needed some way to find additional income to pay for my children's and grandchildrens' school expenses," he said.  At the moment he also needs to get the necessary permits for providing taxi service.

This way, the couple keeps on working as a team.  Their dream is to be able to make their businesses grow.  Pedro's task is to get plates and permits for both taxis; Ignacia's, to increase her profits in the grocery store to keep on paying for their children's and granddaughters' educational expenses.  "We want them to have professional achievements so they don't lack what we did for not having attended school," Ignacia said.

Pedro, Ignacia, and the taxi appear in the photograph.

loans.use: to pay for a taxi

location.town: San Juan Cote, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: María De La Paz

texts.es:
María, de 54 años de edad, estudió hasta primer año de bachillerato, es madre soltera de 5 hijos, dos de ellos se encuentran viviendo en los Estados Unidos y con ella están los otros tres hijos, una trabaja en el mercado vendiendo ropa, el otro trabaja vendiendo pan de manera informal y el otro sufre de problemas mentales, también vive con ella una nieta.

María, se dedica a la venta de especias como canela, pimienta, cominos, orégano, cebada etc. este oficio lo aprendió a la edad de 21 años, cuando trabajaba para otra persona, pasaron dos años para que María, decidiera elaborar las especies de forma independiente. 

El producto lo vende de forma ambulante, en los diferentes caseríos y cantones cercanos, trabaja duro de sol a sol, caminando bajo el sol ardiente y exponiéndose a los diferentes peligros de lo sociedad.

El préstamo que está solicitando es para comprar especias y prepararlas para poder venderlas y así iniciar el año 2015 con una buena cantidad de especias.

María, sueña con hacer un pozo en su casa, para no tener que ir a traer el agua donde su vecino, que es el que proporciona el agua a todos aquellos que necesitan de este vital líquido. A la vez, sueña con tener mejores ingresos para mejorar su casa y brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos, para que se desarrollen, estudien y logren ser profesionales de éxito.
texts.en:
María, 54, studied up to the first year of high school.  She's the single mother of five children.  Two of her children are living in the United States and the three others are with her; one of them sells clothing in the market, another sells bread in the informal sector, and the other one suffers from mental problems.  A granddaughter also lives with her. 

María earns a living selling cinnamon, pepper, cumin, oregano, barley, and other spices.  She learned this trade at the age of 21 when she was working for someone else.  Two years went by and María decided to make the spices on her own.

She sells the product as a street vendor in various nearby communities and cantons.  She works hard every day, walking in the burning sun and exposing herself to the various dangers of society.

The loan she's requesting is to buy spices to prepare for sale so she can start 2015 with a good quantity of spices.

María dreams of having a well at home so she doesn't have to carry water from her neighbor, who provides water to everyone who needs that vital liquid.  She also dreams of having more income to improve her house and give her children a better quality of life so they grow up, go to school, and manage to become successful professionals.

loans.use: to buy spices to prepare so she can sell them

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Clarita is 54 years old, and one of her children is still in school.

Clarita has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for ten years. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients such as meat, fish, vegetables, spices, etc. for her food production business.

Clarita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as meat, fish, vegetables, spices, etc. for her food production business.

loans.name: Rosa Aminta

texts.es:
Rosa, de 37 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos, su hijo se dedica a trabajar en una hacienda ganadera cercana a la comunidad y la su hija va a la escuela.

Rosa, se dedica a los oficios del hogar, sin embargo tiene un camión con el cual realiza viajes a los vecinos, satisfaciendo necesidades como lo son transporte de animales, materiales y equipo agrícola, personas entre otras. 

El préstamo que está solicitado es para hacer un establo para crianza de cerdos, en el patio de su casa y así obtener ingresos extras que mejoren su calidad de vida.

El Sueño de Rosa, es ayudar a sus hijos para que estudien, se superen y sean personas de bien, con familias sólidas en donde reine la armonía y el amor.
texts.en:
Rosa is 37 years old and went to school until middle school. She is a single mother and has two children. Her son works at a livestock ranch near the community, and her daughter attends school.

Rosa tends to the housework, but she also has a truck that she uses to make trips for the neighbors, fulfilling needs such as the transportation of animals, supplies, farming equipment, and people.

She is requesting this loan to construct a barn to raise pigs in her house's courtyard, so she can obtain extra income that will improve her quality of life.

Rosa's dream is to help her children study, rise above, and be good people with strong families, where harmony and love reign.

loans.use: to build a barn to raise her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair her husband's taxi

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 52 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school.

Betty works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell.

Betty has borrowed and repaid 25 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 25 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Betty aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Santos Isaias

texts.es:
Santos, mantiene sus actividades de ganadería y cultivo de granos básicos, para mejorar la economía familiar, con la ayuda del préstamo anterior ha mejorado mucho su negocio.
Está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para comprar una vaca parida, así aumentara la producción de leche y lácteos para comercializarlos entre sus clientes, pretende continuar su buen desarrollo económico.
texts.en: Santos is keeping up with his business of raising livestock and growing basic grains to improve the family economy. With the last loan he improved his business a lot. He is requesting a new loan to buy a pregnant cow and thus increase his production of milk and dairy products to sell to his clients. He wants to continue with his good economic development.

loans.use: to buy a pregnant cow and increase his production of milk and dairy products to sell to his clients.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Lorna works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Lorna is borrowing PHP 16,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy ingredients for her food business.

Lorna has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is a 55 year old, married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Norma has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 30 years. Norma requested a PHP 19,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy new supplies for her sewing machine.

 In the future, Norma would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy new supplies for her sewing machine.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
San Miguel de los Bancos más conocido como Cantón del amor lleno de gente amable y trabajadora, es un lugar muy turístico, por las diversas cascadas y hosterías y el maravilloso clima, aquí encontramos la cascada del amor al cual se puede llegar muy rápido por el teleférico que tienen en este Cantón. 
En este Cantón vive y tiene el negocio el señor Juan un hombre luchador de 27 años mantiene una sólida relación en unión libre de la cual tienen 2 hijas la mayor de 8 años y la ultima de 3 meses, la esposa no trabaja le ayuda en el negocio, ellos se dedican al servicio de alquiler de bicicletas y al mantenimiento de las mismas, aprendió de esta actividad junto con su padre ya que el se dedicaba a este negocio, al mismo le dedica un promedio de 8 horas diarias, también en la noches se dedica a la venta de comidas rápidas.
Solicita este crédito para invertir en el negocio de las bicicletas en la compra de repuestos para dar mantenimiento, con esta nueva inversión podrá mejorar sus servicios y atraer más clientela esto ayudará a incrementar sus ingresos económicos, el señor Juan agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por el apoyo y la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en:
San Miguel de los Bancos, better known as the Hamlet of love, is full of friendly and hardworking people. It is a tourist attraction for its many waterfalls, inns and marvelous climate. It is here that you can take a cable car up to the waterfall of love. 

Juan, a hardworking man of 27 years old, lives and works in this Hamlet. He has a strong relationship in a civil union, in which they have two daughters. The oldest is 8 years old and the youngest 3 months. His wife does not work, but helps him with his business. 

They make a living renting bicycles and providing for their maintenance. Juan learned the business from working alongside his father. He works an average of 8 hours a day, as well as at night when he delivers fast food. 

He asks for this loan to invest in his bicycle business by buying spare parts for maintenance. With this new loan he can improve his services and attract more clients, which will help him increase his economic revenues. Juan thanks the Fundación Alternativa and Kiva for the help and opportunity this affords him.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to maintain the bicycles

loans.name: Dúo Eva Group

texts.es: Dúo Eva, representado por doña Griselda de 57 años de edad,es viuda, ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos por catalogo, tambien doña Griselda se dedica a la venta de comida y la sazón que tiene es lo que le ayuda a tener muchos clientes vende los jueves paches, los sábados tamales, y también cocina para eventos desde hace 13 años cuando se vio en la necesidad ya que avía fallecido su esposo, está feliz pues con eso ella puede defenderse y no depender de sus hijos, su sueño es tener un ahorro para poder así mantenerse cuando ya no pueda trabajar como lo está haciendo ahora, su compañera doña Elba se dedica a la venta de pastas de lunes a jueves, los viernes y sábado vende flores en el mercado municipal,  su sueño es poder darle educación a sus hijos  y ayudar a su esposo, este credito para la compra de insumos para la elaboracion de tamales para la venta.
texts.en:
Griselda, 57, represents Dúo Eva.  She's a widow who earns a living making catalogue sales of cosmetics.  She also sells food, and her seasoning is what helps her have a lot of customers.  On Thursday she sells "paches" [a Guatemalan dish like a tamal made of potato dough] and on Saturday, tamales.  She also has cooked for events for 13 years, when she needed to work because her husband had died.

She's happy because she's able to manage with this and not depend on her children.  Her dream is to have savings to support herself when she can no longer work like she is now.

Her colleague Elba earns a living selling pasta from Monday through Thursday; on Friday and Saturday she sells flowers in the town market.  Her dream is to be able to give her children an education and to help her husband.

This loan is to buy ingredients to make tamales to sell.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make tamales to sell

loans.name: Dúo Eclipce Group

texts.es:
Duo Eclipse
Ana es casada tiene 39 años de edad, tuvo diez hijos de los cuales 4 viven con ella y asisten a la escuela de su comunidad, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas desde hace cinco años, cuando nacio su ultimo hijo inicio vendiendo solo por las mañanas y ahora vende todo el dia ya que en su comunidad a las personas les gusta mucho sus tortillas, ayuda a su esposo con los gastos económicos de su hogar, anhela una estufa a gas ya que actualmente labora con leña,ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de maiz y una estufa para su tortilleria.
texts.en:
Duo Eclipse

Ana is 39 years old and married. She has ten children, 4 of which live with her and attend the community school. Since she was 5 years old she has made a living selling tortillas.

When her last child was born she began selling only during the mornings. She now sells all day long as the people in her community like her tortillas a lot. She helps her husband with the household expenses. 

She wants a gas stove as she currently works with firewood. She asks for this loan so that she can buy corn and a stove for her tortilla bakery.

loans.use: to buy corn and a stove for her tortilla bakery

loans.name: Franklin Uriel

texts.es: Franklin se dedica a la venta de CD y accesorios de celulares, está soltero pero tiene a un niño a su cargo. Franklin tiene mucha demanda de estos accesorios es por tal razón que solicita el crédito para comprar mercadería como cargadores, baterías, memorias, manos libres etc. el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá tener mayor inventario y suplir la demanda de los clientes.
texts.en: Franklin works selling CDs and cellphone accessories. He is single but has a child he is responsible for. Franklin has much demand for these accessories and for this reason he is requesting a loan to buy merchandise like chargers, batteries, memory and hands free devices, etc. The loan will be very useful as he will have a greater inventory and fill the demand from his clients.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like chargers, batteries, memory, hands free devises. etc.

loans.name: Dúo Mujeres Vencedoras Group

texts.es:
Dúo Mujeres Vencedoras
Dúo conformado por Roselia de 57 años de edad, se dedica a la elaboración de tejidos típicos es originaria de san Martin, Este es el cuarto crédito que solicita ha sido responsable en sus pagos. Solicita el crédito para comprar los hilos que utiliza para elaborar los tejidos, está bien agradecida con la ayuda que Kiva y Fape le ha dado ya que le ha ayudado a salir adelante y tener formas de cómo ganar el dinero para ayudar a sus hijos dándoles estudio.
texts.en:
This duo includes Roselia, 57 years old, who is from San Martin and makes a living weaving traditional fabrics. This is the fourth loan she has requested and she has been very responsible with her payments.

She is requesting this credit to purchase the threads that are used to create the fabrics. She is very grateful for the help that Kiva and FAPE have given her which has helped her move forward and have ways to earn money in order to help her children study.

loans.use: to purchase material for the creation of traditional fabrics

loans.name: Johana

texts.es:
Johana tiene 26 años de edad, vive en el chaco con sus abuelos y hermanos. Es madre soltera tiene una hija pequeña, es una mujer muy sacrificada que esta luchando para poder dar a su familia y en especial a su hija, todo lo que ella no pudo tener.
Está estudiando la carrera de criminalista, con lo que quiere ir abriéndose camino y de esa forma poder seguir con su meta de ser una profesional exitosa.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Johana is 26 years old.  She lives in El Chaco with her grandparents and her siblings.  She is a single mother who has a young daughter.  She is very self-sacrificing, and is striving to give her family, especially her daughter, everything she was not able to have.

Johana is studying for a degree in criminology.  With this degree, she hopes to find her way forward so that she can continue toward her goal of becoming a successful professional.

Johana is requesting this loan to pay for tuition so that she can continue with her education.

loans.use: to pay university tuition

loans.name: Kusikoyllor Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “KUSIKOYLLOR”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Valentina ella es casada y tiene 49 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta y crianza de animales, la socia cría los cuyes y gallinas los hace crecer y engordar y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias, por medio de este pequeño negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cuyes y gallinas. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y gallinas y alimentos para los cuyes y gallinas.


 
 
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de venta de ladrillos, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These borrowers are members of the communal bank Kusikoyllor. It is located in the Cusco district in the Cusco province, which is part of the department [state] of Cusco.

One of the members is Valentina, a 49-year-old married woman with 2 children. She raises and sells animals for a living. She raises and fattens guinea pigs and hens, and later sells them at various markets. This small business is how she supports her children.

Her dream is to have a set location where she can sell the guinea pigs and hens. She is requesting a loan to purchase guinea pigs and hens, as well as their feed.

The other members sell clothing, sell bricks, run a grocery store, and own a restaurant.
 
Valentina thanks the lenders who support her dream and commits to paying back her loan within the established timeframe.

loans.use: to purchase guinea pigs, hens, and their feed

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Virginia es una mujer de 63 años de edad, casada, tiene 2 hijos varones de 30 y 35 años y 2 hijas mujeres de 33 y 38 años, y su negocio es la venta de mantas y mandiles de cholita.
Ella es emprendedora, independiente, constante, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza de forma ambulante en la zona de ‘chasquipampa’, área que antiguamente era sitio de pastoreo de ganado y casas construidas de adobe, actualmente se encuentra totalmente urbanizado, de clima templado en verano y muy frío en invierno.
Virginia es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello negro largo trenzado, su vestimenta es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la realiza en compañía de su esposo que se dedica al comercio, viven en una casa propia, construcción antigua hecha de adobe con techo de calamina y cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de mantas y mandiles para cholita. La manta es un tejido de forma rectangular que las mujeres de vestir tradicional utilizan para cubrirse la espalda, está hecho de diferentes materiales y colores según la ocasión y cultura del usuario, pueden ser las tradicionales de lana de alpaca y vicuña, o las modernas elaboradas con telas coloridas de nuevos diseños y variedades. El mandil es un delantal (especie de guardapolvo) que las mujeres de vestir tradicional utilizan para no ensuciar su ropa y lo usan en el trabajo, para cocinar y realizar actividades de limpieza y otros. Su labor la realiza de forma ambulante recorriendo largas distancias para encontrar a sus clientes. “quiero tener un negocio en un lugar fijo, ya estoy cansada de caminar tanto… ” comenta. Su sueño es tener un puesto fijo de venta, ella desea realizar la compra de mantas y mandiles por mayor para satisfacer la demanda del mercado. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 10 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Virginia solicita un préstamo para la compra de mantas y mandiles por mayor para abastecer a sus clientes de temporada.
texts.en:
Virginia is a 63-year-old married woman. She has two sons who are 30 and 35 years old, and two daughters who are 33 and 38. She makes a living by selling shawls and women's aprons.

She is enterprising, independent, reliable, responsible, and hard-working. She conducts her business by traveling around the "Chasquipampa" area, which used to be a region where livestock were raised and houses were made of adobe. Nowadays, it is completely urbanized, and it is warm in the summer and very cold in the winter.

Virginia is tanned, short in stature, and has long, black, braided hair. She dresses in the traditional hat, shawl, and skirt. Her first language was Aymará, and she speaks Spanish because it is general knowledge and she uses it for her business. She lives in the company of her husband, who is a salesman. They live in their family home, which is made in the traditional adobe style with a corrugated metal roof. It has potable water, electricity, and plumbing.

She makes a living by selling shawls (mantas) and women's aprons (mandiles). A manta is a rectangular piece of cloth that women traditionally wear to cover their back. It is made of different materials and colors depending on the occasion and the taste of the wearer. They can be the traditional ones made of alpaca and vicuña [2 breeds of llama] wool, or the modern ones made of colorful cloth with new designs and varieties. A mandil is a type of apron that women traditionally use to avoid getting their clothes dirty while working, cooking, cleaning, or performing other activities. 

She conducts her business by traveling long distances to find customers. "I want to operate my business from an established location. I'm getting tired of walking so much..." she says. Her dream is to have a set location. She wants to buy shawls and aprons wholesale to satisfy the market demand.

This is her second sequence of loans with this lending partner in her 10 years of the business. Virginia is requesting a loan to purchase shawls and aprons wholesale to satisfy her seasonal customers.

loans.use: to purchase shawls and aprons wholesale, to serve her seasonal clients

loans.name: Dúo Hombres De Valor Group

texts.es:
Dúo hombres de valor
Don Edgar Obdulio de 36 años de edad. Empezó su negocio hace doce años con una cantidad de q.300.00 y moliendo su producto en recipientes porque no tenía máquina para moler la arena, luego su negocio fue creciendo y creciendo hasta que llego a tener una panadería un poquito más grande, agradece a dios por darle la oportunidad de vida para salir cada día adelante su mayor anhelo es tener otra panadería con la ayuda de dios, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de Arina para elaboracion de pan.
texts.en:
Two men of valor

Don Edgar Obdulio is 36 years old. He began his business two years ago with 300 Guatemalan Quetzales and grinding his product in containers because he lacked a machine to grind the flour. 

Later his business grew and grew until he owned a bigger bakery. He thanks God for granting him the opportunity to succeed every day. His biggest desire, with the help of Gold, is to own another bakery. He asks for this loan to buy flour to make bread.

loans.use: to buy flour to make bread to sell

loans.name: Channarith

texts.en:
Channarith is 31 years old and married with three children. He is a construction foreman  from the  Kampong Speu province of Cambodia. He has been a construction foreman since 2007. One of the children is a student. His wife is 29 years old and makes  snack food to sell. Both of them earn around 15 USD a day. 

Channarith would like a loan to buy lumber to renovate his house and  a motorcycle for his commute. This loan will provide him with better living and traveling conditions. For his children, he will help them to earn bachelor  degrees.

loans.use: to buy lumber and  a motorcycle.

loans.name: Brenda Beatriz

texts.es:
Brenda, requiere de más capital para comprar cemento, hierro y arena,  le servirán para continuar la construcción del local para la tortillería, ve en los créditos una herramienta importante para seguir dando un buen servicio a su clientes.
Con la inversión del crédito anterior construyo bases sólidas para el nuevo local, su familia se encuentra en óptimas condiciones, mantiene estabilidad en sus ingresos y cancelo su deuda.
texts.en:
Brenda needs more funds to buy cement, iron and sand to continue with the construction of a space to sell tortillas. She finds the loans are an important tool that she can use to continue to provide good customer service.

With the investment of the previous loan she built a solid foundation for the new space. Her family now enjoys better living conditions, she maintains a stable source of income and she paid her debt.

loans.use: to buy cement, iron and sand to help her continue with the construction of a space to sell tortillas.

loans.name: Godlif

texts.en:
Godlif is a 42-year-old man who is married to Derlince, a 39-year-old woman. They are blessed with 6 children: Nathalia, 17, is in the 2nd grade of senior high school; Eduard, 15, is in the 1st grade of senior high school; Febi, 13, is in the 2nd grade of junior high school; Peter, 11, is in the 6th grade of elementary school; Ian, 9, is in the 4th grade of elementary school; and the last is Keke, 7, who is in the 2nd grade of elementary school. 

Godlif works very hard to support his family. He has been running his business selling meat since 1995. Every day he buys between 50 and 60 kilograms of meat from the slaughterhouse, which he then sells on the retail market. He also sells meat to various food stalls. 

Currently, Godlif is requesting an individual loan from Tanaoba Lais Manekat Foundation for 4,500,000 IDR. He plans to use the loan to increase his business capital. He will purchase more supplies of meat to fill the many orders he receives from his customers.

loans.use: to purchase more supplies of meat to sell.

loans.name: Maria Ester

texts.es:
María, comparte su vida con su esposo y cinco hijos; de su esposo aprendió a cultivar granos básicos, plátanos, pipían entre otros cultivos, tiene cinco años de estar desarrollando dicha actividad.
Necesita comprar abono, semilla, fertilizantes, plaguicidas y materiales de construcción para remodelar su vivienda, por lo que solicita un crédito, seguirá trabajando en el campo y mejorará su hogar, espera tener una cosecha más productiva, vender más y tener ingresos extras para cubrir las necesidades familiares.
Sus sueños son tener un negocio fijo, cubrir las necesidades familiares y resarcir la deuda.
texts.en:
Maria shares her life with her husband and five children. She learned from her husband how to cultivate basic grains, plantains, and cucumbers, among other crops. She has been pursuing this activity for the last five years. 

Maria needs a loan to purchase manure, seeds, fertilizers, insecticides, plus construction materials for remodeling her home. She plans to continue working in the countryside while improving her home. Maria expects to have a more productive harvest, and to sell more and have extra income to cover family necessities.

Maria's dreams are to have a fixed business, to cover family necessities, and to repay this debt.

loans.use: buy manure, seeds, fertilizers, insecticides, and construction materials to improve her home.

loans.name: Luz Del Esfuerzo Group

texts.es: Tres mujeres exitosas y con deseos de seguir superándose unieron fuerzas con el objetivo de incrementar su capital de trabajo al solicitar un financiamiento en ADIM desde hace más de  dos años y hoy renuevan el crédito pues le ha permitido así seguir mejorando las condiciones de vida de sus familias. Quien lo coordina es María Catalina una mujer laboriosa de 59 años de edad, casada que ha dedicado los últimos cuatro años de su vida a la comercialización de productos de limpieza en el mercado de Jinotepe, con los créditos anteriores ha logrado aumentar y diversificar los productos ofrecidos, lo que la ha motivado para seguir solicitando los financiamientos, el crédito actual lo solicita para la compra de cajas de jabón, xtra, cajas de jabón ámbar, bolsones de detergentes, desinfectantes, etc., una de sus problemáticas es que existen temporadas bajas por tal razón el crédito anterior logró ampliar más con productos que se comercializan a diario. El resto de las integrantes son las señoras, Martha que tiene la edad de 32 años, comercializa detergente en el mercado de Jinotepe desde hace ocho años, y Vilma una mujer que a sus 60 años de edad lucha para ganarse el pan de cada día, ella se dedica a la hecha y venta de tortilla y nacatamales desde cuatro años.
texts.en:
These three successful women, who have a desire to excel, united forces with the goal of increasing their working capital by requesting a loan from ADIM. After more than 2 years, they are now taking a new loan.  Their previous loan enabled them to continue to improve their family's living conditions. 

The coordinator of this group is Maria Catalina, a hardworking 59 year-old woman.  She is married, and has devoted the last 4 years of her life to selling cleaning products in the Jinotepe market.  With the previous loans, she managed to expand and diversify her products, and this has motivated her to continue to seek new loans.  Maria is requesting this loan to buy cases of soap, Xtra detergent, cases of Ambar soap, detergent pods, disinfectants, etc.  One of Maria's problems is that there are low seasons for sales.  This is why, with her previous loan, she managed to expand her stock of products to include those that sell consistently throughout the year.  

The other members of this group are: Martha, 32, who has been selling detergent in the Jinotepe market for 8 years; and Vilma, 60, who has been earning a living each day for 4 years by making and selling tortillas and Nicaraguan tamales.

loans.use: To buy cleaning products

loans.name: Leo

texts.en: Leo is 41 years old and lives in Tuguegarao, Philippines with his family. He has two children. He operates a motorcycle transport service for income. He is asking for 7,000 PHP to buy gasoline, oil, and maintenance services for his business. He hopes to ensure safe travel to all his passengers and earn good revenue for education purposes.

loans.use: to buy gasoline, oil, and maintenance services.

loans.name: Carlita

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Carlita works hard to support her family. She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from pig-fattening.  

Carlita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more fish to sell through her fish-vending business.

Carlita has been sustaining her business activities through her past ten loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Greyler

texts.en: Greyler is 26 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a split bamboo business in the Philippines and has requested a 22,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional bamboo to make the split bamboo. Greyler has borrowed and repaid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the split bamboo business for two years, and she also earns an income from selling charcoal. She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional bamboo to make split bamboo.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.en:
Teofila is a 59-year-old married woman with six children. 

Teofila has raised pigs for 3 years and requests 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She has previously borrowed four times from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Teofila would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 64 years old and married with four children.

Editha works hard to provide for her family. She has run a general store for 20 years and requests 10,000 PHP through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Editha has borrowed and repaid ten previous loans from NWTF.  She earns additional income raising pigs

Editha aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell.

loans.name: Enriliza

texts.en:
Enriliza has 1 child and she works hard to support her family running a general store.  She earns additional income from a charcoal business.  Enriliza requests 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy shampoo and groceries to sell at her general store.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Enriliza has sustained her business  through 3 previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream which is to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy  shampoo and groceries  to sell.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is 39 years old, married, and works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell ginger business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling clothing and charcoal.  Melinda is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to  buy additional sacks of ginger to sell for her buy-and-sell ginger business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Melinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of ginger to sell

loans.name: Jolita

texts.en:
Jolita is 59 years old and married with two children.  

Jolita is in the agricultural business, doing pig fattening in the Philippines. Jolita requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Jolita has been in pig fattening for four years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jolita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.en:
Eulalia is 58 years old, a widow, and she has nine children.

Eulalia is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Eulalia has been raising pigs for 10 years now, and has borrowed 19 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Florilyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Florilyn works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling hollow blocks in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store.  Florilyn is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials like cement, sand, etc. for her hollow blocks business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Florilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like cement, sand, etc. for her business

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is 45 years old and married with two children. With one child currently in school, Rosa works very hard to provide for them.

Rosa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Rosa has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, eggs, noodles, cereals, coffee, sugar, etc. 

Rosa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Jocelyn is 45 years old and has five children who are currently in school.

Jocelyn has a sound system rental business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy spare parts for her sound system rental business.

Jocelyn has been in this business for ten years. She would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her sound system rental business.

loans.name: Nerissa

texts.en:
Nerissa is a married woman, with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Nerissa is 30 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

Nerissa has a buy-and-sell, ready-to-wear business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional stocks of ready-to-wear to sell to her customers.

Nerissa has been in this business for two years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of ready-to-wear to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Liseth

texts.es: Durante 15 años Doña Liseth se ha dedicado al oficio de costura, corte y confección. Tiene 50 años de edad y tiene solamente un hijo. Entre telas, tijeras, hilos y cortes ha logrado salir adelante esta humilde mujer de rasgos bien definidos. Siempre con deseos de salir adelante solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar: Tela punto com, tela para falda, manta, Dacron, tela chiffon etc. Esta materia prima para corte y confección de ropa le ayudara a fabricar ropa y satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. De esta manera podrá incrementar el volumen de producción, así aumentaran sus ingresos, los cuales le permitirán mejorar su economía familiar y podrá gozar de mejor comodidad y estatus social.
texts.en: For the past 15 years, Liseth has worked in the trade of sewing, cutting and designing clothing. She is 50 years old and only has one son. With fabric, scissors, thread and styles, this humble woman of well defined characteristics has managed to get ahead. Always with the desire to get ahead, she asks for another loan to purchase fabric for embroidery, skirt fabric, muslin, Dacron, chiffon, etc. This raw material to style and design clothing will help her to make clothing and satisfy her customers' demand. In this way, she will be able to increase her production volume and, in turn, increase her income, which will allow her to improve her family income and to be able to enjoy more comfort and social status.

loans.use: to purchase fabric for embroidery, skirt fabric, muslin, Dacron, chiffon, etc.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace works hard to support her family. Grace is married and has a buy-and-sell, used clothing business in the Philippines.

Grace requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more used clothing to sell.

Grace has been in this business for three years now. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Vivincia

texts.en:
Vivincia is 68 years old and widowed with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Vivincia has a food vending business in the Philippines. Vivincia requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, hotdog, seasonings, and more for her business.

Vivincia has been in this business for 12 years. Vivincia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, hot dogs, and seasonings for her business

loans.name: Telma Ligia

texts.es: A sus 55 años de edad Doña Telma ha logrado salir adelante con su pequeña pulpería, gracias al empeño y la disposición que ha tenido durante los quince años que la ha manejado. Tiene tres hijos pero solamente uno a su cargo. Solicita el crédito para comprar productos de consumo básico tales como: Arroz, Frijoles, Aceite, Azúcar entre otros. El crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá incrementar el inventario y satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en: At 55 years old Telma has managed to get ahead with her small store thanks to her determination and attitude that she has had during the 15 years of running her business. She has 3 children but only one is under her care. She is requesting a loan to buy basic consumer products like rice, beans, oil and sugar amongst others. The loan will be very useful as she can increase her inventory and fill the demand from clients.

loans.use: to buy basic food items like rice, oil, beans, sugar amongst others.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Shirley is 31 years old and has two children who are in school.

Shirley has a barber shop business in the Philippines. Shirley requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her business.

Shirley has been in this business for three years. In the future, Shirley would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her business

loans.name: Celeste

texts.en:
Celeste is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Celeste is 30 years old and has two children who are in school.

Celeste has a frozen foods business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional frozen foods to sell to customers.

Celeste has been in this business for two years. In the future, Celeste would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional frozen foods to sell to customers.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is 36 years old and married with two children. With both children currently in school, Janeth works very hard to provide for them.

Janeth runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Janeth has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, beer, shampoo, sanitary pads, diapers, canned goods, etc. 

In the future, Janeth would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Margarita Maria

texts.es:
Trabajado duro, honestidad, respeto y rectitud son algunos de los valores que describen a margarita, una confeccionista de línea propia que a pesar de que se separó de su esposo siempre tuvo la fortaleza y voluntad para mantener su hogar conformado por ella y sus dos hijas. 
A pesar de que es sola en su negocio siempre tiene ideas para impulsar su negocio, ahora tiene una idea para sacar una nueva línea y necesita capital de trabajo para implementarla por lo que necesita una ayuda crediticia para la compra de telas, e implementos para sus futuras modas.
texts.en: Hard working, honesty, respect and fairness are a few values that describe Margarita, a seamstress who designs her own clothing.  Although she separated from her husband she has always had the strength and will to sustain her household where she lives with her two daughters.  Although she works alone in her business she always has ideas to help move it forward.  Now she has an idea to create a new clothing line and she needs capital to implement it which is why she is requesting this credit; to buy fabrics and supplies for her future designs.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and supplies to start a new clothing line this year

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy the raw materials needed to make fabrics for sale.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She is requesting a 17,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Janet is successfully repaying her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan so she can further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Janet's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Norik

texts.en:
Norik is 37 years old and he lives in the village Tsovagyugh of Gegharkunik region. 

His peasant family is wholly engaged in farming and Norik, being the head of his family, perfectly leads it. As he says, his wife and retired mother greatly help him in his farming, especially in the sale of his farm products (milk, macun, national dairy-product, cheese, butter, eggs, and also some meat). 

Norik’s farm is not a very rich one: he has 2 cows, 2 calves, a pig, and 15 chickens. From his plot of land, he gathers potato (he sells it to re-sellers) and also provides his farm cattle with hay. 

Norik hopes that Kiva lenders will be kind to support him with a loan in his idea of farm development; he wants to buy a cow and also animal fodder for his farm cattle for winter.

loans.use: to buy a cow and also animal fodder for his farm cattle for winter

loans.name: Fancy

texts.en:
"Eighty percent of Kenyans are farmers, and by that, I mean people who make a living off of the land, and eighty percent of the food that people eat comes from people who sell in the rural marketplace,” says Fancy, a mixed farmer based in the Litein area of Kenya. She is a mother of four school-going children whom she truly loves and greatly adores. Fancy always describes her upbringing as challenging, and that is why she is doing everything in her power to provide a good foundation for her children and to be able to secure their future. 

Fancy has been farming for over 10 years. Over the years, she has gained much experience and is now considered one of the best farmers in her village because of the immense knowledge that she possesses. Fancy passionately loves dairy farming and she has even nicknamed one of her cows. Since she has excess dairy food and enough space on her land, Fancy has always wanted to buy another dairy cow, but the challenge that she has been facing is lack of finances. That is why Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva and Kiva lenders to help aspiring women like Fancy to turn their dreams into reality. 

Fancy believes that the loan will help her to satisfy the milk demand in her area and, through the accumulated profits, she will be able to realize her dream of developing her business into a large enterprise. Many women in Kenya are responsible for not only producing food, but also feeding their family. Fancy, being a hardworking farmer, wants to provide all of the basic needs that her children and parents require. Fancy is very disciplined with her finances and she knows that with the accumulated profits, she will be able to fully repay her loan.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Yohanna

texts.en:
Yohanna is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Kwankwani village in Kaduna state, Nigeria. 

In the past, because he needed to cover urgent expenses, Yohanna would typically have sold his maize immediately after harvest, when supply was highest but prices were lowest. However, now as a member of Babban Gona, with their support and this loan, he can store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for a price of up to 40% more. 

Like other members of Babban Gona, Yohanna intends to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for his family. As well, he hopes to one day become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing thereby eliminating pressure to sell his corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es:
Ramon está estudiando la carrera  de administración agropecuaria, con la ayuda de sus padres está cubriendo los gastos de la facultad.
Él está  poniendo todo de su parte para lograr sus metas y objetivos  ya que proviene de una familia humilde pero trabajadora.
Pide este préstamo para poder seguir con su Trabajo como lo viene haciendo, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en: Ramon is studying agricultural administration. With the help of his parents, he is covering the tuition. He is putting forth all of his effort in order to achieve his goals and objectives, since he comes from a humble yet hard-working family. He is requesting a loan so that he can continue working as he has been and, in this way, continue with his studies.

loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: Ana Ruth

texts.es:
Ana, tiene dos molinos nixtamales y además vende frutas congeladas cubiertas de chocolate, charamuscas, hielo, etc.; su núcleo familiar está integrado por su compañero de vida y tres hijos; su negocio en un principio era la venta de leche y cerdos, cuando formo su hogar aprendió de su compañero de vida la administración del servicio de un molino nixtamal, por lo que decidió quedarse únicamente con dicha actividad, su negocio está en el mercado desde hace 6 años y por el momento no representa dificultades.
Utilizará el crédito para comprar fajas, grasa, discos y otros materiales necesarios para mantener su equipo en buenas condiciones, tendrá repuestos en caso de un mal funcionamiento, espera dar a su clientela un servicio de calidad, incrementar sus ganancias, incorporar un nuevo rubro y seguir apoyando a su compañero de vida en los gastos familiares.
Ana tiene como objetivos formar un patrimonio para su familia, construir su vivienda de ladrillo y tener buena calificación crediticia.
texts.en:
Ana has two mills for corn flour and also sells frozen fruits covered in chocolate, frozen juice treats, ice, etc.; her immediate family consists of her life partner and three children. Her business initially began as the sale of milk and pigs. When she started her home her life partner taught her how to operate a corn flour mill. She decided to stick with this business and has been in the market for over 6 years, which at the moment doesn’t present any difficulties. 

She will use this loan to buy belts, oil, disks and other materials necessary to maintain her equipment in good condition. She will have replacements in case of malfunction. She hopes to provide her clientele with a quality service, increase her earnings, and incorporate a new line of business, as well as continue supporting her life partner with the family expenses. 

Ana aims to create a legacy for her family, to build her home out of brick and have a good credit rating.

loans.use: to buy belts, oil, disks and other materials necessary to maintain her equipment in good condition

loans.name: Sophat

texts.en:
Sophat, 22, lives in a small community of Battambang Province. He has only one child, who is currently in school. 

To make a living and support his family, he manages and operates a rice farming business on farmland which is located near his house. He has been involved with this business since 2010. He is able to earn a daily income of USD 5.00, on average.

Sophat wants to have household energy at a reduced monthly cost by purchasing a solar energy home system.  Because there is inadequate money, he has requested a Kiva loan through its partner, HKL. After this initial investment, he hopes to have clean energy to power his household lights, TV, and radio. 

He is very happy and thankful because, with this loan, HKL has provided him a special interest rate lower than its general loan rates. He awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to pay for a solar energy home system

loans.name: Machac Marka 27 Group

texts.es:
Ateliana es una mujer de 54 años de edad, casada, tiene un hijo varón de 20 años y una hija mujer de 26 años de edad, y su negocio es el tejido de mantas con lana de vicuña.
Ella es sincera, generosa, comprensiva, paciente, buena oyente, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la feria ‘San Luis’ y la feria ’16 de julio’ caracterizadas por el comercio informal en todas las áreas, donde se dice que se puede encontrar desde una aguja para coser hasta un tractor para arar. De clima frío y seco (2ºC -12ºC), a una altura promedio de 3800 metros sobre el nivel del mar.
Ateliana es de tez morena, cabello negro largo trenzado, su vestimenta es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza (sentada al centro, usa blusa rosada, pollera amarilla y sombrero). Su vida la comparte con su esposo que se dedica al comercio, y con su hijo menor que estudia, su hija mayor es casada y vive aparte. Viven en una casa alquilada, construida de adobe que cuenta con agua potable electricidad, gas domiciliario y alcantarillado. La motivación por ayudar  a pagar los gastos de estudios de su hijo la hicieron liderar una banca de personas con actividades comerciales como; venta de empanadas, comercio de cosméticos, venta de ropa de temporada, venta de vajillas, venta de celulares, venta de carne de pollo, venta de muebles, venta de edredones, confección de carteras de cuero, venta de salteñas y confección de polleras, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus negocios. Su negocio es el tejido en telar con lana de vicuña, ella teje mantas y aguayos para su venta en diferentes ferias de la ciudad. El tejido se realiza en telar y se produce mediante la colocación de la lana en la trama y mediante la fuerza de un peine se ajusta cada tramo. Labor que realiza durante todo el día para exponer sus tejidos a la venta en las ferias. “mi telar es herencia de un familiar, que también fue heredado de otro, se encuentra gastado y viejo pero eso no cambia la calidad de los tejidos…” comenta. Su sueño es tener un taller de tejido grande y con nuevos telares. Ella desea realizar la refacción de un cuarto para utilizarlo como taller de tejido. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 15 años que viene desarrollando esta labor de manera independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Ateliana solicita un préstamo para la refacción de un cuarto para utilizarlo como taller y tejer muchas mantas de vicuña.
texts.en:
Ateliana  is a 54 year old woman, married, with a son who is twenty years old and a daughter 26 years old, and her business is weaving blankets from  vicñua wool.

She is generous, frank, understanding, patient, a good listener, responsible and hard-working. She carries out her business at the San Luis market and the "July 16th" one, which are known for informal sales in all areas, where they say one can find everything from a sewing needle to a tractor for plowing.  The climate is cold and dry (2ºC -12ºC), and the area is located at an average altitude of 34800 meters above sea level.

Ateliana has brown skin and long black hair worn in braids; her dress is traditional (hat, blanket and gathered skirt).  Her native language is  Aymará and she speaks Spanish as a matter of general knowledge and for the business she carries out.  (Seated in the middle of the group, she is wearing a pink blouse, yellow skirt and hat).  She shares life with her husband who is a salesman and with her younger son who is in school.  Her daughter is older, married, and lives separately.  The family lives in a rented house built of adobe which has running water, electricity, gas  and a sewer system.

Her desire to help pay for her daughter's school costs made her become leader of a group of people with sales activitiey such as selling empanadas, cosmetics, seasonal clothing, dishes, cellphones, the meat from chickens, furniture, quilts, making leather wallets, selling pastries and making skirts,  The group members wanted to get a loan and improve their businesses.  Ateliana's business is weaving vicuña wool in a factory.  She weaves blankets and fabric to sell in various markets in her city.  She does the weaving at the factory and it is done by placing the wool in line and adjusting each strand by the pressure of a comb.

Ateliana does this work all day to prepare her woven goods for sale in the market.  "My factory is an inheritance from a family member, who also inherited it from another; it is worn out and old but that does not change the quality of the weaving," she says.  Atelian's dream is to have a large weaving workshop with new looms.  This is the first cycle of loans with the institution in the fifteen years that she has been carrying out this work independently.   

 These are the reasons why Ateliana is asking for a loan to renovate a room to use as a workshop and to weave many blankets of vicuña wool.

loans.use: to renovate a room in order to use it as a workshop and weave many blankets from vicuña wool

loans.name: Jovy

texts.en: Jovy is 46 years old and married to a carpenter. They're blessed with two children. She has owned and managed a retail store in their village for almost eight years from which she earns a net income of 300 PHP daily. Her income from this business is usually spent on their daily living expenses. Jovy is asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase cooking oil, coffee, sugar, detergent soap, and canned goods to sell in her store. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, coffee, sugar, detergent soap, and canned goods to sell.

loans.name: Gerlie

texts.en:
Gerlie manages her hog-raising, direct-selling and farming businesses. Currently, she's raising two sows and three piglets. Gerlie is married and has two children who are school. Gerlie focuses on her direct-selling business for its weekly income.

Gerlie would like to take out a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy additional stock such as perfume, cologne, shampoo, detergent soap and fabric conditioner to sell. She knows that with this loan, she could increase her sales, income and let her two children finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy additional stock such as perfume, cologne, shampoo, detergent soap and fabric conditioner to sell

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa sells a variety of vegetables and fish within her area. She has been doing this kind of work for 15 years.

Teresa also has a farm where she earns other income to support her family by growing vegetables and raising hogs. 

Teresa would like to take a 8,000 PHP loan of additional capital which will be used to purchase vegetables and fish to sell within her local community. 

Teresa hopes that her vegetable selling activity will continue to grow. In this way, she would be able to meet her family's needs and maintain all the businesses she operates.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of vegetables and fish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice, flour, sugar and cooking oil for use in her business.

loans.name: Minerva

texts.en:
Minerva is working hard to support her family. She is happily married with two children. She and her husband work hand in hand to increase their income.

Minerva manages her general store, two hectares of corn farmland, and a hog raising business. Her husband works as a tricycle driver and serves as barangay (community) official for their local community.

With her determination to obtain greater income, Minerva is seeking a loan of PHP10,000 which will be used to buy more stocks of grocery items such as  rice and frozen foods and also gasoline to sell. She hopes to access this loan so she can keep her businesses productive and profitable.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of grocery items such as rice and frozen foods and also gasoline to sell

loans.name: Annalen

texts.en:
Annalen is 21 years old and married with  children.

She has earned a living by farming  for 5 years and earns additional income raising pigs.  Annalen requests 13,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies.

She is working tirelessly to attain her dream which is o  save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase  fertilizer and other supplies.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 56 years old and married with five children.

She has earned a living growing rice for 15 years and earns additional money raising pigs. Vilma is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

She works tirelessly to attain her dream which is to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is a married woman with four children who works hard to support her family.

She has a rice business and earns additional income raising pigs.  Elisa requests 20,000 PHP through NWTF to  buy sacks of rice  to sell.

Elisa has sustained her business through 6 previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream which is to save enough money  to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice grains.

loans.name: Orlina

texts.en:
Orlina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has had a motorcycle transportation business for 12 years. 

She requests 24,000 PHP through NWTF to buy spare parts for her motorcycle transportation business.

Orlina earns additional income from a charcoal business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and requests another loan to further build her businesses.

She has sustained her business  through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fruit for her husband's business.

loans.name: Cerelina

texts.en:
Cerelina is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 55 years old and has one child who is still in school. 

Cerelina has a repair shop business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials and tools like welding rod, interior aluminum and other materials for her business. She has been in this business for 29 years. Cerelina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials and tools like welding rod, interior aluminum and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a furniture making business in the Philippines.  She earns more income from selling vegetables.

She requests 13,000 PHP through NWTF to buy wood, nails, and paint for her furniture business.

Helen has sustained her business  through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy wood, nails, and paint.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 51 years old and married with eight children.

Rosita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her general store.

Rosita has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from electronic mobile load retailing.

Rosita aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Charlin

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Charlin works hard to support her family.

She has a ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines and earns additional income from selling frozen foods. Charlin is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy additional ready to wear stock like blouses, t-shirts, and shorts to sell.

Charlin has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional ready-to-wear stock like blouses, t-shirts, and shorts to sell

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a business buying and selling ready-to-wear in the Philippines.

Lourdes has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of blouses, shorts, bags, etc. to sell to her customers. She has been in this business for five years now. Lourdes would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of blouses, shorts, bags, etc. to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 40 years old, married, and has 1 child, who is in school. Helen works very hard to provide for them.

Helen runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of 14,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy additional items to sell such as eggs, beverages, canned goods, etc.

Helen has been running this business for 2 years where she sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Helen would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like eggs, beverages, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia is 55 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Herminia has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from pig fattening. She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Ana Dolly

texts.es:
Ana es una mujer sonriente y eufórica que a pesar de que vive y trabaja sola siempre trata de alegrarse encontrando en la música un fiel amigo.
Inicio su negocio de preparación de alimentos por iniciativa propia, por necesidad económica e impulsada por un amigo y sus propósitos para este 2015 son aumentas sus ventas, hacerse más conocida y tener su propio restaurante, pero ira paso por paso y el siguiente es solicitar un crédito para la compra de insumos para cubrir algunos eventos pendientes y salir como todas las mañanas a ofertar fuera de casa sus alimentos.
texts.en:
Ana is a smiling and exuberant woman.  In spite of living and working alone, she always tries to be happy.  She finds music to be a loyal friend.

She started her business of preparing food on her own initiative because of financial need.  She was motivated by a friend, and her goals for 2015 are to increase her sales, to become more well-known, and to have her own restaurant.  However, she will take it step by step.

The next thing is to request a loan to buy the supplies to cover some pending events and to go out, as she does every morning, to sell her food away from home.

loans.use: to buy the supplies to cover some pending events and to go out, as she does every morning, to sell her food away from home.

loans.name: Luis Carlos

texts.es:
Luis es un hombre creativo, recursivo, que a pesar de ser de un sector rural en donde es muy común ver agricultores, ganaderos, busco la forma de cambiar de innovar y monto su negocio de  jardinería para mantener campos en fincas y tener un poco más de libertar para trabajar. 
En vista de que en muchas ocasiones le toca mantener un campo muy repleto de hojas quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de una maquina sopladora para agilizar más su trabajo y poder atender más fincas o clientes en un día.
texts.en:
Luis is a creative and resourceful man.  In spite of being from a rural area where it is very common to see farmers and ranchers, he looked for a way to be innovative.  He established his gardening business to maintain the fields on the farms and to have a little more freedom in his work.

Given the fact that he often performs maintenance on fields that are full of leaves, he wants to request a loan to buy a leaf blower in order to streamline his work and to be able to tend to more farms or customers in a day.

loans.use: to buy a leaf blower to speed up his work by 60%.

loans.name: Doris Esmeralda

texts.es:
Doris, de40 años de edad, estudió unicamente hasta 7º grado, ya que su padre falleció y su madre no pudo seguirla apoyando para que terminara sus estudios, porque la llevaba a que le ayudara a trabajar, su esposo es agricultor, solo su hija menor vive con ella y estudia 6º  grado. 

Doris, tiene 19 años de dedicarse a la venta de ropa,  pero hace un año inicio en el negocio propio  de venta de verduras y frutas. Ambos negocios los conoce muy bien, ya que cuando su padre murió, fue su madre quien le enseño a como poder trabajar en estos negocios, así fue como aprendió las técnicas de comercializar los productos.

Los lugares donde ella vende están a una distancia de cinco kilómetros, viaja en autobús; todos los días se levanta a las 4.30 de la mañana para arreglarle el desayuno a su esposo y a su hija, después sale a vender, y regresa hasta las 3.00 de la tarde a su casa.

El préstamo sera utilizado para comprar frutas y verduras para su negocio; con el otorgamiento del préstamo, se esta contribuyendo para que Doris, continué haciendo lo que más le gusta y a la vez tenga ingresos para su hogar.

Doris, tiene muchos sueños, uno de ellos es poder dejarles a sus hijos, una casa en buenas condiciones donde puedan vivir, por eso ha logrado mejorar la vivienda.- También, le gustaría tener una pequeña tienda en su casa y además, desea comprarle un molino a su hijo, para que trabaje en su casa.
texts.en:
Doris is 40 years old. She studied only up until the 7th grade because her father passed away at that time. Her mother could not continue to support her in finishing her studies. She had to help with work. Her husband is a farmer and one of her children, a daughter in 6th grade, still lives with her.

Doris has been engaged in the sale of clothing for 19 years, but she also started selling fruits and vegetables a year ago. She knows both businesses very well. After her father died, her mother taught her how to work in these businesses and market the products.

She travels 5 kilometers to get to work on a bus. She gets up everyday at 4:30 a.m. to make breakfast for her husband and daughter, goes to work, then returns home after selling out around 3:00 p.m.

This loan will be used to buy fruits and vegetables for her business. With the funding of this loan, it contributes to Doris continuing to do what she enjoys and also have income for her home.

Doris has many dreams, one of which is to be able to pass on to her children a home in good condition where they can live. That is why she has improved the housing. Also, she would like to have a small shop at home and purchase a mil for her son so that he can work at home.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand her tailoring business by buying needed supplies

loans.name: Juana Dolores

texts.es:
Juana, de 40 años de edad, estudió hasta tercer grado, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijas pero ambas tienen sus propios hogares.

Juana, se dedica a cuidar una anciana desde hace 4 años, ella decidió hacer esto, ya que cuando se separó de su compañero de vida ya no tenía ninguna ayuda económica de nadie; ella camina una distancia de 25 minutos para llegar a cuidar la anciana. 

Juana, necesita el crédito para comprar tres bolsas de cemento y 100 ladrillos, para realizar reparaciones en su vivienda, ya que se le ha deteriorado. 

Juana, sueña con tener una casa digna y más grande para que cuando sus hijas la visiten, puedan sentirse cómodas y quedarse a dormir donde ella.
texts.en:
Juana is forty years old and she completed third grade at school. She is the single mother of two daughters, both of whom have homes of their own.

She has been working for four years providing care for a woman of advanced age. She decided to do this because when she separated from her life partner, she was left with no financial assistance from any source. She walks for 25 minutes to reach the old lady's place.

Juana needs the loan to buy three bags of cement and 100 bricks to repair her home, since it has deteriorated. 

Juana dreams of having a decent, bigger house so that her daughters can feel comfortable and spend the night over when visiting their mother.

loans.use: to buy three bags of cement and 100 bricks.

loans.name: Hieng

texts.en:
Hieng is a 49-year-old man from a remote area of Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. He is a chef with a daily income of USD 7.50, while his wife Chenda, 48, is a rice farmer who earns USD 5.00 per day. They have 7 children, 4 of whom are single and 3 are married. 

Hieng would like to improve his standard of living by having clean energy for household use. He wishes to build a biogas digester but lacks the capital. So he is requesting a loan from the partnership between the National Biogas Program and Hattha Kaksekar Limited. 

After an initial investment in this system, Hieng hopes that he will not only save money spent on fuel but also help decrease the smoke generated by wood or charcoal. 

Hieng is very happy and thankful because, with this kind of loan product, HKL has offered a special interest rate. He awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to build a biogas digester.

loans.name: Dúo Esmeralda De Magdalena Group

texts.es:
Dúo Esmeralda de Magdalena
Este dúo está formado por Doña Alicia ella tiene 52 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de consumo diario como aguas gaseosas, detergente, golosinas, frijol , azúcar, leche en liquido, papel higiénico, en su tienda ubicada en su domicilio, ella esta solicitando el crédito para la inversión de compra de un quintal de frijol negro y rojo y el resto para la compra de abarrotes en general,  su anhelo es surtir mas su tienda con su ganancia piensa invertir en juegos pirotécnicos para la temporada navideña.
texts.en: This is the communal bank "Dúo Esmeralda de Magdalena."  This group includes Alicia, 52, who has a business selling basic consumer products such as sparkling water, detergent, snacks, beans, sugar, milk, and toilet paper from the store that she has in her home.  She is requesting a loan that she will use to purchase a 100 lb.sack of red and black beans and other groceries.  She wants to stock up her store so that with the extra earnings, she can invest in fireworks for the Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell

loans.name: Dúo Parana Group

texts.es:
DUO PERANA 
El cual esta integrado por la señora Bethzaida Eunice quien es propietaria de una venta de zapatos la cual ya tiene 3 años de tenerla y también es madre soltera con tres niños, lo cual no ha sido impedimento para que ella los saque adelante proporcionándoles ropa, estudio y un buen estilo de vida  ella en esta ocasión acude a la fundación para la adquisición de un crédito  para invertir en su negocio(calzado) ya que por las fechas presentes es una buena época para poder invertir por lo que espera que se le tome en cuenta dicha solicitud…
texts.en: This is the communal bank "Duo Perana."  One of the members is Bethzaida Eunice, who has owned a shoe store for 3 years.  She is also a single mother with 3 children, but this has not stopped her from working to provide them with clothing, an education, and a good standard of living.  At this time, she has approached FAPE to apply for a loan to invest in her shoe business, because this is a good season of the year to invest in her business.  She hopes that you will consider her request for funding.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell

loans.name: Thea

texts.en:
Thea is a 43-year-old married mother with 6 children in her care. She lives in Kampong Speu Province in Cambodia. 

Both Thea and her husband, who is 47 years old, earn incomes by selling palm fruit, and they have been in this business since 2013. Among their children, 2 of them work in a factory, and 4 are students. All together they earn around $16 each day. 

One of her children will marry soon, so Thea has decided to apply for a loan to cover her child’s wedding expenses. With this loan, she will have enough money to hold a traditional wedding. 

In the future, Thea wants to renovate her house. And as for her other children, she plans to help them finish high school.

loans.use: to cover her child’s wedding expenses.

loans.name: Pronia

texts.en:
Pronia used her previous loan to buy stock like sugar, rice, and cooking oil to sell.  She is is a 46-year-old married woman with four children, living in Fort Portal, Uganda.  Her main business is agriculture, but she also runs a retail shop to boost her income.  

Her vision is to educate her children to higher levels of learning, although she is facing the hardship of inadequate capital.  Pronia intends to use the loan to buy stock like sugar, rice, cassava flour, and cooking oil to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, cassava flour, and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Yusufjon

texts.en: Yusufjon was born in 1995. He is a single young man from the capital of Tajikistan. Yusufjon studies at the university, and is a second year student. He is learning the military system, and wants to work in the military system of Tajikistan after graduating from the university, and to be helpful to society.
