Yusufjon is asking for a loan to pay for university tuition because he does not have the money to pay for it. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Alma

texts.en: Alma is engaged in selling of frozen foods, and in the transportation business. She is a 34-year-old, married woman, who is blessed with three children. Alma aims to have a stable source of income in order to send her children to a higher level of education, and to have a better way of living. To make her dreams possible, she is asking for a loan of 8,000 PHP. She will use this amount to buy additional stock of frozen foods, and for maintenance of her motorcycle for her transport business.She hopes that she can use this loan for further growth of her food vending and transportation business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of frozen foods, and for maintenance of her motorcycle for her transport business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth works hard to support her family. Elizabeth is married and has a business direct selling Fuller Life products in the Philippines.

Elizabeth requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional products like lotion, shampoo, body spray,  and deodorant to sell to her customers.

Elizabeth has been in this business for 25 years now.

In the future, Elizabeth would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like lotion, shampoo, body spray, and deodorant to sell to her customers

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Josephine works hard to support her family.

She has a fruit and vegetable vending business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from a general store.  Josephine is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell to her customers for her fruit and vegetable vending business.

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell to her customers

loans.name: Dulce Amor

texts.en:
Dulce Amor is 32 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by buying and selling farm supplies in the Philippines. Dulce Amor is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of fertilizer to sell.

Dulce Amor has been buying and selling farm supplies for 10 years and earns additional income from pig fattening.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of fertilizer to sell

loans.name: Ma. Lorena

texts.en:
Ma. Lorena is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 40 years old and all her children are currently in school.

Ma. Lorena has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more fish to sell in her fish stall.

Ma. Lorena has been in this business for ten years. She would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her fish stall.

loans.name: Ma. Socorro

texts.en:
Ma. Socorro is a 47-year-old married mother of six children, one currently in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Ma. Socorro has a buy-and-sell frozen food business in the Philippines. Ma. Socorro requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more frozen foods to sell in her food stall.

Ma. Socorro has been in this business for five years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more frozen foods to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a 41-year-old married mother of three children, two currently in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Susan has a general store business in the Philippines. Susan requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Susan has been in this business for two years. In the future, Susan would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of seven children, Leonora works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines and earns additional income from a general store. Leonora is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance for her motorcycle transport business.

Leonora has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle transport business.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Rosalia works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines. Rosalia is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal to sell for her business. 

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested this loan to further build her business.

Rosalia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell for her business

loans.name: Nhóm 10 - Lưu Phương 01 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Co, pictured first from the left, is 34 years old, and has four children who are all in school. 

She and her husband do not have stable jobs, earning about VND 600,000 monthly. She has been a member of the local Women's Union since 2009. Her household does not have a hygienic latrine. 

With this VND 8 million loan, she will have a hygienic toilet installed in her home. This will improve her family's hygiene and health and contribute to the sanitary improvement in her community.

loans.use: To pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine with a device for hand-washing with soap

loans.name: Gennefe

texts.en:
Gennefe is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials for her business.

Gennefe has been in this business for five years. Gennefe earns additional income from food vending.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested this loan to further build her businesses.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of his family.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials for her business

loans.name: Criselda

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Criselda works hard to support her family.

She has a business farming rice in the Philippines and earns additional income from selling vegetables. Criselda is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional rice seed and fertilizer for her rice business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested this loan to further build her business.

Criselda has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilzer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is a 42-year-old woman with three children, who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Sonia has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 23,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

Sonia has been in this business for 13 years. In the future, Sonia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Nieves

texts.en:
Nieves is 35 years old and married, with one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 40,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy items to sell, like shampoo and groceries.

Nieves has borrowed and paid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from buy-and-sell charcoal.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Nieves aspires to save enough money, so she could afford to send her child to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like shampoo and groceries.

loans.name: Ma. Lolita

texts.en:
Ma. Lolita is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 49 years old and has three children who are in school.

Ma. Lolita has a business buying and selling bags in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional bags to sell. Ma. Lolita has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional bags to sell.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a married woman with one child who is currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marilyn is 28 years old.

Marilyn has a business selling fruits and vegetables in the Philippines. She requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional fruits and vegetables to sell, such as bananas, sweet potatoes, squash, etc.

Marilyn has been in this business for five years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables such as bananas, sweet potatoes, squash, etc

loans.name: Emmaculada

texts.en:
Emmaculada is 57 years old and married.  She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Emmaculada has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, eggs, biscuits, diapers, coffee, shampoo, sanitary pads, etc. Emmaculada would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 39-year-old married woman, with five children, three of whom are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Elizabeth has a furniture making business in the Philippines. She has requested a 23,000 PHP loan through NWTF, to purchase additional materials for her furniture making business.

Elizabeth has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her furniture making business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Meet Elizabeth. She is a smallholder farmer with extremely humble beginnings. She is based in Inoro village in the Molo region of Kenya. Her upbringing was difficult. She never managed to finish her primary education, but she is very determined to give the best life to her children. 

Ten years ago, Elizabeth started farming on her husband's two-acre farm. She did it mostly for subsistence until recently. She keeps a dairy cow that gives her ten liters of milk to sell everyday. She also grows vegetables that she uses to prepare food, and to also sell. 

Elizabeth is seeking a loan to purchase a dairy cow. The cow will produce additional milk to sell. This investment will not only double the income that Elizabeth is making from milk, but will also mitigate risks associated with having just one productive cow. The additional income will enable her to comfortably handle food and education costs, which happen to be her highest expenses. Consider lending a loan to Elizabeth to help her improve her economic activity.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay school fees for his child at the university.

loans.name: Yuri Marcela

texts.es:
Yuri junto con su esposo velan cada día por el cuidado de sus dos hijos que tiene 7 y 2 años de edad, una edad que los padres disfrutan pues es donde más cerca están de ellos y donde más pendientes hay que estar de su cuidado, educación y alimentación y es dicha preocupación que llevo a Yuri a realizar sus trabajos de confección para mejorar sus ingresos para ellos. 
Gracias a los buenos trabajos se ha ganado la gratitud de sus clientes y ellos la quieren seguir apoyando este 2015 y pensando en todo el trabajo que tendrá solicita un crédito para la compra de una maquina recibidora para agilizar sus tiempos de confección y pensar en darle trabajo a una compañera que lo necesite.
texts.en:
Yuri, together with her husband, care for their two children who are 7 and 2 years old, an age that the parents enjoy and so it is where they most need to be to so that they can be pendant of their care, education and feeding.  It is this worry which brings Yuri to undertake the work she does as a seamstress; to help increase their income.  

Thanks to her good work she has won the gratitude of her clients and they want to keep helping her throughout 2015.  She is thinking about how much work she will have which is why she is requesting this loan to buy a sewing machine to save time when sewing and she is also thinking of giving work to her neighbors who need it.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine to speed up her sewing and give work to her neighbors who need it

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses a hardworking, married man, aged 24, with three children living in Kyenjojo-Uganda. He deals in cattle trade whereby he buys cattle to sell at a profit. He also carries out commercial crop farming where he earns additional income to cater to family needs. As it is a festive season of Christmas, Moses wants to invest more in cattle trade. Therefore, he requires a loan to buy more cows for selling.

loans.use: To buy cows for selling

loans.name: Diego Efrain

texts.es:
El taller de mecánica representa para el amigo diego un hombre de 29 años de edad su sustento y el de sus padres, pues vive con ellos no tiene pareja ni hijos. 
Es por esta razón que este negocio lo atesora y lo cuida demasiado y siempre trata de tenerlo bien abastecido para atender cualquier dificultad que le llegue.
Por tal razón Diego Solicita un crédito para la compra de repuestos de moto y aceites, abasteciendo su taller de moto para el inicio de este año en el que espera muchos éxitos.
texts.en:
His repair shop constitutes the livelihood for both Diego, aged 29, and his parents. He lives with them as he does not have a partner or children.
For this reason, Diego treasures his business and sometimes care for it too much and always tries to have it fully stocked to be prepared to attend to any difficulties.
Therefore, Diego is asking for a loan to buy spare parts and lubricants, thus stocking his motorcycle repair shop for the start of the new year in which he hopes to have much success.

loans.use: to stock his motorcycle repair business with spare parts, lubricants and other necessities

loans.name: Yeni Alfita

texts.es:
Yeni, de 25 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato, está soltera y no tiene hijos, vive con sus padres, hermanos y dos sobrinos.

Yeni, tiene gran experiencia en la siembra de yuca, desde los 10 años ayuda a sus padres en la siembra  de este cultivo. Actualmente, solo siembran 7,000 metros cuadrados de yuca.

Yeni, también ha trabajado en una tienda de granos básicos. 

El crédito será  para pagar la mano de obra que le ayudará para cosechar la yuca, de donde genera ingreso para ella y sus padres.

El sueño de Yeni, es poder ayudar a mejorar la calidad de vida de sus padres.- Además, le gustaría estudiar inglés, aprender este idioma y graduarse de esta carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Yeni, aged 25, finished high school, is single, childless and lives with her parents, siblings and two nephews.

Yeni is experienced in the sowing of yuca. She has been helping her parents in the sowing of the crop since the age of ten.
At the moment they only sow 7,000 square meters of yuca. Yeni has also worked in a basic grains store.

The loan will be used towards paying the laborers that will help with the harvesting of the yuca, which supplies the income for herself and her parents.
Yeni dreams of improving her parent's living conditions. Additionally, she would like to study English to learn the language and graduate in the subject at university.

loans.use: to pay the laborers that will help her harvest yuca.

loans.name: Mahraja

texts.en:
Mahraja is a 45-year-old mother of four children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is a fruit seller by profession, selling apples, bananas, grapes, etc. He is responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household.
Mahraja's husband needs to purchase different types of fruit for reselling purposes so that he can increase the size of his business, improve his sales growth and earn maximum profit. But he is not in a financial position to purchase fruit for business purposes.
Therefore Mahraja has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband purchase more fruit. 
She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase fruit for her husband's business.

loans.name: Shoira

texts.en:
Shoira is a strong woman. She was born in 1993. She is from the northern part of Tajikistan. She is single. 

She is a student who studies at university. It is the fourth year of her studying. She is studying languages. Her dream is to become an Anglo-Arabian translator. She is an active and educated student in the class. After graduation she wants to have a good occupation. She tries to be responsive and useful to her family and community. 

She needs financial support for paying her tuition for the university.

loans.use: to pay for tuition.

loans.name: Mehrikhon

texts.en:
Mehrikhon is a hardworking woman. She was born in 1981. She is from the northern part of Tajikistan. She lives in a village. 

After graduating high school, she got married. She has two children. Her husband is a master. He repairs conditioning apparatus. 

She started an agriculture business. She bought one calf, fed him, and sold him. She thought that it is a good business to do. Now Mehrikhon has five big cattle. She wants to expand her business. She is planning to buy one more cattle. She is asking for financial support to enlarge her business.

loans.use: to buy cattle to sell

loans.name: Larena

texts.en:
Larena is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF in order to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

Larena successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is relisting Larena's business profile again in support of her efforts to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF in order to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

Nancy successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Nancy's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Hello world! Meet Teresia. Teresia, 62, is a very dedicated mother who believes in hard work. She is happily married and blessed with four lovely children whom she often refers to as “my pride.” She is based in Kapsowar, a small remote rural town in Kenya that has bad terrain and is characterized by drought and bad weather conditions. 

For the past twenty years, Teresia has been actively involved in mixed farming. Her primary source of income is from milk and crop farming. Teresia passionately loves dairy farming and has nicknamed one of her cows “Kapseret.” Milking Kapseret is her hobby and feeding her cows makes her very proud. Dairy farming is very fulfilling for Teresia. 

Although this humble mom makes a living through selling milk, she faces the challenge of irrigating her farm and providing water to her animals. Kapsowar is a remote area without piped water or electricity. Since Teresia is from a marginalized community, she is forced to walk long distances to search for water. She typically walks for two hours. 

Therefore, Teresia is requesting a loan to buy a water tank. Most of the rain water in her area goes to waste, and Teresia wants to harvest the water and store it in a water tank. The loan will save Teresia time and allow her to irrigate her farm during dry seasons and increase her productivity. The increase in productivity will translate into more income, which will provide Teresia with financial security. Teresia will also use the stored water for home consumption. 

Teresia's dream is to increase her farming activities and provide her children with a proper education. Education is the only way that her children, who are from a marginalized community, can succeed.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen lives with his family in Tsovagyugh, a village in the Gegharkunik region of Armenia. He is married with one son. 

From a very young age, Armen has been engaged in farming. Over the years, little by little, he has established and enlarged his farm which is the sole source of income for his family. 

Currently his farm is made up of 4 cows, 3 calves, 6 sheep, and 10 chickens. Armen mainly does all the farm work himself, since their child is still small and his wife is busy caring for him. He sells his farm products - milk, meat, and eggs - at the city‘s wholesale market several times a week. He also cooperates with some local butchers who purchase the meat he produces. 

Now, Armen hopes that his first partnership with Kiva's lenders and Nor Horizon will enhance his farm’s income and lighten the burden of his many financial problems, especially during the winter season.

This 500,000 AMD loan he is requesting will be used to purchase 2 calves, 2 sheep, and fodder for his livestock. He offers his thanks in advance and hopes to enjoy his relationship with Kiva and its field partner Nor Horizon.

loans.use: to buy 2 calves, 2 sheep, and livestock fodder.

loans.name: Munkaila

texts.en:
Munkaila is a maize farmer from Barangwaje Village in Kaduna state, Nigeria.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Munkaila would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Munkaila can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.  Munkaila, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for his family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing.

loans.name: Murtala

texts.en: Murtala is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Murtala would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Murtala can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Like other Babban Gona members, Murtala is looking to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family, and he hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Nhóm 8 - Kim Định 01 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Mung, 48, works in agricultural production with a monthly income of VND 600,000. She currently supports two children, one is in high school and the other is in university. She has been a member of the local Women's Union since 1988. 

Currently, her house still has no hygienic toilet. With this loan, Mung will build a septic tank latrine to improve her family's quality of life. This also will help her family to stay healthy by avoiding diseases and infections associated with using an unsafe latrine. In the picture, she stands in the middle of the front row.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine with a device for hand washing with soap

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina is 36 years old, married and has four children. Her husband is a tricycle driver providing motorcycle transport services to the people in their village. Gina wants to help improve her husband's business so has asked for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy gasoline and pay for maintenance of the motorcycle. This will also help ensure safe travel for all of their passengers. Additional revenue will be kept for revolving capital in the business and for emergency purposes.

loans.use: to buy gasoline and pay for the maintenance of the motorcycle

loans.name: Edlyn

texts.en: Edlyn has been involved in the furniture business for 16 years. She is a 31-year-old married woman, with three children. Two of her children are attending school, while her youngest child is still an infant. Edlyn makes bed and dining sets. She also engages herself in farming, and a direct selling business. With the support of her husband, she has been able to manage her businesses well. Now, she is in need of financial assistance to keep her furniture business profitable. She is seeking a loan of 10,000 PHP. She will utilize this amount to buy stock of raw wood to improve the quality of her finished furniture products.

loans.use: to buy stock of raw wood for her furniture business

loans.name: Al Ekhwaa Group

texts.en:
Mona is the featured borrower for Al Ekhwaa Group. She got together with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and standards of living at the same time.

Mona is a 50-year-old married mother of six children who has sold clothes from her house for the past two years to help her husband in covering the increasing needs and expenses of their family.

Mona is a hard worker and ambitious woman who is trying desperately to develop her business. Thus she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with a new collection of clothes to satisfy her customers' needs during the winter season.

Mona is the first woman on the right of the photo. With respect to the other group members, Eman is the woman sitting in the middle, and the second Mona is the first one on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with a new collection of clothes to satisfy her customers' needs during the winter season

loans.name: Dúo Unidos Por Gracia Group

texts.es:
DUO UNIDOS POR GRACIA
Doña Emiliana es originaria de la aldea Xetzac, municipio de Tecpan,  tiene 48 años de edad, bajo su responsabilidad están sus dos hijas, ella  se dedica a la venta de refacciones y comida en la plaza municipal del Municipio.
Gracias al apoyo de sus hijas ella sigue adelante con su negocio ya que con esfuerzo y trabajo esta luchando para salir adelante.
Ella  sueña en  ampliar mas su negocio ofrecer mas variedad de productos a sus clientes ya que asi ella obtendrá mejores ganancias y mejorar su calidad de vida.
El crédito que ella recibió lo invirtió en compra de materia prima para su venta de refaccion, en esta oportunidad esta solicitando un nuevo credito para la compra de productos comestibles para la elaboracion de comidas para vender.
texts.en:
DUO UNIDOS POR GRACIA

Emiliana is a native of the Xetzac village in the Tecpan municipality.  She is 48 years old and has two daughters.  She makes a living selling snacks and food in the municipal market. She continues with her business thanks to the support she receives from her daughters. It takes a lot of effort and work to continue to get ahead. She dreams of expanding her business and offering a larger variety of products to her customers, this way she could make more profit and improve the quality of her life. She invested the loan she received in the purchase of raw materials for her snack sales.  
This time she is requesting a new loan to buy ingredients to prepare food for sale.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients to prepare food to sell.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 41 years old, married and has three children, two currently in school.

Elsa is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Elsa requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Elsa has been pig fattening for one year now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Elsa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Loselyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Loselyn works hard to support her family.

She has a business farming rice in the Philippines.  Loselyn is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to  buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested this loan to further build her business.

Loselyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilzer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is married and works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines.  Magdalena is borrowing 18,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Magdalena has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Roberto Enrique

texts.es:
La sala de la casa de Roberto está adornada de fotos de su familia, de adornos y, por supuesto, de la mercadería que vende desde hace ocho años. Las sillas de niños, cubiertos, retraterías, abanicos, bolsos, entre otros productos. Este comerciante de 47 años inició con una pequeña pulpería teniendo la esperanza de salir adelante con su esposa y sus dos hijos de 16 y 7 años de edad, para luego agregar ahí mismo una línea de créditos para ofrecer productos caseros. 
Roberto es conocido por su responsabilidad, por ser un hombre trabajador y ser un visionario que no deja pasar ninguna oportunidad, por lo que solicita un crédito para comprar electrodomésticos para agregar a su mercadería de venta. Él considera que el agregar un nuevo producto generará mayor fluidez en la venta, permitiéndole incrementar sus ingresos y comenzar ahorrar para ampliar su negocio a otros departamentos del país. Entre sus planes está mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Robert's living room is decorated with family photos, decorations, and, of course, the merchandise that he has been selling for eight years: children's chairs, silverware, photography items, fans, bags, and other products. This 47-year-old merchant started off with a small store and the hope to succeed for the sake of his wife and two children ages 7 and 16. He hoped to start a line of credit to sell home products.
Robert is known for his responsibility, for being a hard-working man, and for being a visionary who never lets an opportunity pass. He is requesting a loan to purchase home electronics to increase his stock. He thinks that increasing his stock will generate better sales volume, allowing him to increase his income and to start to save up in order to expand his business to other parts of the country.
His plans include improving his home.

loans.use: to buy home electronics.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is a 41-year-old married mother of six children, five in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Arlene has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. Arlene requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional spare parts and pay for other maintenance.

Arlene has been in this business for six years. In the future, Arlene would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional spare parts and pay for other maintainance

loans.name: Louela

texts.en:
Louela works hard to support her family. Louela is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like frozen foods and spices, and charcoal.

Louela has been in this business for eight years now.

In the future, Louela would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like frozen foods and spices, and charcoal

loans.name: Dayabu

texts.en:
Dayabu is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Dayabu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his child: Kabiru.  

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Dayabu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Dayabu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Dayabu  spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his child, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: To pay for children's school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating the pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Monalie

texts.en:
Monalie is 57 years old and is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Monalie has a buy-and-sell dry goods business in the Philippines. Monalie requested a PHP 23,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more dry goods like blouses, t-shirts, and pants to sell to her customers.

Monalie has been in this business for three years. In the future, Monalie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more dry goods like blouses, t-shirts, and pants to sell to her customers

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.en:
Asuncion is 69 years old and married with four children. Asuncion works very hard to provide for her family.

Asuncion runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, and groceries..

Asuncion has been in this business for nine years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Asuncion would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, and groceries.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred works hard to support her family. She is married and has a restaurant business in the Philippines, which she has been running for 6 years now.

Mildred has requested a 24,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy ingredients for her restaurant like meat, vegetables, canned goods, etc. 

In the future, Mildred would like to build and expand her business so she can secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her restaurant such as meat, vegetables, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Rasimu

texts.en: Rasimu is a maize farmer from Hana Aiki village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Rasimu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater to his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Rasimu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Rasimu, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for his family and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Maria Theresa

texts.en:
Maria Theresa is a 53-year-old married mother of four children, one currently in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Maria Theresa has a buy-and-sell ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines. Maria Theresa requested a PHP 19,500 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional ready-to-wear clothing to sell in her customers.

Maria Theresa has been in this business for eight years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of his family.

loans.use: to buy additional ready-to-wear clothing to sell to her customers

loans.name: Nhóm 11 - Kim Định 01 Group

texts.en:
Linh, pictured first on the right in the first row, is 18 years old and works in agricultural production. She is married and hasn't had any children yet. She has been a member of the local Women's Union since 2014. 

Currently, her family does not have access to a hygienic toilet. Like other group members of Group 11 - Kim Dinh 01, Linh will use the loan to build a sanitary toilet and a hand-washing device with soap to improve living conditions and contribute to environmental protection.

loans.use: To pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine with a device for hand-washing with soap

loans.name: Htein Ta Piin Village

texts.en:
This community is located in Htein Ta Piin Village in Myanmar's Ayeyarwadduy Delta region. In this community, five community based organization (CBO) members oversee a group of fifteen village customers (nine male, six female). This loan will help the community purchase ducks, rebuild their duck farms (the cost is $100 for the whole duck farm and $15 for the stage), and purchase high-quality duck feed (a $22 packet feeds 100 ducks for six days).

The villagers mostly are farmers who also raise livestock. In addition to ducks, villagers raise pigs and chicken. Households sometimes open small grocery stores at home for additional income. 

The above picture shows the CBO leaders from Htein Ta Piin Village. Their names are U Chit, U Soe, Daw Ohm, U The, and U Hla. Included in the picture is U Chit (in the middle), who is 60 years old and divorced. He lives with his daughter and grandchildren. U Chit sometimes works on his two acre crop farm, but he mainly focuses on his duck raising business. Among his 300 ducks, 200 lay eggs every day.  Proximity Designs' loan will enable U Chit to buy better feed to increase his egg output, and thus his income.

loans.use: to help the villagers purchase ducks, rebuild duck farms, and purchase high-quality inputs

loans.name: Deziderio

texts.en:
Deziderio deals in cattle as well as grows bananas. He is a 48-year-old hardworking, married father of 6 children who lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He started his businesses to boost his income and meet his family’s increasing demands. 

Deziderio faces the hardship of low yields due to a dry spell. There is a lack of both water and pastures for his animals. 

Deziderio dreams of building a permanent home. He plans to use the loan to buy more cows to resell.

loans.use: to buy more cows to resell.

loans.name: Nhóm 9 - Kim Định 01 Group

texts.en:
Thảo, pictured second from the right in the first row, is 27 years old and works in agriculture production.  She is married and has a little child currently attending kindergarten.  She has been a member of the local Women's Union since 2007.  

Currently, her family does not have access to a hygienic, sanitary toilet facility.  Like other group members of Group 09 - Kim Định 01, Thảo will use the loan to build a toilet with a septic tank an a hand-washing device with soap to improve living conditions, improve the health of family members, and contribute to environmental protection.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine with a device for hand-washing with soap.

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
Cherry is 46 years old and married.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Cherry has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from frozen foods.

Cherry aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Thadyam2 Group

texts.fr: Korotimi, membre représentatif du groupe Thadyam2 est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle fait le commerce des chaussures, des pagnes et en plus de cela, elle fait la restauration. Vu le volume de ses activités, elle a un employé qui l'aide moyennant un salaire mensuel. Cette femme battante a besoin de ce prêt pour acheter ses articles vendre et renforcer son restaurant. A l'issue des ventes, le bénéfice lui permettra de continuer ses activités et de contribuer à la gestion financière de sa famille.
texts.en: Korotimi, the representative of the group Thadyam2, is married and a mother of 5 children. She sells shoes, fabrics and on top of that she does catering. Given the volume of her activities, she has an employee who helps her for a monthly salary. Korotimi, who is a driven woman, needs this loan to purchase items to sell and to reinforce her restaurant. As a result of the sales, the earnings will allow her to continue her business and to contribute to her family's financial management.

loans.use: to purchase shoes and pagnes of various quality to sell.

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en: Hello lenders, meet Sharon. She is a 20-year-old smallholder farmer based in Kitale, which is a small rural town near the famous Rift valley of Kenya. Sharon and her husband are blessed to have four children. Sharon has been a mixed-farmer for more than seven years. She keeps cows for milk, poultry for eggs and grows maize and vegetables for sale. She also holds a day job and engages in small businesses on the side whenever an opportunity crosses her path. Despite the rapid fluctuation of prices in the market, Sharon is very passionate and optimistic about the future of horticultural farming in Kenya. Sharon is seeking a loan to expand her horticultural farm. This move is quite a big deal for her. With your loan, Sharon seeks to continue growing different varieties of crops but on a greater scale. The demand for vegetables and other greens in Kitale and other parts of the country is very high. Income from this venture will negate the high farming expenses she has to deal with currently. In the long run, with increased income, she will finally be able to satisfy her family’s basic needs. She stated, “In the future, I will be able to provide food for my family and also educate my children.”

loans.use: To grow her horticulture business

loans.name: Abraham

texts.en: Abraham is a 30-year-old married man living in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He used the previous loan to buy his own motorcycle. He was inspired to have his own motorcycle after seeing that he would submit 50% of his earnings to the motorcycle owner; yet if he bought his own he could make more money. His challenges are high transportation costs and seasonal weather. His dream is to educate his children and to buy more motorcycles to make more income. Abraham needs the loan for another motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.name: Jose Danilo

texts.es:
Lo que empezó como un pasatiempo y una forma de entretenerse, llevó a José a emprender en un negocio que poco a poco se ha ido convirtiendo en el sustento de su día a día y la ha convertido en una persona independiente. Este joven de 28 años, ya graduado de la universidad, tiene seis años de haber iniciado en el negocio de renta de video juegos, para después con una visión más grande colocar un cibercafé que complementara el negocio.
José sueña con seguir ampliando el negocio y en convertirse en un líder en el mercado. Afortunadamente cuenta con el apoyo de su hermano y con remesas de su familia, quienes lo han impulsado a seguir creciendo, por lo que solicita un préstamo para comprar un par de computadoras y video juegos para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, lo que le generará mayores ingresos. Entre sus planes está seguir  creciendo e innovando en su negocio.
texts.en:
What started as a past-time and a form of entertainment brought José to start a business that has been becoming little by little his daily livelihood and he has become an independent person. This 28 year old youth has already graduated from university. He has been in the video game rental business for six years and for later he has a grander vision of a cybercafe to complement the business.

José dreams of continuing to expand the business and becoming a market leader. Fortunately he has the support of his brother and help from his family who have motivated him to continue growing which is why he is asking for a loan to buy a couple of computers and video games in order to satisfy the needs of his customers which will generate higher earnings. Among his plans are to continue growing and innovating his business.

loans.use: to buy a couple of computers and some video games

loans.name: Hernan Reyneldo

texts.es:
Herman de 38 años de edad, estudio hasta 9°grado de educación básica y no continuó debido a que su familia no pudo seguir pagándolos, tenía que recorrer enormes distancias y quedarse a dormir en otro lado además tenía que ayudar a su padre en el trabajo por lo que no se podía quedar fuera de su casa. Está acompañado su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos y han procreado un hijo de 9 años de edad.

Herman es chofer de un autobús, tiene dos años trabajando de esta manera, aprendió cuando de joven trabajó con su padre que transportaba materiales en un camión y él lo manejaba. Además en los días libres trabaja la tierra para que cuando tenga cosechas abundantes vende una parte. Su horario de trabajo es de 7:00 am a 6:00 pm de lunes a sábado. 

Solicita el préstamo para comprar fertilizantes, semilla de tomate, pepino y ejote y preparar el terreno de siembra, con lo que espera tener buenos resultados y algún día cambiar de trabajo por uno menos riesgoso y que no se vea comprometido por la delincuencia actual, también quiere ampliar su casa.
texts.en:
Herman, age 38, studied up to grade 9 and did not continue because his family could not pay for it. He had to travel long distances and stay overnight; but he also had to help his father with the work, so it wasn't possible for him to stay away from home.
He is in a relationship; his partner does the housework. They have a 9-year-old child.
Herman is a bus driver. He has been doing this for two years and learned the work when he was young. He worked with his father, who transported materials in a truck, and he drove it. On top of this, on his free days he works the land so that he can sell part of his abundant harvest. He works from 7 am to 6 pm Monday to Saturday.
He is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers and tomato, cucumber and green bean seeds to plant. With this, he hopes for good results and to one day change his work for a less-risky job that won't be threatened by crime. He also wants to expand his home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and tomato, cucumber, and green bean seeds.

loans.name: Basiru

texts.en:
Basiru is a maize farmer.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Basiru would have to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater to his immediate cash needs. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Basiru can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.  Like other Babban Gona members, Basiru is looking to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing.

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es:
Juan de 57 años de edad, está casado y tiene cuatro hijos, su esposa es comerciante y tiene un comedor en el que vende alimentos durante el día y Juan la apoya. Además es empleado y trabaja como seguridad durante la noche en una escuela,  en vida aprendió diversos oficios con los que logró construir su casa, pero su principal trabajo fue siempre la vigilancia por más de 20 años y apoyar a su esposa en el negocio.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en el negocio de su esposa para abastecerlo comprando carnes, vegetales, bebidas y demás porque se acerca la temporada feriada en su comunidad y la comida es uno de los productos que más se venden. Esperando que resulte la inversión le gustaría mejorar el negocio de su esposa para que le dé más ganancias a la familia.
texts.en:
Juan, age 57, is married and has four children. His wife has an eatery where she sells food during the day, and Juan helps her. He is also employed and works as a nighttime security guard at a school. He has learned various jobs throughout his life, and from this knowledge has been able to build his home. His main job has always been in security and supporting his wife in the business; he has done this for 20 years.
He is requesting this loan to invest in his wife's business with stock. He will buy meat, vegetables, drinks, and more, because the holiday season is coming in his community and food is one of the most-sold products in that time. He hopes that this investment will happen; he would like to improve his wife's business so that it will bring in more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, drinks and more.

loans.name: Nhóm 14 -  Kim Định 01 Group

texts.en: Thuy, pictured first on the right in the first row, is a 22-year-old farmer with a  monthly income of VND 600,000. She is married and has one little child. She has been a member of the local Women's Union since 2012. Currently, her family does not have access to a hygienic toilet. With this loan, Thuy will install a toilet that will improve the quality of life for all of her family members and help her family and community to avoid diseases and infections commonly associated with unsanitary toilets.

loans.use: To pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine with a device for hand washing with soap.

loans.name: Francisco Jose

texts.es: Don Francisco tiene 43 años, está casado y es padre de tres hijos. Para sacar adelante a su familia él y su esposa luchan a diario. Mientras Francisco trabaja como taxista en las calles de Managua su esposa se dedica a la venta de ropa y cosméticos y encima elabora y vende deliciosos Nacatamales, comida típica de Nicaragua. Solo así les es posible pagar los gastos diarios del hogar y de la comida. Para poder mejorar su vivienda la pareja siempre solicita apoyo crediticio, por lo cual ya pudieron realizar varias obras en la casa. Este nuevo préstamo lo solicita Don Francisco para hacer el techo en las partes donde todavía falta y para instalar un nuevo portón. Esta obra le brindará más seguridad a su hogar y protegerá a la familia de las influencias climáticas.
texts.en:
Francisco is 43 years old, married and has three children. Francisco and his wife work hard every day in order to get ahead with his family, While Francisco works as a taxi driver in the city of Managua, his wife makes a living selling clothes and make-up. In addition, she prepares and sells delicious "nacatamales" (Nicaraguan tamales). 

Only through this work is it possible for the couple to pay daily household expenses and buy food. In order to improve their home, the couple always applies for loans. These have allowed Francisco and his wife to carry out various bits of work around the house.

Francisco is applying for this new loan in order to build a roof on parts of his home that still need one, and to install a main gate. This work will provide the family with more security and protect them from the climate.

loans.use: to purchase materials for building a roof and a main gate

loans.name: Jeramie

texts.en:
Jeremie is married and he works hard to support his family.

He has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a bicycle taxi. Jeremie is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for his food production business.

Jeremie has been sustaining his business activities through his past 15 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. He hopes that his hard work will help him to attain his dream of saving money in order to support the financial stability of his family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for his food production business.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF in order to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

Maricel successfully paid back her previous loan, and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Maricel's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Karla Mariela

texts.es:
Karla de 25 años de edad es soltera, no tiene hijos y estudia en la universidad, es comerciante y desde que realizaba sus estudios en bachillerato vendía productos femeninos por catálogos y al ver que le daba muy buenas ganancias decidió seguir trabajando de esta manera y así como paga sus estudios.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la comprar de prendas de vestir de diversos estilos juveniles y que están de moda en su comunidad, con lo que espera vender mucho gracias a la temporada navideña y con el dinero que obtenga espera seguir estudiando el año siguiente pues no dejara de luchar hasta lograr graduarse.
texts.en:
Karla, age 25, is single and has no children. She is in university and is also a businesswoman; when she started her bachelor's degree she also started selling women's products through catalogues. When she saw that it provides her with a good income, she decided to continue doing this in order to pay for her studies.
She is requesting this loan to invest in various styles of youth clothing that are in style in her community. She hopes to sell a lot thanks to the Christmas season. With the money she obtains, she hopes to continue her studies next year; she won't stop fighting until she achieves her graduation.

loans.use: to buy various styles of fashionable youth clothing.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Hello world! Meet Elizabeth, 28, a very dedicated mother who believes in hard work. She is happily married and blessed with four lovely children whom she often refers to as “my pride.” Elizabeth is based in Kapsowar, a small remote rural town in Kenya that has bad terrain and is characterized by drought and bad weather conditions. 

For the past five years, Elizabeth has been actively involved in mixed farming. Her primary sources of income are from milk and crop farming. Elizabeth passionately loves dairy farming and has nicknamed one of her cows. Although this humble mom makes a living through selling milk, she faces the challenge of controlling her cows from straying to her neighbors' farms. She is kindly requesting a loan to buy barbed wire to control her animals and to avoid incurring losses when paying for the crops damaged by her animals. This loan will also facilitate peaceful co-existence among Elizabeth and her neighbors.

loans.use: to buy barbed wire

loans.name: Marziya

texts.en:
Marziya was born in 1978 and has a higher education. She is married and has 4 children. All of them are young. Marziya’s husband is a migrant worker in Russia. For many years she has been busy in the tailoring business but now she works at a training center. She is a deputy director. She is a very hard-working woman.

Marziya always strives for the education of her children and she dreams of seeing her children with a higher education. Her son studies at the Turkey – Tajik lyceum and she must pay for her son’s education at the lyceum. She is asking for a loan to pay for her son's education. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to pay for her child's education.

loans.name: Lisania

texts.es:
Lisania de 31 años de edad, estudió hasta 9° grado de educación básica y no siguió debido al conflicto armado en el país en aquella época por lo que se vieron truncados sus sueños de poder estudiar. Es madre soltera de tres hijo de 12, 10 y 3 años de edad, su pareja la abandonó por lo que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos, que son los únicos que dependen de ella.

Lisania es comerciante y tiene una venta de tortillas en su casa en la que dedica su tiempo en horas de la mañana, pera que el resto del día lo trabaje en una casa como empleada doméstica hasta las 6:00 pm y mientras tanto su madre cuida de sus hijos. Solicita el préstamo para comprar una cocina de plancha para reemplazar la que tiene que ya está muy deteriorada y necesita una mejor y más grande para agilizar la elaboración de tortillas.

Lisania espera mejorar su negocio a tal grado de contratar a alguien que le ayude en la elaboración del producto y así con las ganancias procurar dar lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Lisania, age 31, studied until grade nine and was unable to continue due to armed conflict in her country at that time; her dreams of being able to study were cut short. She is a single mother of three children, ages 3, 10, and 12. Her partner abandoned them. With great hard work, she has been able to get her children ahead. They are the only people who depend on her.
Lisania is a merchant. She sells tortillas from her home; this takes up her time in the morning hours, but the rest of the day she works in a home as a domestic employee until 6 pm. During this time, her mother takes care of the children.
Lisania is requesting this loan for the purchase of a cooking plate to replace hers, since it is in very bad shape and she needs a bigger, better one to make tortillas.
She hopes to improve her business so much that she will be able to hire someone to help her make tortillas, and to use her income to give the best to her children.

loans.use: to buy a cooking plate.

loans.name: Abubakar

texts.en: Abubakar is a maize farmer from the village of Karofi in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Abubakar would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to provide for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Abubakar can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% more than the market price at harvest. Abubakar, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for his family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a maize farmer from Dogon Fako village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Hassan would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Hassan can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Hassan, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for his family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Azharchach

texts.en:
Azharchach is a freshman at the American University of Central Asia, in the Department of Psychology.  Here is her story:

“There are several reasons of my applying for a Kiva loan: The first and main reason is the lack of money.  I live with my mother and little sister.  My parents divorced many years ago and we don’t keep in touch with my father.  My mother is a teacher at school and my sister attends kindergarten.  My mother’s salary is not enough to cover our daily necessities even though she earns additional money selling the goods of “Oriflame” company.  So, my mother is not able to pay for my tuition fees at AUCA for which I kindly ask you to support me.

I was an active and diligent student at school.  Although I couldn’t afford English courses myself, I tried to find courses or lectures for free.  So in 2012 I was on the list of 29 students, who won a micro scholarship from the ACCESS program and learned English free of charge for two years.

In 2013 I was lucky to win AUCA’s full scholarship for the one-year-study program at New Generation Academy.  This time I was among the 70 students, who had a chance to live in the dormitory and to receive a monthly stipend.  The New Generation Academy aims to prepare its graduates for university education.  The program seeks to fill the gaps in the public school system to help high school graduates enter a university of their choice.

The second reason for my applying to Kiva is responsibility, which makes me extremely hard-working and cheerful.  The Kiva loan will help me to concentrate just on my studies, and achieve my desired academic and professional purpose.”

loans.use: to pay for her higher education.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: acheter des garnitures de couture pour ouvrir une mercerie

loans.name: Simeona

texts.en:
Simeona is 58 years old and widowed with five children.

Simeona works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like bread, canned goods, snack foods, cooking oil, soft drinks, biscuits, detergent soap, and other goods to sell.

Simeona has borrowed and repaid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from dress-making.

Simeona aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like bread, canned goods, snack foods, cooking oil, soft drinks, biscuits, detergent soap, and more to sell

loans.name: Jose Cecilio

texts.es:
José, vive únicamente con su compañera de vida, sus hijos son mayores e independientes pues ya tienen su propia familia, se dedica a trabajar en el campo cultivando granos básicos, lo ha practicado toda su vida y es así como ha dado el sustento diario a su familia, actualmente es apoyado por su compañera de vida.
Invertirá en el pago de mozos para recolectar la cosecha y comprara cosechas de granos básicos a otros agricultores, tendrá mejor productividad, almacenara el producto para luego venderlo al menudeo a mejor precio, con ello busca tener una situación financiera mucho más estable y resarcir su deuda.
Su visión es utilizar el crédito de la mejor manera para obtener mayores ganancias con las que mejorara su negocio y tendrá un mejor estilo de vida familiar.
texts.en:
José lives with just his partner. His children are now independent adults who have their own families. José makes a living working in the fields growing basic grains. He has done this work all of his life, and it allowed him to support his family. José receives support from his partner in his work.

This loan will be used to pay labourers to bring in the harvest and to buy harvests of basic grains from other farmers. With this loan, José will have higher productivity and will store his products in order to sell it retail at a better price at a later date. With this loan, José wants to stabilise his financial situation and pay off his debt.

José plan is to use this loan as best he can in order to earn higher profits to improve his business and his family's lifestyle.

loans.use: to pay labourers to bring in the harvest and to buy harvests of basic grains from other farmers.

loans.name: Librada

texts.en:
Librada is 54 years old and married with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Librada has a cafeteria business in the Philippines. Librada requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of sugar, milk, coffee and utensils for her cafeteria.

Librada has been in this business for two years. In the future, Librada would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of sugar, milk, coffee and utensils for her cafeteria.

loans.name: Restituta

texts.en:
Restituta works hard to support her family. She is married and has a videoke machine rental business in the Philippines.

Restituta requested a PHP 19,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy spare parts for the maintenance of the machine and to pay electric bills.

Restituta has been in this business for 13 years now. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her videoke machine and to pay electric bills.

loans.name: José Esteban

texts.es: La agricultura es parte esencial de la vida de José Esteban, se dedica a sembrar maíz y hortalizas. Este es el segundo crédito que solicita ya que el primero le fue de mucha ayuda porque logro comprar insumos y abonos para la siembra de maíz en la cual obtuvo buena producción. Esta vez solicita el crédito para comprar abono y aplicarlo a la nueva siembra de maíz. De esta manera podrá tener mejor rendimiento en la siembra y obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Agriculture is an essential part of the life of José Esteban. He makes a living growing corn and leafy vegetables.

This is the second loan that he is requesting, since his first loan was a great help to him. With his first loan, he managed to buy supplies and fertilizers for cultivating corn, and it yielded a good crop. 

This time, he is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and use it on his new cultivation of corn. With this, his crop will have a better output, and he will earn more profit.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and use it on his new cultivation of corn.

loans.name: Manyama Devt Group

texts.en:
The group is located in rural area called Manyama and comprises nine members, both men and women, namely: Beatrice, Ruth, Passy, Fred, Francis, Abas, Mathias, Fred, and Abasi. They carry out different activities, which include retail, charcoal trading, grocery, farming, teaching, local brewing, and stalls.

Mathias, the most well to do among them, is a married man aged 35, with two children, one attending school. He lives with the family in Manyama. He does farming alongside trading agricultural products such as corn,grain, beans and nuts. He works all seven days of the week and ten hours per day to maximize income. He started the business because it was more profitable, and is using this loan to buy more stock of grain, corn and beans to expand the business.

His clients are traders from different markets and those from nearby villages. His hopes for the future are to educate his children and also buy more land for farming. His challenge is limited capital.

He describes himself as an honest and hardworking man. He encourages fellow agriculturalists to be focused and resilient in order to achieve the fruits of their labour. He is hardworking and looks forward to a long-term partnership with Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy grain, corn and beans for his agricultural produce business.

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.en:
Dilorom is a hardworking woman. She was born in 1969. She lives far from region. She is married. She has two children. 

For almost ten years, she has had this business. She is planting seeds and working on the land. She works hard and progressively. 

She wants to increase her business. She is planning to buy fertilizer for seeds. She needs financial support for her agriculture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for seeds

loans.name: Deo

texts.en:
Deo used the previous loan to pay workers who are tilling his farm. He lives in Fort Portal, Uganda.  He has worked in agriculture for 10 years, and he is now one of the model farmers in his village.  He has a personal goal of educating his children, and he dreams of expanding his business to new markets and diversifying his business to include farming, despite the challenges in season variations. 

Deo needs the loan to hire (rent) a wine making machine, as he is going to do a wine making business in order to obtain more income and  pay workers who are tilling his farms.

loans.use: to hire (rent) a wine machine and  pay workers who are tilling his farms.

loans.name: Lilit

texts.en:
Lilit is divorced and she lives with her 11-year-old son and retired father in the cit of Sevan, in the Gegharkunik region. Lilit has always worked as a nurse, having completed her vocational education in this field. She now also works at one of the city’s kindergartens as a nurse. She also sometimes has orders from her neighbors and other people to give injections, for which she is paid. Since Lilit is the only breadwinner in her family, she hardly manages to make ends meet, as the family's needs are many and she cuts back greatly on her and her father's needs to provide her child with all she can. 

Lilit if feeling unwell and in pain, the cause of which she wants to find out. She cannot postpone looking into this problem since she is the only employed person in her family who is able to sustain their needs. Lilit is asking for a loan in order to have a medical examination to become aware of her health problem. She has great hopes that there will be nothing very serious and that she can work and take care of her lovely family as she used to for many years.

loans.use: to have a medical examination to become aware of her health problem, having great hopes that there will be nothing very serious

loans.name: Amosi

texts.en:
Amosi is a 32-year-old married man with two children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He has a cosmetics shop as his major source of income. He has been in this business for two years, and the business is steadily growing. He is very hard worker, and hopes to construct a house out of the proceeds from the business.

He wants a loan to buy cosmetics for selling.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics for selling.

loans.name: John Fredy

texts.es:
La pasión por las motocicletas está muy latente en el corazón de Fredy quien a sus 32 años tiene un taller de mecánica, su sonrisa de satisfacción y de alegría demuestra lo feliz que se siente a realizar su profesión y hace lo posible por mejorar cada día.
Fredy quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de repuestos de motocicletas, pues son de vital importancia a la hora de atender cualquier cliente.
texts.en:
The passion for motorcycles is very latent in the heart of Fredy who at 32 years of age has a mechanical workshop. His smile of satisfaction and joy shows how happy he is with his profession and he does what he can to improve each day.

Fredy wants a loan in order to buy motorcycle spare parts as they are of vital importance when servicing any customer.

loans.use: to buy spare motorcycle parts

loans.name: Maria Ana Gloria

texts.es:
María de 40 años de edad, estudió hasta 2nd grado de educación básica, tuvo que dejar el estudio porque su familia no podía pagárselos y además tenía que apoyar a su madre en los oficios de la casa. Esta acompañada y es madre de 6 hijos de 25, 23, 22, 19, 17 y 14 años de edad, de los que solo tres viven con ella.

María es comerciante y vende bocadillos típicos del país como atol, enchiladas, nuégado, yuca pan y además hace pupusas y cuenta con 14 años de experiencia en este negocio, tiene un local que decidió abrir gracias a que en la zona donde vive es visitada por un gran número de personas, por lo que inicio su negocio, atiende de 3:00 pm a 9:00 pm todos los días y le colaboran sus hijos.

Solicita el préstamo para comprar una cocina de plancha para hacer las pupusas, con una plancha le cuesta cubrir la demanda de sus clientes, aparte de que la que tiene esta deteriorada y necesita dos para despachar más rápido a los clientes. María sueña con diversificar las ventas para que su negocio mejore y espera también algún día realizar arreglos a su casa.
texts.en:
María, age 40, studied until grade 2. She had to stop because her family couldn't pay for it and she had to support her mother with the housework. She has a partner and six children ages 25, 23, 22, 19, 17 y 14. Only two of her children live with her.
Maria is a merchant and sells traditional foods such as atol [a cornflour drink], enchiladas, nougat, yucca bread, and pupusas [stuffed tortillas]. She has 14 years' experience in this business. She has a storefront which she decided to open because the area is frequented by many people. She is at her store from 3 pm to 9 pm every day. Her children help.
She is requesting this loan to buy a cooking plate to make the pupusas. With only one cooking plate it is hard to cover her clients' demand, and her current cooking plate is in bad shape. She needs two to be able to serve her customers more quickly. Maria dreams of diversifying her sales so that her business will improve, and she hopes one day to make some improvements to her home.

loans.use: to buy a cooking plate.

loans.name: Tuichi

texts.ru: Туйчи мужчина средних лет, женат и имеет 3 детей. Туйчи живет в сельской местности и занимается разведением и откормом крупного рогатого скота. Туйчи начал заниматься этим бизнесом в молодости, 15 лет назад. В начале он купил одного молодого бычка и пару баранов и потихоньку начал развивать свой бизнес. Сейчас он имеет более 10 голов взрослых быков. Туйчи является единственным кормильцем в семье и его бизнес это основной источник дохода. благодаря своему бизнесу Туйчи смог построить дом и дать образование своим детям. Туйчи приходиться много работать чтобы обеспечивать семью и с возрастом это все труднее и труднее. Жена Туйчи помогает по хозяйству мужу и ухаживает за скотом. На данный момент у Туйчи нехватка финансов чтобы закончить ремонт дома и с этой проблемой он обратился в "АРВАНД" за помощью. На полученные деньги Туйчи хочет купить окна и двери из дерева и установить их. Туйчи заранее благодарен организации за предоставление кредитов малоимущим сельским жителям.
texts.en:
Tuichi is a middle-aged man. He is married and has three children. He lives in a rural area and earns a living fattening and reselling cattle, a business he started 15 years ago. In the beginning he bought one young steer and a pair of rams and then gradually developed his business to the point where he currently has more than 10 head of full-grown steers. He is the only breadwinner in his family and his business is their primary source of income.

Thanks to his hard work, Tuichi has been able to build a house and educate his children. He has put a lot of effort into caring for his family and it is getting harder and harder as he gets older. His wife helps her husband with the farm and cares for the cattle. 

At the moment, Tuichi doesn't have enough money to complete construction of his home and has turned to Arvand for help with this problem. He wants to use the loan amount to purchase windows and wooden doors and install them. He thanks the organization in advance for lending money to rural residents living in poverty.

loans.use: to purchase and install of windows and doors

loans.name: Adau

texts.en:
Adau is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona Farmers Organization. Adau joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Mujadeen, Tijani, and Khali.  

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Adau would have had to sell his maize for low prices, soon after harvest, to cater to his immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Adau can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later, for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Adau spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to pay for children's school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Lubian Antonio

texts.es:
Lubian un responsable, atento hombre de 30 años de edad, trabajador, emprendedor, sonriente, responsable y por encima de todo honrado.
Padre de dos hijas de 6 y 3 años de edad una bebes que hace todo lo posible pro que vistan bien, pro que puedan estudiar y tener bases para ser grandes personas.
Lubian es vendedor de mercancía, jean y zapato deportivo y solicita un crédito para la compra de mercancía en zapato deportivo, tu ayuda puede hacer que Lubian salga a vender sus productos y pueda generar ingresos para darles un regalo de navidad a sus dos hijas.
texts.en:
Lubian is a responsible and attentive man, 30 years old. He is hard-working, enterprising, smiling, responsible, and above all honest. 

He is the father of two daughters, aged 6 and 3. He does everything he can so that his babies will look good, have the chance to study, and have the foundation they need to be successful people. 

Lubian is a vendor of merchandise, jeans and sport shoes. He is requesting a loan in order to buy sport shoes as merchandise for his business. Your help can ensure that Lubian can go out to sell his products and can generate income to give a Christmas present to his two daughters.

loans.use: to buy sport shoes to sell.

loans.name: Nhóm 12 - Kim Định 01 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Phuong, pictured in the middle of the first row, is a 21-year-old farmer who earns VND 600,000 monthly. She is supporting her little child. 

She has been a member of the local Women's Union since 2013. Currently, her family does not have a hygienic toilet. With this loan, Phuong will install a toilet that will help to improve the quality of life for all of her family members. 

This will help her family and the community to avoid diseases and infections commonly associated with unsanitary toilets.

loans.use: To pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine with a device for hand-washing with soap

loans.name: Nhóm 4 - Định Hóa 01 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Quyen, pictured first in the right, is 45 years old. Her family works in agricultural production, and is listed as a poor family. She has two children who are currently in school. 

With this loan, Quyen will build a sanitary toilet that will improve the quality of life for all of her family members and help the community avoid diseases and infections commonly associated with unsanitary toilets. She has been a member of the local Women's Union since 1994.
