loans.use: To pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine with a device for hand-washing with soap

loans.name: Aissa's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe créé en novembre 2013,est composé de membres qui habitent le même village,elles ont pour activité le petit commerce.Elles sont solidairement liés pour la responsabilité du crédit

Aminata,qui sa trouve à droite de la photo et levant le bras,est la responsable du groupe,elle est mariée,est âgée de 37 ans et mére de 08 enfants dont 06 garçons.

Son activité consiste à acheter et revendre les sacs d'arachide.

Ainsi,elle compte acheter 10 sacs d'arachide pour une valeur de 100000f.

Son objectif est d'augmenter son épargne et aider son mari à assurer la dépense quotidienne.
texts.en:
This group, which was created in November 2013, is made up of members who live in the same village. They have the small business as an activity. They are all mutually responsible for the loan. 

Aminata, who is shown on the right-side of the picture with her arm raised, is in charge of the group. She is married, 37 years old and is a mother of 8 children, 6 of which are boys. 

Her business consists of buying and reselling bags of peanuts. 

She expects to purchase 10 bags of peanuts worth 100000f.

Her goal is to increase her savings and to help her husband take care of daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy bags of peanuts for resale.

loans.name: Shahlo

texts.en:
Shahlo is a hardworking woman. She lives in a rural area. She is married. She has three children. Her husband is an agrarian. 

About three months as she started a business. She works hard on the land. She is planting seeds for forage. 

Shahlo is planning to buy cattle for starting a new business. She wants to feed cattle and sell them in a market. 

Shahlo is asking for financial support to buy cattle. She would be pleased to be supported.

loans.use: To buy cattle to increase her new business

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es:
Jesus tiene 52 años de edad, es casado, vive con su cónyuge y sus 03 hijos en una casa de material rústico en la provincia de Callayuc, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. Las actividades económicas principales que se desarrollan en este distrito son la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

El se dedica al cultivo del café, realiza esta actividad desde hace 10 años y cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales como comerciales por parte de los pobladores de la zona. El préstamo será utilizado para la compra de abonos y fertilizantes para realizar el mantenimiento de su cultivo de café, con esto Jesus esperar mejorar la calidad del producto que ofrecerá a sus clientes, logrando así incrementar su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Jesus is 52 years old, married, and lives with his wife and their 3 children in a house made of rustic materials in the province of Callayuc, in the region of Cajamarca, in the northern mountains of Perú. The main occupations that people have in this district are in the fields of agriculture, ranching, and commerce.

Jesus makes a living growing coffee. He has been doing this for 10 years, and he has very good personal recommendations from residents in this area, including sales people. This loan will be used to buy organic fertilizers and other fertilizers to maintain his coffee crop. With this, Jesus hopes to improve the quality of his product that he will offer to his customers, and manage to increase his income and improve the quality of his life and the life of his family as a result.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers and other fertilizers to maintain his coffee crop.

loans.name: Urkupi¥A Group

texts.es:
Clara es una mujer de 34 años de edad, soltera, tiene 2 hijos de 4 y 15 años, y su negocio es la manicura.
Ella es paciente, buena oyente, buena madre, emprendedora, responsable y 
comprometida con su trabajo. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘Sur’ de la ciudad un lugar que reúne una vez al año cerca de mil artesanos en la denominada feria de ‘la Alasita’ dónde se oferta todo tipo de bienes en miniatura con el fin de que esa miniatura se materialice y se haga realidad. De clima cálido tropical muy húmedo con una temperatura constante de 30 grados aproximadamente durante todo el año.
Clara es de tez morena, cabello negro largo, baja estatura, ojos obscuros, su lengua materna es el Guaraní y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza (la primera de la derecha, polera con estampado de tigre). Su vida la comparte con sus hijos; el mayor estudia en la escuela, el menor aún no está en edad escolar. Su deseo de progresar y abastecer a su familia la llevo a liderar una banca de personas con actividades comerciales como; servicio de transporte, tienda de videos, venta de vajillas, venta de celulares, venta de carne de pollo, venta de flores y servicio de té, para solicitar un préstamo y ampliar sus negocios. Su actividad principal es de manicurista; ella se ocupa del cuidado de las manos y los pies de los clientes, en un salón de belleza donde trabaja como empleada. “Una parte fundamental dentro de la carta de presentación de una persona son sus manos y ahora con el buen tiempo también los pies…” comenta. Su segunda actividad es la repostería; ella hornea variedad de masitas tradicionales a base de yuca, queso y harina de arroz. Ambas actividades abastecen la canasta familiar de su familia. Su sueño es tener su propio salón de belleza. Ella desea independizarse y realizar el servicio de manicura a domicilio, para lograrlo necesitar realizar la compra de materiales de trabajo, vasijas, toallas, pinzas, tijeras, aceites y otros. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que viene desarrollando esta actividad de forma independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Clara solicita un préstamo para la compra de instrumentos de manicura para independizarse y tener su salón de belleza propio.
texts.en:
Clara is a 34-year-old woman. She is single with two children yes 4 and 15. She is a manicurist.
She is patient, a good listener, a good mother, enterprising, responsible, and committed to her work.
She runs her business in the south zone of the city, where once a year around a thousand artisans join together in the La Alasita market to sell all kinds of miniature goods with the goal that the miniatures will materialize and become reality. The region has a warm and very humid climate with a constant temperature of 30 degrees year round.
Clara is dark-skinned with long black hair. She is short and has dark-coloured eyes. Her mother tongue is Guarani and she speaks Spanish due to the general culture and for her business. She is pictured first on the right with the tiger shirt. 
She shares her life with her children. The eldest is in school, but the youngest is not yet school-aged. She wants to progress and support her family; this desire has brought her to become the leader of a communal bank whose members' businesses include: transportation services, a video store, flatware sales, cell phone sales, chicken sales, flower sales, and a tea service. The group's purpose is to request a loan and expand the members' businesses. Clara mainly works as a manicurist. She cares for the hands and feet of her customers in a beauty salon where she works as an employee. "A fundamental part of a person's personal presentation is their hands, and now, with the good weather, their feet", she says.
Her second source of income comes from desserts. She bakes a variety of traditional yucca, cheese, and rice flour-based pastries.
Both activities support her family. Her dream is to have her own beauty salon. She wants to become independent and provide manicures from her home. To do this, she needs to purchase materials such as flatware, towels, tongs, scissors, and oils. 
This is her second loan sequence with the institution in the year that she has been doing this activity independently.
For these reasons, Clara is requesting a loan for the purchase of manicure supplies to become independent and have her own beauty salon.

loans.use: to purchase manicure supplies in order to have her own beauty salon.

loans.name: Wilber Moises

texts.es:
Wilber, tiene un negocio de venta de ropa para adultos y niños/as, al realizar esta actividad obtiene ingresos que utiliza para cubrir las necesidades básicas familiares, no tiene ayuda económica de otras personas, Wilber está acompañado, es padre de una niña de 6 años de edad. Vende ropa todos los días en el mercado municipal y cuenta con muchos clientes establecidos.
Invertirá en pantalones, camisas, vestidos, ropa interior, etc., mejorará las ofertar a sus clientes, tendrá mayor capacidad de pago con las nuevas ventas y responderá a sus diferentes compromisos con puntualidad.
Sus proyectos son lograr tener casa propia y compartir con su familia un nivel de vida más confortable.
texts.en:
Wilber's in a relationship and is the father of a six-year-old little girl.

Wilber has a business selling clothing for adults and children.  He sells clothing every day in the town market and has a lot of steady customers.  With this job he earns the income he uses to cover his basic family necessities.  He has no financial help from other people.

He's going to invest in pants, shirts, dresses, underwear, etc.  He'll improve what he offers his customers, have a greater payment capacity with his new sales, and fulfill his various commitments on time.

His projects are to have his own house and to share a more comfortable standard of living with his family.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, dresses, underwear, etc.  He'll improve what he offers his customers and have a greater payment capacity with the new sales.

loans.name: Kevin Edemir

texts.es:
Kevin, de 27 años de edad, estudió hasta 6° grado, está acompañado, tiene 2 hijos de 3 y 6 años, su esposa es comerciante.

Kevin, trabaja desde la edad de 15 años, tiene mucha experiencia en la actividad de panaderías; la cual ha sido su única fuente de ingresos durante todo este tiempo.


Desde muy temprano se levanta para iniciar con la elaboración de pan, en el transcurso de la tarde alista su motocicleta para ir a comercializarlo, de esta forma genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos del hogar.- Además, de la pequeña tienda que posee que es atendida por su esposa.


El crédito sera invertido para comprar utensilios y materia prima como, harina, azúcar y levadura para la panadería.

Kevin, logro cumplir uno de sus sueños, el cual era tener una pequeña tienda.- Ahora,  su sueño es que la panadería crezca y de los resultados esperados, para asegurar más los ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Kevin is 27 years old. He studied until the sixth grade. He is married, has two children of 3 and 6 years old, and his wife is a saleswoman.

Kevin has worked since he was 15 years old and has a lot of experience with bakeries, which have been his only source of income throughout his life. 

He wakes up very early to begin making bread. During the afternoon he utilizes his motorcycle to go around selling bread. In this way he generates income to cover household expenses. And, the small store he has is attended by his wife.

The loan will be used to purchase utensils and raw material, such as flour, sugar and leaven, for the bakery.

Kevin was able to fulfill one of his dreams, which was to have a small store. Now his dream is that the bakery will grow, and that when this occurs he will be able to improve his family's income.

loans.use: to purchase supplies and ingredients for his bakery.

loans.name: Pascal

texts.en:
Pascal has a cyber cafe business in the town of Mombasa and has been running this business for two years. He also has a car wash business. He is 42 years old, married, and he and his spouse have been blessed with two children.

He will use this loan to buy a car wash machine. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business.

This is his first loan term from VisionFund Kenya and in the future he hopes to have a prosperous business and a happy family.

loans.use: To buy a car washing machine.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy a new engine for her fishing boat for her fishing business.

Jesusa successfully paid back her previous loan, and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Jesusa's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Adamu

texts.en:
Adamu is a maize farmer from Kadanya Biyar village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Adamu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Adamu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Adamu, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for his family, and hopes to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Jose Nehemias

texts.es:
José de 22 años de edad, está acompañado y tiene un hijo de un año de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, su esposa es ama de casa y se dedica también a cuidar a su hijo, solo ella y su hijo viven con él.

José es empleado de una cooperativa en su comunidad, trabaja cuidando las plantaciones de café y también es socio de esta. También es agricultor de hortalizas y por eso necesita el crédito, para comprar fertilizantes y plaguicidas para la parcela en la que está trabajando con su pareja. La aspiración más grande de José es que con fruto de su trabajo mejore las condiciones de vida de su familia y tenga el gusto de ver a su hijo preparado profesionalmente.
texts.en:
José, age 22, has a wife and a one-year-old child. He did not have the opportunity to study. His wife is a housewife and also cares for their child. The three of them live alone together.
José is employed by and a member of a community cooperative. He takes care of coffee crops. He is also a vegetable farmer. He needs a loan for his vegetables, to buy fertilizers and pesticides for the land that he works with his wife.
His biggest dream is to, with the fruit of his labour, improve his family's living conditions. He wants to see his child become a professional.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Abdulkadir

texts.en:
Abdulkadir is a 27-year-old married man with two children, living in Kyenjojo, Uganda.  He deals in Agriculture, producing beans, maize, rice and groundnuts, depending on the season.  He also earns additional income from commercial farming by growing crops on a large scale.  

He is faced with the problem of climatic changes such as rain and drought which affects the fields negatively.  Abdulkadir therefore, wants a loan to purchase more beans and maize to sell.

loans.use: to purchase more beans and maize to sell.

loans.name: Nhóm 6 - Định Hóa 01 Group

texts.en: Nhung, pictured first from the right in the first row, is 34 years old. Her husband is paralyzed on the left side. Her two children are currently in school. Her family is a poor family. With this VND 8 million loan, Nhung will build a sanitary toilet that will help her family to stay healthy by avoiding diseases and infections associated with using an unsafe latrine. She has been a member of the local Women's Union since 2002.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine with a device for hand washing with soap.

loans.name: Nhóm 9 - Định Hóa 01 Group

texts.en: Duyen, pictured second from the right, is a 52-year-old farmer with a monthly income of VND 500,000. Since her husband passed away, she has to raise her three children by herself. Her family is a poor family and does not have a sanitary toilet. With this loan, she will have a hygienic toilet installed in her home. This will improve the health of family members and contribute to environmental protection. She has been an active member of the Women's Union since 1992.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine with a device for hand washing with soap.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy calves to raise.

loans.name: Mohira

texts.en: Mohira is a strong woman. She was born in 1984. She lives in a rural area. She is married. She has two children. Her husband works selling and buying fruits. Mohira is starting a new business. She has worked on her business for almost two months. She is a sewer. She is planning to buy materials and tools for her business. She is an attentive and hardworking woman. She always finds time for her clients. She needs financial support for her business.

loans.use: To buy materials and tools for her new business

loans.name: Luis Fernando

texts.es:
Fernando es un hombre de 28 años de edad, casado, tiene 3 hijos de 6, 3 y 1 año y su trabajo es la pesca.
El es independiente, constante, responsable, paciente y trabajador. Su trabajo lo realiza en la comunidad “la isla Suriqui” que se encuentra ubicado en una isla del lago Titicaca, área agrícola dónde se cría ganado vacuno, ovino, se vive de la pesca y también de vegetales del lugar, como; la quinua, el chuño, la haba, la papa, etc. caracterizada por el clima frío del lugar, donde los rayos solares golpean fuertemente la superficie, a una altura promedio de 3800 metros sobre el nivel del mar.
Fernando es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello negro corto, su lengua materna es el aymará que se habla en el lugar para el comercio en la ciudad habla español. su vida la realiza junto a su esposa; que realizan labores de agricultura, viven en una casa propia construida de adobe que no cuenta con agua potable si  electricidad. Su negocio es la pesca en bote con red; La pesca del lago Titicaca es uno de los artes de pesca más bonitos, artesanos, y respetuosos con el lago y los fondos marinos que existen, ya que este arte de pesca consiste en arrojar al lago una línea de red, que suele ser desde 30 metros de largo. Al dejar caer la red en el fondo, y dejarla allí un día a modo de trampa, y luego simplemente recogerla, hace que no arrastre y destruya los fondos marinos, y solo queden atrapadas piezas del tamaño que se busca según grosor de red, y pescar solo las variedades que se quieren, “la pesca en el lago es sumamente tranquila, el frío del lugar congela todo a su alrededor, debemos tener bastante paciencia en el trabajo diario…” comenta.  Su sueño es mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y desea ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de redes de pesca por mayor, debido a que estas se rompen continuamente y todo el tiempo debe renovarlas. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Fernando solicita un préstamo para la compra de redes de pesca por mayor para tener material de trabajo constante.
texts.en:
Fernando is a 28-year-old man. He is married with three children ages 6, 3, and 1. He is a fisherman.
He is independent, constant, responsible, patient, and hard-working. He works in the La Isla Suriqui community, located on an island of Lake Titicaca. It is an agricultural area where the people raise cattle and sheep and live off of fish and local vegetables such as quinoa, chuño, beans, and potatoes. The area has a cold climate, and the solar rays are harsh. The average altitude is 3800 metres above sea level.
Fernando is dark-skinned and short with short black hair. His mother tongue is Aymara; it is spoken in the region for business. In the city, he speaks Spanish. He lives with his wife, who is a farmer. They live in their own adobe home, which does not have drinking water or electricity.
He fishes in a boat with a net. Fishing on Lake Titicaca is one of the most beautiful ways to fish. It is an art. Fisherman are respectful of the lake and the seabed; the art of fishing consists of tossing a net, usually 30 metres long, into the lake. It is left to fall to the bottom and sits for a day. Then, it is simply collected again, carefully so that it does not drag or damage the seabed. The fisherman are careful to make sure that they only capture fish the size they are seeking, which is determined by the size of the net. They only fish the varieties they want. 
"Fishing on the lake is very peaceful. The cold of the lake freezes everything around it. We have to be quite patient in our daily work" he says.
Fernando's dream is to improve his family's quality of life. He wants to expand his business by buying more fishing nets wholesale, since the nets are constantly breaking and he constantly has to repair them. This is his first loan cycle with the institution in the five years he has been doing this work.
For these reasons, Fernando is requesting a loan for the wholesale purchase of fishing nets so that he can always have tools for his work.

loans.use: to purchase fish nets wholesale.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

Marissa successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is presenting Marissa's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Tukur

texts.en:
Tukur is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Tukur joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Abubakar, Abubakar and Bello. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Tukur would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Tukur can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Tukur spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, and eventually hoping to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: To pay for children's school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en:
This woman lives in Kapan city of Syunik region. She is 65 years old, and her name is Tamara. Unfortunately, 20 years ago her husband died and with this loss and great sorrow during these years she brought up her three children; her two sons are married and they live with their families in Russian Federation. Her daughter is divorced and she lives with Tamara with her small child. 

For many years, Tamara worked at the Kapan city’s combine as a worker and then being greatly busy with care of her children, she worked at different places and did different work in order to sustain her family’s needs. Now Tamara is unemployed and her daughter also, and from Russian Federation, Tamara’s sons send money for their living. 

Tamara has now some health problems, but very little money to solve it. This loan she asks in order to pay for her medical examination and find out the reason for her unhealthy feelings.

loans.use: to pay for her medical examination and find out the reason for her unhealthy feelings

loans.name: Dauda Haruna

texts.en:
Dauda Haruna is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Dauda Haruna joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Promise, Ezekiel and Isuwa.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Dauda Haruna would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Dauda Haruna can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Dauda Haruna spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, and eventually hopes to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: To pay for childrens school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies and accessories for her beauty salon

loans.name: Nhóm 7 - Định Hóa 01 Group

texts.en:
Hoa, pictured second on the right in the first row, was born in 1973 and works as a farmer. She is married and has three children who are currently in school. She has been a member of the local Women's Union since 2001. 

Her family has not been able to afford a hygienic toilet. With this loan, Hoa will be able to build a sanitary latrine that will improve her family's quality of life and health by helping them to avoid diseases and infections commonly associated with unsafe latrines.

loans.use: To pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine with a device for hand-washing with soap

loans.name: Nhóm 8 - Định Hóa 01 Group

texts.en: Thu, pictured first on the left in the second row, is 59 years old and works in agriculture. She has been a member of the local Women's Union since 1999. Currently, her family does not have access to a hygienic toilet. Like other group members of Group 8 - Dinh Hoa 01, Thu will use the loan to build a sanitary toilet and a hand-washing device with soap to improve her living conditions and contribute to environmental protection.

loans.use: To pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine with a device for hand-washing with soap

loans.name: Rami 50371 Group

texts.en:
Layla is the featured borrower for Rami 50371 Group. She got together with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.

Layla is a 38-year-old married mother of two children who has been selling cosmetics and make-ups from her house for the past eleven years to help her husband in covering the increasing needs and expenses of their family.

Layla is an ambitious woman who has a good reputation among her customers, as she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to develop her business with new requested special make-ups and cosmetics to satisfy her customers' needs. Layla is the first lady on the left of the photo.

With respect to the other group members, Nisrine is a 27-year-old married mother of two children who works as a saleswoman and wants to develop her business, while Issmat is a 43-year-old married mother of three children who wants to pay her children's school tuition fees. Nisrine is the first lady on the right of the photo, while Issmat is the lady sitting in the middle.

loans.use: to develop her business with new requested special make-ups and cosmetics to satisfy her customers' needs

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel has been involved in the charcoal sales business for three years. She is able to sell 30 sacks of charcoal twice a week. Maricel is also engaged in the hog raising and farming business.

With the businesses she has had, she is in need of additional support to keep them growing.To make that possible, she is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000. She will use this loan amount to buy 30 sacks of charcoal to sell. She is hoping that lenders will grant her requested loan.

Maricel knows that this loan amount will contribute a lot of things to her businesses.

loans.use: to buy 30 sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Hello, lenders! Meet Rose, a youthful 31-year-old mother, a wise farmer whom neighbors and fellow farmers respect as a mentor. She farms a small plot of land in the green, lush hills of Kapsowar, in the Rift valley region of Kenya. Rose is happily married and together with her husband, blessed with four lovely children. 

For the past five years, she has been involved in mixed farming and her primary source of income has been growing maize, milk, cabbages, tomatoes and also she keeps dairy cows. Rose has been able to provide nutritious food for her family. Although she has been making profits selling a variety of food crops, she is faced with a challenge of timely delivery of the produce to the market. This challenge has not made her give up; “I have to do something for my family,“ she said. Rose mobilized other women in her village and joined Juhudi Kilimo, which is a micro finance institution that assists aspiring women like her. 

She is requesting a loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders to buy another motorbike. Rose is from a remote village that has poor feeder roads and transporting her produce to the market has been a challenge, hence suffering so many losses. Perishable products such as milk, vegetables, and tomatoes require timely delivery to the market if you are to fetch a high price, and through this loan Rose is going to achieve her dream and goals. Accessing a financial solution for women in Kenya is an uphill battle, but Rose feels relieved to know that there are institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva that help out women so that they can gain respect and equality among their male counterparts. 

The benefits of this loan are astronomical, because Rose will never suffer losses due to delays in delivery of produce to the market and also, she will increase her sales volume because she will be able to transport more goods to the market hence increased income level. Rose is a woman who is making a change for herself and for others in the community because she intends to employ someone who will be riding the motorbike and helping in farm work. With your loan, Rose will improve her living conditions and assure her children and grandchildren to come of a secure future.

loans.use: To buy another motorbike to transport produce to market

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en:
Vanna, 44, is a married woman who lives in a small community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has only one dependent child who is currently in school. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small farmland which is located near her house. On her farmland, she grows rice and sells her agricultural products to the local dealers. On average, she can generate earnings of USD 10.00 per day.

The current farmland that she owns is small and it can provide a smaller benefit to her. Vanna wants to enlarge her farmland area but she cannot afford to. Therefore, now she would like to get a Kiva loan to buy a plot of farmland for growing rice. She hopes this additional farmland will help to improve her living conditions. She is thankful to all lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland for growing rice

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to get treatment in the hospital.

loans.name: Buvisaodat

texts.en:
Buvisaodat is a strong woman.  She was born in 1973 and is from northern Tajikistan.  She lives in a rural area, and is married with three children.  Her husband is a business man.  

For about eight years now, Buvisaodat has operated her own business as a seamstress, sewing traditional dresses for women.  Her son has become sick and is being treated in the hospital, but she does not have enough financial resources to treat her son.  She is asking for financial support to treat her son.

loans.use: to pay for medical treatment for her son.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 40 años de edad, casada, tiene un  hijo de la edad de 17 años y su negocio es es el acopio de chatarra y  plástico para su reciclaje.
Ella es emprendedora, independiente, responsable, constante, activa y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona de ´Corea´, de clima frio y seco con una temperatura promedio de 4-15 grados centígrados, que varía durante el transcurso del día.
María es de tez trigueña, cabello castaño largo, estatura mediana, su lengua materna es el aymará el cual sólo habla con familiares y habla español para el comercio, Su negocio es el acopio de distintos materiales  en plástico  y chatarra, Su negocio es innovador y casi único en el mercado, por lo que tiene clientes de distintas fabricas que se encargan de comprar el material que ella reúne; ‘la ventaja de mi negocio es que camino constantemente para reunir todo el material reciclable, es muy cansador  peor vale la pena…’. Esta es la segunda secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Maria solicita  un préstamo para la compra de plásticos  por mayor para ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
María is a 40 year old woman. She is married and has a 17 year old son. Her business is the collection and recycling of scrap metal and plastics.

She is an entrepreneur who is independent, responsible, reliable, active and hardworking. She does her work in the area of Corea which has a cold and dry climate with an average temperature between 4-15 degrees Celsius, which varies during the course of the day.

María has a dark complexion, long brown hair, is medium height, and her mother tongue is Aymara which she speaks only with relatives, speaking Spanish for business. Her business is the collection of various materials of plastic or metal. Her business is innovative and almost the only one in the market. This is why she has customers from different manufacturers who are in charge of buying the material that she collects. “The advantage of my business is that I walk constantly in order to collect all the recyclable material. It is very tiring but it is worth it.” This is the second cycle of loans with the institution in the three years she has been doing this activity.

It is for these reasons that María is requesting a loan to buy wholesale plastic so she can expand her business.

loans.use: to buy plastic at wholesale prices

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 50 years old and has two children who are in school.

Teresita has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy abaca fiber.

Teresita has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy abaca fiber

loans.name: Sabastiano

texts.en: Sabastiano is a 45-year-old hardworking married man with four children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He deals in cattle fattening alongside banana growing for increased income. He started the business to meet his daily family needs. Sabastiano faces a hardship from the dry spell leading to a lack of water and pastures for his animals; hence low yields. He dreams of building a permanent home as well as educating his children up to university. Sabastiano requests the loan to buy cattle to fatten and sell.

loans.use: to buy cattle to fatten and sell.

loans.name: Yesenia

texts.es:
Yesenia es una creativa, productiva y rebuscadora mujer de 25 años de edad, madre soltera de un hijo de 6 años, se gana la vida vendiendo accesorios para hombre y dama y con la ayuda de este ingreso puede sostener su familia.
Yesenia busca incrementar sus ventas con el negocio que por iniciativa propia inicio y principalmente por matricular su niño es la primaria.
Solicita un crédito para la compra de manillas, pulseras, anillos, aretes, cadenas, reloj, candonga y una vitrina para exhibir sus productos.
Su sueño es que su hijo lo tenga todo, una educación, salud y felicidad, y que su negocio prospere
texts.en:
Yesenia is a creative, productive and enterprising woman, age 25. She is the single mother of a 6-year-old son. She earns her living selling accessories for men and women, and with the help of this business she is able to support her family. 

Yesenia is seeking to increase her sales in her business which she started on her own initiative, mainly so she could send her son to primary school. 

She is requesting a loan to buy various kinds of bracelets, rings, earrings, necklaces, and watches, as well as a showcase to display her products. 

Her dream is that her son will have everything -- an education, health and happiness -- and that her business will prosper.

loans.use: to buy various kinds of bracelets, rings, earrings, necklaces, and watches, as well as a showcase to display her products.

loans.name: Hauwa

texts.en:
Hauwa is a maize farmer from Rafin Tabo village in Kaduna state. Before she became a Babban Gona Farmers Organization member, Hauwa had to sell her maize for low prices, soon after harvest, to cater to her immediate cash needs. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Hauwa can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later, for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Hauwa, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for her family and hopes to make more money for herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Gloria Maria

texts.es:
Gloria una mujer de 47 años de edad que encuentran en sus expresiones artísticas una manera útil y creatividad para generar ingresos, es separara de su esposo con el cual llegó a tener 2 hijos ya mayores de edad.
Entre sus habilidades están la de dibujar y crear piezas ingeniosas y hermosas que no solo sirven para hacer recuadros si no como diseñadora de interiores plasma sus ideas en un pizarrón y presenta creativamente sus propuestas. 
Gloria solicita un crédito pues su forma de trabajar única e innovadora le lleva varios materiales, con el crédito comprara paneles, bastidores pinturas, pinceles entre otros.
Apoya la creatividad e innovación que coloca Gloria a favor de la comunidad.
texts.en:
Gloria is a 47-year-old woman who has found that her artistic expression is a useful and creative way to make a living. She is separated from her husband, with whom she has two grown children.
Drawing and creating imaginative and beautiful pieces are among her talents. She doesn't just make paintings, but is also an interior designer. She  designs items on a blackboard and creatively presents her proposals.
Gloria is requesting a loan because her innovative and unique job requires various materials. With this loan she will purchase canvass, stretchers, brushes, and other items.
Support the creativity and innovation that Gloria puts at the service of her community.

loans.use: to buy canvass, stretchers, brushes, and more.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 54 years old and has seven children. She is married and three of her children are currently in school.

Alicia is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Alicia requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional piglets, feed and other supplies for her business.

Alicia has been in pig fattening for 11 years now, and has sustained her business by borrowing 25 times in the past from NWTF.

In the future, Alicia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets, feed and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Ibrahim joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Rabiu and Auwalu.

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Ibrahim would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ibrahim can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Ibrahim spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: To pay for his children's school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Rahila

texts.en:
Rahila is a maize farmer from Kwankwani village in Kaduna state. Before she became a Babban Gona member, Rahila would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for her immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Rahila can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Rahila, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for her family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in her community.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Santos Aurora

texts.es:
Santos, con ayuda del préstamo anterior surtió la tiende de productos de primera necesidad, estaba teniendo buenos resultados y su situación económica poco a poco estaba mejorando, pero debido a las extorciones tuvo que quitar dicho negocio, a pesar de la dificultad ella logro cancelar su deuda. Actualmente se dedica a vender ropa, bolsos y otros productos de uso personal, su familia se encuentra muy saludable y con una mejor alimentación.
En esta oportunidad solicita un crédito para comprar bolsos, faldas, pantalones, ropa interior,  camisas y otras prendas de vestir que le sirvan para mejorar el inventario de su nuevo negocio, espera atraer nuevos clientes y seguir trabajando para apoyar a su familia.
texts.en:
With help from the previous loan, Santos stocked her store with necessary products. She was getting good results and her financial situation was improving little by little, but due to blackmail she had to get rid of that business. Despite the difficulty, she managed to pay off her debt. 

She is currently selling clothing, handbags and other items for personal use. Her family is very healthy and they have improved their diet. 

This time she is requesting a loan to buy handbags, skirts, pants, undergarments, shirts and other articles of clothing that will be used to improve the inventory of her new business. She hopes to attract new clients and to continue working to support her family.

loans.use: to buy handbags, skirts, pants, undergarments, shirts and other articles of clothing that will be used to improve the inventory of her new business.

loans.name: Ziyagul

texts.ru: Зиягул 47 лет, замужем, мать 6 дочерей, самая младшая дочь учится в школе. У Зиягул - среднее образование, с 2000 года занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду Зиягул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день насчитывается 3 коровы, 5 овец. На участке мерою 1,0 Га она выращивает кукурузу и пшеницу для реализации. Ежемесячный доход Зиягул около 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота, для увеличения поголовья.
texts.en: Ziyagul is 47 years old, married and a mother of 6 daughters, the youngest of whom attends a school. Ziyagul has a secondary education and has been involved in animal husbandry and farming since 2000. Thanks to Ziyagul's hard work, today her farm contains 3 cows and 5 sheep. She grows corn and wheat for sale on 1.0 hectares of land. Ziyagul's monthly income is about 10,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, she requested a loan in the amount of 30,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy livestock to increase livestock headcount.

loans.use: to purchase livestock in order to increase her livestock headcount and invest in her business

loans.name: Usman

texts.en:
Usman is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Usman would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Usman can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Like other Babban Gona members, Usman is looking to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family, and hopes to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating the pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a 52-year-old hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda.  He owns a coffee plantation and rears cattle and goats to earn extra income.  He started this business to earn a living.  He hopes to improve on the level of output from his plantation however, his main challenge is competition from other farmers and traders. 

He needs a loan to buy more inputs like fertilizers and mulch for his farm.

loans.use: to buy more inputs like fertilizers and mulch for his farm.

loans.name: Nhóm 10 - Định Hóa 01 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Mai, pictured first on the left in the second row, is a 32-year-old farmer. Her family is a low income family with three little children. 

She does not have a sanitary latrine at home due to a lack of funds. With this loan, Mai will install a toilet that will improve the quality of life for all of her family members and help the community to avoid diseases and infections commonly associated with unsanitary toilets. 

She has been an active member of the Women's Union since 2005.

loans.use: To pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine with a device for hand-washing with soap

loans.name: Nhóm 2 - Định Hóa 01 Group

texts.en:
Hồng, pictured first from the left, is 60 years old and earns approximately 550,000 VND monthly.  Her husband passed away years ago.  She has been a member of the local Women's Union since 1990.  

A portion of Nhóm 2 - Định Hóa 01 group's loan will help Hồng, as well as other group members, to build a sanitary toilet and a hand-washing device with soap.  This will help to improve her family's hygiene and health and contribute to the sanitary improvement of her community.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine with a device for hand-washing with soap.

loans.name: Matha

texts.en: Matha is a maize farmer from Kwankwani village in Kaduna state. Before she became a Babban Gona member, Matha would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for her immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Matha can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Matha, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for her family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in her community.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth, is aged 55, married and blessed with four children. She owns and manages a livestock business, specifically a hog raising business in her village.

Ruth earns a net income of PHP 20,000 every four months. She would like to request a loan amounting to PHP 35,000 to purchase a supply of hog feed for her hogs.

She's hoping that her business will continue to grow productively and become more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase a supply of feed for her hogs.

loans.name: Nhóm 3 - Định Hóa 01 Group

texts.en:
Hương, pictured first on the right in the first row, is 40 years old.  Her family works in the agricultural sector and has three children who are still in school. 

With this loan, Hương will install a sanitary toilet that will improve the quality of life for all of her family members and help her family and community avoid diseases and infections commonly associated with unsanitary toilets.  She has been a member of the local Women's Union since 2000.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine with a device for hand-washing with soap.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is 48 years old and married with four children. With two children currently in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Tessie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like canned goods, vinegar, soy sauce, eggs, detergent soap, cooking oil, etc. to sell.

Tessie has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, vinegar, soy sauce, eggs, detergent soap, cooking oil, etc.

In the future, Tessie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like canned goods, vinegar, soy sauce, eggs, detergent soap, cooking oil, etc. to sell

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 44 years old and has two children who are in school.

Nelia has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Nelia has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Pablita

texts.en:
Pablita is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 61 years old.

Pablita has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like shampoo, soft drinks, coffee, canned goods, sugar, etc.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

Pablita has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like snack foods, biscuits, candies, juice, soft drinks, etc. to sell

loans.name: Anarkan

texts.ru: Анаркан, успешно погасила свой кредит, использовав его по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. Анаркан приложила все усилия для развития своего бизнеса, на сегодняшний день в ее хозяйстве есть 9 коров, 2 лошади, 40 овец. Также есть надел мерою 2,0 ГА орошаемой земли, где она выращивает кукурузу и клевер. Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку породистых нетелей. В будущем, Анаркан планирует и дальше расширять свою деятельность и накопить средства на образование младшего сына.
texts.en: Anarkan successfully repaid her loan, using it as directed. She is grateful to the KIva Fund and everyone, who helped her with the financing. Anarkan put forth all of her efforts to develop her business and today has 9 cows, 2 horses and 40 sheep. She also has 2.0 hectares of land, where she grows corn and clover. In order to further develop her business, she requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy purebred heifers. In the future, Anarkan plans to continue expanding her business and saving money for her youngest son's education.

loans.use: to buy purebred heifers in order to invest in her business and save for her son's education

loans.name: Ramata

texts.fr:
Madame RAMATA est née en mars 1967 à KOULIKORO, mariée, mère de 7 enfants, elle réside à Lobougoula avec son époux et leurs enfants dans une famille nucléaire. Lobougoula fait partie de l’un commune du cercle  de Sikasso 3ème région administrative de la république du MALI. 
Cette brave femme après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès madame RAMATA s’est initiée aux activités d’achat et de revente des cartes de recharge de crédit ("zèrè" et "paani" c'est le nom en Bambara des cartes de rechange pour les 2 opérateurs de téléphone au Mali). Elle s’approvisionne à SIKASSO et à BAMAKO. 
A fin de satisfaire le besoin de sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle sollicite auprès de l’Institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso un septième prêt individuel. Les prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursé.
Ce prêt lui permettra de faire l’achat des quantités importante de carte de recharge qui seront revendus sur place à Lobougoula au comptant.  
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 285 000 francs CFA par mois. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en: Mrs. RAMATA was born in March, 1967 in KOULIKORO. A married mother of seven, she lives in Lobougoula with her husband and their children in a nuclear family. Lobougoula is part of a commune in the circle of Sikasso, the third administrative region of the republic of MALI. A good woman who unsuccessfully tried out several businesses, Mrs. RAMATA started buying and selling phone cards ("zèrè" and "paani" are the names in Bambara for phone cards for the two phone companies in Mali). She stocks up in SIKASSO and in BAMAKO. In order to satisfy the needs of her increasingly growing clientele, she is seeking her seventh individual loan from microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. The previous loans were properly repaid. This loan will allow her to buy large quantities of phone cards, which will be sold locally in Lobougoula for cash. She foresees earning an average monthly profit of 285,000 FCFA. This profit will allow her to repay the loan with interest and to save up.

loans.use: to buy phone cards

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her electronics business

loans.name: Irimiya

texts.en: Irimiya is a maize farmer from Kwankwani village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Irimiya would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Irimiya can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Irimiya, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for his family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Madina

texts.ru: Мадина молодая жительница города Душанбе. Ей всего 20 лет. Она добрая, вежливая, ответственная и активная девушка. Мадина проживает с мамой и сестренкой. Они являются большими помощниками в ее работе. Мадина дома занимается шитьем национальной женской одежды на заказ. Также она еще студентка высшего учебного заведения. У Мадины большая тяга к учебе. Она хочет учиться и одновременно работать, чтобы покрыть свои расходы. Мадина обратилась за кредитом для приобретения новой швейной машинки. Из-за того что ее нынешняя машинка не выполняет свои функции как прежде хорошо она решила купить новую, чтобы продолжить работу и сохранить источник дохода. По причине не достаточной суммы денег для реализации покупки Мадина обратилась за кредитом.
texts.en: Madina is a young resident of the city of Dushanbe. She is only 20 years old. She is a kind, polite, responsible and active young woman. Madina lives with her mother and sister. They provide a lot of help with her work. Madina is involved in sewing national women's clothing to-order at home. She is also a university student. Madina has a lot of desire to study. She wants to study and work at the same time to cover her expenses. Madina requested this loan to buy a new sewing machine. Because her current sewing machine does not function as well as it used to, she decided to buy a new one in order to continue her work and retain her income source. Madina requested a loan due to the lack of the sufficient amount of money to make this purchase.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Bahor

texts.en: Bahor was born in 1970. She is a kind woman from South Tajikistan. Bahor is a married mother of three children. She is a higher educated woman and has more than 30 years of labor experience. She has worked in many spheres of society. For the last five years, she has been working in the telephone system. Bahor does her job well. She plans to buy a chiffonier and mirror for her household and in this way, offer comfortable living conditions for her family. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni with this aim. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy a chiffonier and mirror for her household

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy potatoes

loans.name: Fredy Armando

texts.es:
Fredy, de 67 años de edad, está casado y estudió hasta bachillerato, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tiene dos hijos que ya trabajan y generan ingresos para los gastos de la casa, en su casa vive su suegra

Fredy, tiene una pequeña tienda en donde vende sodas, pan, azúcar, golosinas y otro tipo de productos. Antes él trabajaba en una tienda como vendedor, pero hoy que ya tiene su propia tienda, percibe mejores ingresos; la tienda está ubicada en su casa y su esposa le ayuda a atender sus clientes.

Además, su esposa hace tamales, atol de elote, entre otros antojitos y de esa manera le ayuda a Fredy con los gastos de la casa, ya que sus hijos trabajan pero es poco lo que ganan.- El horario de atención a sus clientes es de 5:30 a.m. hasta las 7:00 p.m.

Fredy, utilizará el crédito para comprar más mercadería para su tienda, ya que en esta época de navidad, se venden más productos como por ejemplo, pollo en libra y el pan de barra.-

Anteriormente, solicito un crédito con el cual compró golosinas, gaseosas y productos de la canasta básica y gracias a Dios le fue bastante bien.

Sus sueños son poder tener una tienda con más variedad de productos para que sus cliente, encuentren todo lo necesario en un solo lugar y no tengan que caminar grandes distancias. 

Fredy, espera generar ganancias considerables para comprar útiles escolares en Enero y poder ofrecerlas a sus clientes, anteriormente ha vendido este tipo de productos escolares y  las vendió bastante rápido.
texts.en:
Fredy is 67 years old, married, and he completed high school. His spouse is a housewife, and they have two children tho work and generate income for their home. His father-in-law also lives with them.

Fredy has a small store where he sells soda, bread, sugar, candy and other types of products. Previously he worked in a store as a clerk, but today he has his own store and he has better income. His store is located in his home and his wife helps him attend to his customer. In addition, his wife makes tamales, corn beverage, and other snacks, and in this way she helps Fredy with the household expenses as his children work but they earn little. The store is open from 5:30 AM until 7 PM. Fredy will use the loan to buy more merchandise for his store, as during this Christmas season he sells more merchandise such as chicken and baguettes.

Previously he had a loan to buy candy, soda pop, and household goods and thanks to God it went well.

His dreams are to be able to have a store with more product variety for his customers, so they encounter what they need in one place, and don't have to walk long distances.

Fredy hopes to generate considerable income to buy school supplies in January and be able to offer them to his customers. Previously he has sold school supplies and he sold them rather quickly.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for his store, because in this Christmas season he sells more products such as chicken and baguette bread

loans.name: Claudia Yanet

texts.es:
Claudia una mujer de 35 años de edad, madre de un hijo de tan solo 9 años y con una historia plagada de tropezones e injusticias, no logro empelarse en una empresa, por razones de estudios y experiencia laboral solo en las ventas por catálogo encontró la oportunidad de generar ingresos para apoyar a su familia.
Como ha sido el negocio que le abrió las puertas, permitiéndole generar el sustento para su pequeño hijo, le gustaría solicitar un auxilio monetario para la compra de surtido pro catalogo como lo son ropa, productos de belleza, y productos para el cuidado del cuerpo.
Su sueño es a partir de este negocio impulsar y sacar a su hijo adelante siendo una emprendedora exitosa y con muchos clientes.
texts.en: Claudia is a 35 year old woman, mother to a 9 year old son and has a history of challenges and injustices. She wasn't able to find work, for reasons related to education and work experiences, she found catalog sales as a way to generate income to support her family.  This business has opened doors for her, enabling her to generate the support she needed for her young son. She would like a loan to buy "Pro Catalogo" brand items such as clothing, beauty products and body care products. Her dream is to use this business to help her child be successful, and that she be a successful businesswoman with many customers.

loans.use: to buy "Pro Catalogo" brand items such as clothing, beauty products and body care products.

loans.name: Talatu

texts.en:
Talatu is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Talatu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children: Obadiya, Alsa and Saminu.  Before she became a Babban Gona member, Talatu would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater to her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Talatu can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Talatu spoke of her ambition to use the additional income to educate her children, eventually hoping to make more money for herself and her family.

loans.use: to pay for her children's school fees and uniforms. thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Damarice

texts.en:
Damarice is 42 years old, married and together with her spouse they have been blessed with two children. She has a preparatory school which she has been running for the past nine years.

She plans to use this loan to buy school desks and writing materials such as exercise books, charts and chalk. She will use the anticipated profits to expand and buy more school materials.

This is her first loan term from VisionFund Kenya and her future hopes are to grow her business and be successful and have a happy family.

loans.use: To buy school desks and writing materials.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Salvacion is 36 years old and all of her children are in school.

Salvacion has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

Salvacion has been in this business for nine years. In the future, Salvacion would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Nhóm 10 - Kim Định 01 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hang, pictured second on the right in the first row, is a 37-year-old-farmer with a monthly income of approximately VND 600,000.  Her husband passed away a couple years ago. 

She is raising her two sons who are in high school by herself. She has been a member of the local Women's Union since 1997. With this VND 7.2 million loan, she will have a sanitary toilet installed in her home. This will improve her family's hygiene and health and contribute to the sanitary improvement in her community.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine with a device for hand washing with soap

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Lanie works hard to support her family.

She has a cafeteria business in the Philippines and earns additional income from her general store. Lanie is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional stock of coffee to sell for her cafeteria business.

Lanie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 29 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream:  to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of coffee to sell.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Maricel requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Maricel has been in this business for one year now.

Maricel would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Librada

texts.en:
Librada is single and has a raising pigs business in the Philippines.

Librada requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to purchase vaccines, feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Librada has been in this business for four years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Librada would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase vaccines, feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Pilar

texts.en:
Pilar is 34 years old and has one child in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Pilar runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like beverages, condiments, canned goods, etc.

Pilar has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Pilar would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like beverages, condiments, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a married woman with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 40 years old now.

Rowena has a fish vending business in the Philippines. It was damaged by super typhoon Haiyan last November 8, 2013. Rowena requested a PHP 5,000 bridge loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell to restart her business activities.

Rowena has been in this business for five years and would like to rebuild it with your help. In the future, Rowena would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a forty-one-year-old mother of four children aged 16, 12, 8 and 6, living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. She deals in cattle trade as well as boda boda (motorcycle) transport where she earns an additional income. Like any other loving mother she has a dream of educating her children and constructing a very good residential house but she has a challenge of high charges on cattle movements like transport and trading license. She wants to maximize profits this Christmas season when demand for cattle is very high. Rose needs a loan to buy cows to sell.

loans.use: To buy cows to sell.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Margaret, 44 years of age and a very hardworking, honest and dedicated farmer who lives in Kibomet, a remote village in Kitale. She is happily married and is blessed with four adorable children. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last ten years and has gained so much experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling milk, eggs, and a variety of food crops from her farmland. To make ends meet and make extra cash, she has been engaging in another small personal business. The Kitale area is very populated and the demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable and she stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand that is really high. She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming and she is seeking a loan of 65,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry. Being a woman accessing funds is very challenging, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, she feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved and she will be able to buy more poultry. As a result of the loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market. This will translate to an increased profit margin and an improved income level. Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits and expand her poultry market to other markets; this will increase her income and improve her living conditions. The extra income she will get will be used to fully repay the loan, permanently changing her living conditions and securing the future of her school-going children.
Your support is needed not only by Margaret but also her four children who want to study through to university level.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy pagnes (traditional wrap arounds)

loans.name: Dúo Las Gemelas Group

texts.es:
DUO LA GEMELAS
Ana Lucrecia  de 20 años tiene  una hija , empezó su negocio  con Q.300.00 invirtiendo en costuras  agradece  a su esposo y a su suegra por el apoyo , su mayor anhelo es poner un local grande  para tener mas mercadería y así poder tener mejores ganancia en un futuro, agradece y le pide mucho a dios para que todo le salga cada día  mejor.esta solicitando este credito para la compra de hilo y telas para seguir elavorando costuras de todo tipo.
texts.en: DUO LA GEMELAS: Ana Lucrecia, age 20, has one daughter. She started her business with Q300.00 [Guatemalan Quetzals], investing in dressmaking supplies. She is grateful to her husband and her mother-in-law for the support. Her greatest ambition is to set up a large store so that she can offer more merchandise and thus have better earnings in the future. She is grateful and she prays often to God that things will go a little better for her each day. She is requesting this loan to buy fabrics and thread so that she can continue making clothing of all types.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and thread to make clothing to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy atiéke (a dish made from fermented cassava couscous)

loans.name: Bashiru Haruna

texts.en:
Bashiru Haruna is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Bashiru Haruna joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Amos, Salama and Filomena.  

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Bashiru Haruna would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Bashiru Haruna can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Bashiru Haruna spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: To pay for his children's school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating the pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Víctor un hombre de 62 años de edad, padre de 3 hijos y felizmente casado, se desempeña como vendedor de productos de la canasta familiar, una actividad que inicio por necesidad económica pues por su avanzada edad ya no le daban trabajo en una empresa.
Víctor está muy consciente de que ya no podrá emplearse y el dinero que genere, vendrá por su capacidad emprendedora y su creatividad para sacar su negocio adelante, por ello, es tan importante, pues de él depende toda su familia.
Solicita un crédito para la compra de surtido de la canasta familiar como lo son víveres, gaseosas, granos, y productos lácteos. 
Tu ayuda puede marcar la diferencia y hacer que este hombre siga velando por mejorar las condiciones de vida de los suyos.
texts.en:
Víctor is a 62 year old father of 3 children, is happy married, and has a business selling groceries, a business he started out of economic necessity since because of his advanced age he wasn't able to get a job in a business. Victor is very conscious of not being able to be employed and the money that a job would generate; the solution would come with his entrepreneurial ability and his creativity in order to be successful in his business. For him this success is important as his family depends on him.

He seeks a loan to buy a stock of household goods such as groceries, soda pop, grains, and dairy products. Your help can make a difference and make it so this man continues toward improving the living conditions of his loved ones.

loans.use: to buy a stock of household goods such as groceries, soda pop, grains, and dairy products.

loans.name: Hernando

texts.es:
Hernando es un artesano que ha sabido llevar su profesión a través del tiempo, con su profesión de reparación y fabricación de bolsos ha podido sostener  a su familia conformada por 4 hijas ya ellas mayores de edad, en el momento se encuentra soltero y vela por el cuidado de él y apoya en momentos difíciles a su familia.
Este humilde hombre vive de su profesión, come gracias a su profesión, su edad no le permite explorar nuevos campos por ello solicita un crédito para mantener viva su tradición el cual invertirá en la compra de cuero y surtido para la fabricación y reparación de bolsos de cueros.
texts.en:
Hernando is a craftsman who learned to make and repair leather handbags many years ago. This skill has allowed him to support his family and raise his four daughters, who are now all adults. Hernando is now single, but remains a devoted father who helps to his children when they are in need. 

Hernando is a humble man, who has always earned a living from his business. At his age, finding a new career isn't an option, so Hernando is applying for a loan in order to sustain his business. He will use the loan funds to invest in the purchase of leather and supplies for making and repairing leather handbags.

loans.use: to purchase leather and supplies for making and repairing leather handbags.

loans.name: Balcon 3 Group

texts.es:
Juana es una mujer de 23 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos, y su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano.
Ella es paciente, buena oyente, solidaria, emprendedora, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la localidad de ‘El Torno’ una comunidad rural ubicada a 45 minutos de la ciudad en automóvil, caracterizada por el comercio agrícola que reúne a productores campesinos y vendedores/distribuidores de la ciudad, el clima del lugar es cálido, tropical y húmedo, con una temperatura que varía durante en día entre 21-35 grados centígrados durante todo el año.
Juana es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello negro largo amarrado, su lengua materna es el Guaraní y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con sus padres que se dedican al comercio, viven en una casa alquilada construida de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Sus deseos de superación la llevaron a liderar una banca de personas con actividades comerciales como; servicio técnico de equipos, venta de muebles, venta de sábanas, confección de carteras, venta de salteñas, confección de polleras, servicio de transporte y tienda de videos, para solicitar un préstamo y ampliar sus negocios. Su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano; comercio que realiza de forma ambulante en diferentes ferias y mercados de la zona. “La ropa de segunda mano se ha convertido en una alternativa más de consumo, el costo de la misma y la variedad existente la han convertido en un negocio en auge para algunos emprendedores…” comenta. Su sueño es tener su tienda de ropa para dejar de ambular. Ella desea aumentar su stock de ropa de segunda mano para tener mayor variedad para ofertar a sus clientes. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que viene desarrollando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Juana solicita un préstamo para aumentar su stock de ropa de segunda mano en oferta para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Juana, 23, is a single woman who has no children.  She has a business selling used clothing.  She is patient, a good listener, supportive, enterprising, responsible, and hardworking.  She is developing her business in the El Torno community, which is a rural area located 45 minutes from the city by car.  This area is known for its agricultural commerce, because it is where the farmers meet up with the wholesalers and distributors from the city.  The climate here is hot, tropical, and humid, with a temperature that varies during the day between 21 and 35 degrees centigrade over the year.

Juana has a dark complexion, is short, and has long black hair tied back.  Her native tongue is Guaraní, and she speaks Spanish so that she can integrate into the general culture and conduct business.  She shares her life with her parents, who work in commerce.  They live in a rented house built of bricks that has potable water, electricity, and sewer service.  Her desire to succeed has led her to lead a communal bank with people who have a variety of businesses, such as: technical equipment services, furniture sales, bed sheet sales, the production of purses, the sale of empanadas, the production of traditional skirts, transportation services, and a store selling videos.  They are requesting a loan to expand their businesses.

Juana has a business selling used clothing.  She sells from place to place in the various fairs and markets in the area.  "Used clothing has become another option for consumers.  Because of the cost and the variety available, it's become a booming business for some entrepreneurs," she comments.  

Juana's dream is to have her own clothing store so that she can stop selling in the markets.  She wants to increase her stock of used clothing so that she can have a greater variety to offer to her customers.  This is the first loan with the institution in a year that she has taken for this business.  Juana is requesting this loan to increase her stock of used clothing to offer for sale to her customers.

loans.use: to buy used clothing to sell

loans.name: Nhóm 1 - Hồi Ninh 01 Group

texts.en: Anh, pictured first from the right, is 61 years old. She works in the agricultural sector and earns 500,000 VND monthly. She is married with grown children. Her husband has brain related disease. Her family is experiencing economic hardship and could not afford a hygienic latrine. With this loan, she will build a latrine in order to improve the living conditions for her family members by preventing diseases commonly associated with unhygienic toilets. She has been a member of the Women's Union since 1991.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine with a device for hand washing with soap.

loans.name: Chrep

texts.en:
Chrep, who is 49 years old, is living in a community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has five children in total; three are single and two are married. 

To make a living and support the family, she has been involved in a farming business since 1990, growing rice and selling her agricultural product to the local dealers and customers in market. The net profit that she can generate is USD 5.00 a day, on average.
