Eladio, 50 years old, has decided to open a business preparing and selling Solteritas in the municipality of Bello. Solteritas are fritters made out of sugar that are very popular in Colombian culture. 

Eladio works every day from 6 in the morning until 6 at night. He is a responsible, and just man who is dedicated to his business. 

Among other unrealized dreams is his dream to open a large restaurant that offers a variety of foods and can offer others employment.

He currently encounters many difficulties such as the cost of goods, competition in the industry and the strong rains that destroy his work stand. 
. 
He asks for economic support to capitalize his business and buy goods such as sugar and artificial sweetners. 

The loan will improve his life and his business in a great way. It will allow him to obtain his dream and have a variety of products to offer to his clients, as well as continue the support of his children.

loans.use: to buy goods such as sugar and artificial sweeteners.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en: Marites is 43 years old, married and has two children. She and her spouse manages a rice field. Marites would like to improve their crop production but she has insufficient fund to sustain her crops, so she is now asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy fertilizers, insecticides and herbicides to use in farming. These farm inputs will help nourish the crops for healthier growth and production. Marites promises to pay back her loan in full and hoping to achieve economic stability someday.

loans.use: buy fertilizers, insecticides and herbicides

loans.name: Barno

texts.en:
Barno is young and hardworking woman. She is 18 years old. Barno is single and lives with her parents. She has a business buying cattle, feeding them  some months and selling them to local people. Her parents help her with managing the business. She always tries for the well-being of her family. 

Barno is going to be married and soon they will make her marriage party. Barno wants to buy bedroom furniture for her new life with her future husband. She is asking for a loan of 2000 Somonis with this aim. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: buy bedroom furniture

loans.name: Dúo Las Margaritas Group

texts.es:
DUO LAS MARGARITAS
Doña Margaritas es originaria del municipio de tecpan, Guatemala ella tiene 41 años de edad, bajo su responsabilidad están sus hijos menores de edad, ella tiene una tienda de venta de productos de consumo diario.
Ella empezó con una pequeña tienda y gracias a Dios poco a poco a podido salir adelante y ampliarlo un poco mas.
El esposo de ella trabaja como chofer de camión  y gracias al apoyo de el y el apoyo de su familia ella sigue adelante con su negocio.
El crédito que ella recibió lo invirtió en su tienda comprando su mercadería para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
Ella sueña con ampliar mas su negocio surtirlo con mas variedad de productos asi obtendrá mejores ganancias y mandar a sus hijos a la escuela para un futuro mejor,ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de productos comestibles para la venta.
texts.en:
Las Margaritas Duo ("DUO LAS MARGARITAS")

Margarita is originally from the town of Tecpan, Guatemala. She is 41 years old, and has dependent children she cares for. She has a shop selling everyday consumer goods. She started with a small shop and, with the help of God, was able to become more successful and expand it a little. Her husband works as a truck driver, and thanks to his and her family’s support, she is able to continue running her business.

She invested the previous loan she received in her store to buy merchandise to meet the needs of her customers. She dreams of expanding her store even more and stocking it with a greater variety of products so that she can make better profits and send her children to school so they can have a better future. Margarita is requesting this loan to purchase groceries to sell.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell.

loans.name: Flores Hermosas Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Flores Hermosas está integrado por tres microempresarias emprendedoras, coordinado por Teresa de 27 años de edad, acompañada, y se dedica a  la compra-venta de ropa desde hace cuatro años. El crédito lo solicita para la compra de pacas de ropa como pantalones, camisas, talladores, sabanas, chores, pijamas, etc. La segunda socia es la señora Ana de 23 años de edad, y se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapatos desde hace dos años y Elizabeth de 29 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de cosméticos Avon desde hace dos años.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Flores Hermosas [Beautiful Flowers] is composed of three enterprising micro-entrepreneurs, and is coordinated by 27-year-old Teresa, who is in a relationship and has bought and sold clothing for four years. 

She is asking for a loan to buy packs of clothing such as trousers, shirts, bras, sheets, shorts, pyjamas, etc. 

The second member is 23-year-old Ana who has sold clothing and shoes for two years, and the third is 29-year-old Elizabeth who has sold Avon cosmetics for two years.

loans.use: to buy packs of clothing such as trousers, shirts, bras, sheets, shorts, pyjamas, etc.

loans.name: Ginalyn

texts.en: Ginalyn is aged 28, married to a cellular phone's technician, and blessed with 1 child. She owns and operates a retail store of cellular phones and accessories in their town for almost seven years. She earns a monthly net income in this business amounting to PHP 45,000. Due to insufficient capital for her business she wants to avail of a loan amounting to PHP 20,000 to purchase cellular phones for resale. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: buy cell phones

loans.name: Pius

texts.en:
Pius is 56 years old, married, and together with his spouse they have been blessed with nine children. He does farming in Thika town. He has been in this business for the 24 years, and it has been profitable. 

He plans to use this loan to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer for planting on his farm. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children. 

This is his first loan term from VisionFund Kenya, and his future hopes are to grow his business and be successful, and to have a happy family.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 33 years old and widowed with 2 children. She sells fruits in Thika town. She also sells clothes and has been in this business for 3 years. She plans to use this loan to buy more clothes to sell. 

She will use the anticipated profits to provide for the needs of her children. This is her third loan term from VisionFund Kenya, and she repaid her previous loans successfully. Her future hopes are to grow her business and be successful.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is engaged in the retailing business. She has her sari-sari (variety) store in front of their house. Marivic has been selling various types of grocery items for 13 years. Through her income from the business, Marivic has been able to finance her children's daily school allowances. 

Marivic's goals are for her children to finish their studies and become professionals someday. With this, Marivic has been inspired to work hard in order to attain her goal. 

Thus, Marivic is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy drinks, canned goods, and many more items. She is just hoping to gain a higher income from her business to make her goals come true.

loans.use: to buy drinks, canned goods, and many more.

loans.name: Andimutolib

texts.ru: Абдимутолиб мужчина 55 лет ,женат , отец шестерых детей и дедушка восемнадцати внуков. Он родился и вырос в сельской местности , окончил 9 классов средней школы и помогал родителям по дому. Уже в раннем возрасте он ухаживал за скотом,пас на поле,доил коров , собирал урожай и продавал на рынке.Сейчас у него собственный участок земли,где он и занимается животноводством.Он имеет пятнадцать баранов и пять коров. В его делах ему помогает младший сын.Несмотря на возраст Абдимутолиба,он не жалуется и с радостью работает и в холод,и в жару.В настоящее время  он хочет расширить поголовье своего стада ,но у него нет полной суммы денег.Поэтому он обратился в МДО Арванд за финансовой поддержкой.Он надеется ,что  организация Арванд одобрит его  просьбу о помощи и выделит нужную сумму.Заранее благодарит за поддержку и доверие.
texts.en: Andimutolib is a 55-year-old married man, a father of six children and a grandfather of eighteen grandchildren. He was born and raised in a rural area, completed 9 school grades and helped his parents with the household. He has been taking care of livestock, taking it to pasture, milking cows, gathering harvest and selling it a market from a very young age. Now he owns a plot of land, where he is involved in animal husbandry. He has fifteen sheep and five cows. His youngest son helps him with the business. Despite Andimutolib's age, he does not complain and gladly works in cold and hot weather alike. At the present time, he wants to increase his livestock headcount, but does not have the sufficient amount of money. This is why he requested financial support from MDO Arvand. He hopes that the Arvand organization will approve his request for help and provide him with the necessary amount. He is grateful in advance for the support and trust.

loans.use: to buy livestock in order to increase his livestock headcount

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy beauty products for use in her business.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is married and she works hard to support her family.  She has a business buying and selling bamboo in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from charcoal retailing. Gloria is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of bamboo to sell for her bamboo business.

Gloria has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy bamboo

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is a married woman with four children. She is 47 years old and two of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Zenaida has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Zenaida has been in this business for one year. In the future, she would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Milaluna

texts.en:
Milaluna is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 11,500 through NWTF to purchase additional fish to make dried fish for her dried fish making  business.

Milaluna has been in this business for two years. Milaluna earns more income from food vending.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to make dried fish

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who does business buying and selling sacks of rice grains in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell in her business.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 25 years. She earns more income from pig fattening. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Lulu

texts.en:
Lulu is 25 years old and has two children.  She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Lulu has borrowed and paid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from buying and selling personal collections and Natasha products.  She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Merlinda works hard to support her family.

She has a bicycle taxi business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from charcoal retail and pig fattening businesses. Merlinda is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy an additional bicycle taxi.

Merlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy an additional bicycle taxi.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida works hard to support her family. Aida is married, and has a dried fish making business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell.

Aida has been in this business for 18 years now.

In the future, Aida would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Bob

texts.en:
Bob, who is a 26-year-old, single man, living in Kamwenge, Uganda used his previous loan to buy more clothes to sell. He still deals in the mobile selling of second-hand clothes, although he also owns rentals and practices the selling of maize and coffee. 

His challenge is the market fees that he pays in each market which is high when computed at the end of the month. His business dream is having stable sources of income that will enable him to diversify his business and increase profits.

Bob is requesting a loan to buy more clothes to sell during the festive season.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell during the festive season.

loans.name: Selevano

texts.en:
Selevano used the previous loan to pay school fees for his children. He has a motorcycle (boda boda) business and also earns income from selling milk. He faces a challenge of competition and long distances to his milk customers whereby it becomes expensive for him to deliver his services to the customers. 

He hopes to educate his children so they go to higher institutions. Selevano needs a loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Johnmary

texts.en:
Johnmary is a hardworking married man with four children aged 18, 12, 8 and 6 years living in Kamwenge, Uganda.  He is a farmer, and also earns a salary to earn him extra income. He prefers to deal in this business because it is profitable. He hopes to have a big farm, however his main challenges are pests and diseases that attack his crops.  

He is requesting a loan to finish up the mulching of his coffee plantation.

loans.use: to finish up the mulching of his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy men's fabrics for his business.

loans.name: Maa Santoshi Shg Group

texts.en:
Lakshmi is a very dynamic, enterprising, and tenacious woman. She is 42 years old and has two children who are dependent on Lakshmi. Lakshmi's husband is unable to do any work and all the family responsibilities are taken care of by her nowadays. She is always in search of a good future and better economic stability. She works selling merchandise such as articles for the personal bathroom. In this manner, she generates a good income being close to her family.

Today she is starting with very little capital and is in the gathering of clients stage. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy an assortment of products like hand creams, deodorants, lotions, soaps, detergents, and beauty creams among other things at wholesale, in order to be able to provide her small business with quality products. 

She dreams of opening a new location and generating a sustainable job. With the help of the loan, she can boost her business and have a better quality of products to offer, achieving the consolidation of her business.

The other members of this group are engaged in different activities such as milk selling, running a general store, etc.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and bathroom articles to resell

loans.name: Maa Maheswari Shg Group

texts.en: Mohini is widowed and the very devoted mother of one grown daughter. Five years ago, she went into the business of buying and selling children's clothing. Her business developed little by little as she increased her working capital. Now, she has her own shop where she sells perfumes, gifts, and other items. Mohini is a very hardworking woman and President of this 10-member group with a good reputation in her group. After becoming the President of this group, she decided to take a loan from Peoples Forum for her group members to invest in their respective activities to improve their business. She, along with her group, is requesting a new loan for 150,000 INR and she will use her portion to buy more gifts items and fashion items for girls to sell. She wants to thank Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy more girls' gift items and fashion items to sell

loans.name: Jay Bajarangbali Shg Group

texts.en:
Purnnami managed to establish a general store on the sidewalk. These areas lack this type of business because the majority of families eat what they produce in the fields.

Purnnami is a divorced mother of two children, ages six, and nine, who mean the world to her. She works between 10 and 12 hours per day just so they have a better future of going to school and having the opportunities that she could not have due to the lack of resources. 

She learned the business empirically and now that she has a plan, she wants to strengthen her business. You can help increase her income so she is able to pay for her children to attend school.

With the help from a loan, she will use her portion to buy an assortment of items, mostly products that are not produced by the land, such as cleaning supplies in general, spices, biscuits, and some grains and vegetables that are not commonly grown. This loan will help her to improve her sales and diversify the products she offers. 

The other member of this Jay Bajarangbali Shg are engaged in different activities to raise some extra money so that they can help their families.

loans.use: to buy basic goods to stock her general store

loans.name: Mayerlin

texts.es:
Mayerlin en su búsqueda por un futuro prometedor y unas buenas oportunidades para salir adelante, decidió iniciar un negocio que según ella le dará todo eso que siempre ha soñado.

Montara un negocio de tienda de abarrotes en su casa en el municipio de Rionegro, con el cual planea sostener a su familia compuesta por sus dos hijos y su esposo.

Su principal dificultad es la falta de capital para trabajar.

Para lograr esto necesita la ayuda de un préstamo con la Corporación Interactuar que le permita comprar un enfriador, estanterías, vitrinas y surtido de productos básicos de la canasta familiar como abarrotes, granos, galletas y otros alimentos para abastecer e iniciar su negocio.

Apoya a los sueños emprendedores de una Colombiana con un préstamo hoy!
texts.en:
Mayerlin, searching for a brighter future and good opportunities to more forward, decided to start a business that, according to her, will give her everything that she has always dreamed of.

She will start a grocery store business in her house in the town of Rionegro. With this, she will support her family, which is composed of her husband and her two children. Her biggest difficulty is a lack of capital. 

In order to achieve this, she needs the help of a loan from Interactuar, which will allow her to buy a cooler, shelves, showcases, and an assortment of basic staple products such as groceries, grains, cookies, and other food items to stock her store and open her business.

Support the entrepreneurial dreams of a Colombian woman with a loan today!

loans.use: to buy a cooler, shelves, showcases, and an assortment of basic staple products such as groceries.

loans.name: Andres Felipe

texts.es:
Andres, un campesino lleno de sueños y aspiraciones en su vida, quiere sacar adelante a su familia con el sudor de su frente. 

Por ello comenzó con su negocio de cría de cerdos, una profesión común en el municipio de El Carmen De Viboral, donde no solo destaca el precio si no también la calidad de los cerdos que allí se crían. 

Andres solicita un crédito para la compra de cerdos de aproximadamente 70 kilos, los cuales engordará para su posterior venta, con el único objetivo de progresar y cuidar de su familia que es la que eleva su espíritu luchador y pujante.
texts.en:
Andres, a farmer filled with dreams and aspirations, wants to help support his family with the sweat of his brow.

As such he opened his own business raising pigs, a common job in the municipality of El Carmen de Viboral, known not only for the price but also the quality of the pigs raised there. 

Andres asks for a loan to buy pigs that weight about 70 kilos, which he will fatten for their subsequent sale. His only objective is to provide and care for his family, which lifts his hard working and vibrant spirit.

loans.use: to buy pigs that weigh about 70 kilos

loans.name: La Laguna Group

texts.es:
Gueisa es una mujer de 33 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 2 hijos de 3 y 8 años, y su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional.
Ella es emprendedora, independiente, constante, buena madre, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en el barrio ’15 de septiembre’ una zona residencial popular, de clima cálido, húmedo y tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Gueisa es de tez morena, cabello corto ondulado, estatura mediana, complexión física robusta ojos obscuros, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia, para el comercio habla español (al medio fila de atrás, usa blusa animal print color blanco/negro). Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica a la plomería y con sus hijos; el mayor estudia en la escuela, el menor aún no se encuentra en edad escolar, viven en una casa de herencia familiar construida de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Sus ganas de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia la llevaron a liderar una banca de personas con actividades comerciales como; taller de soldadura, tapizado de autos, venta de jugos batidos, venta de cubiertas de celulares, venta de hoja de coca y venta de jugo de quinua, para solicitar un préstamo y ampliar sus negocios. Su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional, como; majadito de charque (carne deshidratada, arroz, huevo frito y plátano frito), locro carretero cruceño (sopa de: carne deshidratada, carne cortada en pedacitos, yuca y huevo), Sopa de Remojado (sopa de huesos), Chicharrón de Taitetu (Chanchitos de monte “taitetú” frito), 
Cogote relleno (cuello de gallina criolla, relleno puede ser de papa y churiqui). Labor que realiza en su domicilio, para la hora  de almuerzo y cena. “la cocina que realizo es muy popular, siempre se termina todo lo cocinado…” comenta. Su sueño es ser la preferida de todos sus clientes y que no cambien de restaurante. Ella desea ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de mesas y sillas para atender a mayor cantidad de clientes de mejor manera. Esta es la 3 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 6 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Gueisa solicita un préstamo para la compra de mesas y sillas para atender a mayor cantidad de clientes de mejor manera.
texts.en:
Gueisa is a 33 year old mother who lives with her husband and two children ages 3 and 9. She has a business selling traditional food.

She is enterprising, independent, reliable, a good mother, responsible, and hard-working. Her business is located in the “15 de septiembre” neighborhood, a popular residential zone. The area has a warm, humid and tropical climate with a temperature that varies during the day from 21-35 degrees centigrade.

Gueisa has a dark complexion, short wavy hair, is of medium heigh, dark eyes, and her first language is Guarani which she speaks with her family and her second language is Spanish. She is in the middle , wearing an black and white animal print blouse. Her husband is a plumber. Her oldest child attends school, the youngest is not yet school age. They live in a home they inherited from family; their home is built of brick and has potable water, electricity, and sewage system. She wishes to improve her family’s quality of life so she formed a bank with others who have businesses such as sodering, car repair, selling juices, selling cell phone covers, selling coca leaf, selling quinoa juice. They seek a loan to expand their businesses. Gueisa’s business is selling traditional food such as “majadito de charque” (dehydrated meat, rice, fried egg, fried plantain), “Locro carretero cruceño” (soup with dehydrated meat, chopped meat, yucca, and egg), “sopa de remojado (bone soup), “Chicharrón de Taitetu” (fried “taitetu” skin, a type of pig), “cogete relleno” (chicken neck stuffed with potato and churiqui). She works from her home, serving lunch and dinner. She comments, “The cooking I do is very popular, and everything I cook sells out...” Her dream is to be the preferred place of all her customers and that they don’t change restaurants. She wants to expand her business by buying tables and chairs to better serve a greater number of customers. This is the 3rd sequence of loans with the institution in the 6 years that she has been doing this business.

For these reasons Gueisa seeks a loan to buy tables and chairs to better serve a greater number of customers.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs to better serve a greater number of customers.

loans.name: Cruz Elena

texts.es:
Cruz es una mujer de campo y madre de 2 hijos por los que ha tenido que pasar por muchas adversidades en su vida, sin embargo siempre ha tenido la fortaleza para salir adelante y continuar progresando con su familia.
Desde hace tiempo ha querido montar un negocio de cría y venta de cerdos.

Es por eso que solicita un gran aliento económico para comprar algunos cerdos para cría y materiales para la construcción de un corral.

Con este nuevo negocio podrá generar ingresos para su familia que es todo para ella y podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su esposo y sus hijos.

Trabajara todos los días para impulsar su negocio y hacerlo una actividad sostenible y rentable.

Apoya a una mujer trabajadora con un préstamo!
texts.en:
Cruz is a rural woman and the mother of 2 children. She has had to endure many hardships in her life but she has always had the strength to progress forward and continue to get ahead with her family.

For a long time, she has wanted to start a business raising and selling pigs. That’s why she is asking for a great economic encouragement to buy some pigs for breeding and materials to build a corral. 

With this new business, she can generate income for her family. Family is everything to her. She can improve their quality of life for her husband and children. She will work everyday to promote her business and make it a sustainable and profitable activity. 

Support a working woman with this loan!

loans.use: to purchase breeding pigs and materials to build a corral

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy building materials for repairing the food shop

loans.name: Dieb

texts.en:
Dieb, 56, is living in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has four children in total; one is married and lives independently, while other three are single and live under her support. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small rice farmland which is located near her house. So far, she has been in this type of business for more than 30 years. On average, she is able to make an income of USD 5.00 a day.

She wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. 

She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Jose Santos

texts.es: jose de 57 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos, se dedica al cultivo de maiz desde hace 42 años, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los sacos que muestra en la fotografía para luego comercializarlo, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y asi seguir con su trabajo.
texts.en: 57-year-old Jose lives in his own house with his wife and four children. He has made a living for 42 years by growing maize. When his harvest is ready, he stores it in the sacks shown in the photograph and then sells it. He is requesting a loan in order to buy seeds, fertilisers, compost, pesticides, and other things so he can continue with his work.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilisers, compost, pesticides, etc

loans.name: Ashura

texts.en:
Ashura, who is in her late 40s, is single with three kids who are still in school. She has been a food vendor for ten years now. She works from 6:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Ashura's 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to keep increasing her "mama lishe" stock and has paid back all of her loans successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees and to cover household expenses. She will use this loan to restock the out-of-stock items in the food store. She dreams of starting a catering business.

Ashura will make sure she pays back the loan at the scheduled time.

loans.use: to restock the out-of-stock items in her food store.

loans.name: Kimleang

texts.en:
Kimleang, 44 years old, is originally from Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. He has two single children. To make a living, he manages and operates a farming business; he primarily grows and sells rice on a small farmland that is located near his house. This business allows him to earn USD 5.00 a day on average. So far, he has been in this field of business for more than twenty years. 

In this farming season, he is going to use natural fertilizers on his farmland. Because there is a shortage of money, he would like to get a Kiva loan via KHL to buy fertilizers to use in his farming process. With the support from this loan, he hopes that his rice will grow better and he will be able to produce more crops for him. 

He is thankful to all lenders for their financial support. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: San Judas Tadeo Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “San Judas Tadeo” está conformado por 07 socias optimistas y comprometidas. Este es el caso de Silvia de 23 años de edad separada con 01 hijo dependiente. Ella se dedica al servicio de corte de cabello (cosmetóloga). Con dicho negocio a podido brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su único hijo. Así  mismo como actividad secundaria apoya en accesoria contable. Solicitó el  crédito para la compra de tintes, tijeras, talcos y peines. El deseo de Silvia es de poder contar con su propio salón de belleza. El grupo “San Judas Tadeo” agradece a las personas que hicieron posible este crédito. Silvia es la segunda del lado izquierdo y viste bivirí floreado.
texts.en:
This is the "San Judas Tadeo" group, which consists of 7 optimistic and committed members. This is true of Silvia, who is 23 years old, separated, with one dependent child. She makes a living giving haircuts as a cosmetologist. With this business, she has been able to provide a better quality of life for her only son. She also has a second job helping with accounting consulting. 

Silvia is requesting a loan to purchase dyes, scissors, powders and combs. Silvia's dream is to have her own salon. The group "San Judas Tadeo" thank the people who made this loan possible. Silvia is the second from the left wearing the floral top.

loans.use: to purchase dyes, scissors, powders and combs.

loans.name: Nieves Ann

texts.en:
Nieves Ann is a responsible housewife who owns and manages a small boutique within the town proper. She is 43 years old, married and has only one child. 

She aspires to further improve this business and increase her income in order to help her husband provide the necessities of her family. Due to capital insufficiency, she wants to avail herself of an additional capital amounting to PHP 25,000 to buy more clothes, sandals, shoes, bags, toys and jewelry to resell. 

Having this financial assistance, Nieves Ann hopes that someday, she will further improve the business as well as their status of living.

loans.use: to buy more clothes, sandals, shoes, bags, toys and jewelry to resell.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Selling a variety of vegetables is what Jovelyn is involved in. She is happily married, having four children. Three of her children are currently attending school while her youngest is still infant-aged. As additional source of income, she is also engaged in a hog-raising business. 

Her husband's occupation is farming. The couple is doing their best in order to sustain their daily necessities and provide allowances for their three children.

Jovelyn would like to borrow additional capital amounting to PHP 7,000. She knows that this loan will help her in increasing her sales and income. She would be thankful if her requested loan will be granted.

loans.use: to buy a variety of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Millicent is 28 years old. She is married to Julius, and together they have been blessed with 2 children of 9 and 6 years.

Millicent is a poultry farmer, a business she has been in for the last 4 years, earning a monthly income of KES 3,000. She has requested her 1st loan with VisionFund Kenya of KES 15,000, which she will use to add to her stock of poultry for farming.

With the anticipated profits, Millicent will be able to start another business in order to increase her profits. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to be able to support her family and repay her loans without defaulting.

loans.use: to add to her stock of poultry

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia is a 57-year-old married woman from the town of Estancia in Ilo-ilo. All her nine children are adults. Three years ago, she started a transportation business using her tricycle. She would like to expand her business to earn a better income. She is asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy a new sidecar. With this, she will be able to have a better return on her investment. Her income will provide her and her husband healthy meals and savings for their future needs.

loans.use: to buy a new sidecar

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy farm inputs

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
This is Daniel. He sends you his thanks for your generosity because his previous loan enhanced his business. He was able to buy spare parts and accessories for their vehicle. The loan also helped him provide for their daily needs and expenditures.

He is very positive that he could improve his business even more if you will let him borrow again an amount of 50,000 PHP. This new loan will go to purchase additional supplies of accessories and spare parts for their tricycle. Simultaneously, he could sustain the needs of his family if the unit is regularly maintained and in good condition.

Daniel wants his business to improve and expand. He dreams to give his children the best education possible. He meets every week with his *co-fellowship members to share stories of his work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and the maintenance of his tricycle vehicle.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Wilma works hard to support her family.

She has a farming of rice business in the Philippines and earns additional income from buy and sell of rice grains.  Wilma is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy additional fertilizers and other farm supplies for her farming of rice business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Wilma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Renelyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Renelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from dried fish vending.  Renelyn is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Renelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Merlie

texts.en:
Merlie is 54 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Merlie is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Merlie has been raising pigs for two years and also earns additional income from frozen foods.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Navy

texts.en:
Residing in Kampong Chhnang province, Navy is 36 years old and a mother of one child. 

She rents karaoke to earn income to support her family condition. Moreover, she can earn additional income via selling grocery items. 

For Navy, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will spend her entire loan portion to buy a solar panel. 

She hopes that she can improve her house to have enough electricity to use.

loans.use: To buy a solar panel.

location.town: Kampong Chhnang province, Tek Phos district

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina is 29 years old and a single man who is living in Kampong Cham province. Nowadays, he works in a company to make income to support himself. 

He can earn an income of about 11 USD per day. For Dina, this is his first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). He will spend his entire loan portion to pay tuition fees for his Master's degree. He hopes that he can get a good job after he graduates.

loans.use: To pay tuition fees for his Master's degree.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Mercy, 28 years of age, a very hardworking, honest and dedicated farmer who lives in Kesses, a remote village in Eldoret. She is happily married and is blessed with two adorable children. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last 5 years and has gained so much experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling rabbit meat, eggs and a variety of food crops from her farmland. 

To make ends meet and make extra cash, she has been engaging in another small personal business. The Eldoret area is very populated and demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable. She stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand that is really high. 

She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, and she is seeking a loan of 30,000 KES to buy poultry. Being a woman, accessing funds is very challenging. Through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, she feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved, and she will be able to buy more poultry. Through the loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market. This will translate to increased profit margins and an improved income level. 

Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits and increase her poultry market to other markets. This will increase her income and improve her living conditions. The extra income she will get will be used in fully repaying back the loan and permanently changing her living conditions and securing the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: To purchase poultry.

loans.name: Maria Nancy

texts.es:
Un día la señora Nancy se sentía muy angustiada era mujer del campo sin terreno ni tierras para cultivar, con dos hijos a su cuidado gracias a la venta ambulante de mercancía como ropa, ropa interior, pijamas. 
Con esta forma de ventas y de vida ha podido levantar su familia, dándoles una alimentación, educación, una vida digna, ahora pensando en empezar el año de la mejor manera Nancy quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de surtido de ropa para hombre y dama, pijamas para seguir velando por el bienestar de sus seres amados
texts.en:
One day Nancy felt very distressed: She was a woman in the country who had no land or soil to cultivate and two children in her care.  Thanks to selling merchandise such as clothing, underwear, and pajamas as a street vendor--with this form of sales and way of life--she has been able to lift up her family and give them food, an education, and a decent life.

Now, thinking about the best way to start the new year, Nancy wants to request a loan to buy a supply of women's and men's clothing and pajamas to keep watching out for the well-being of her loved ones.

loans.use: to buy women's and men's clothing, underwear, and pajamas.  She's a landless entrepreneur from the country.

loans.name: Vy's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area in Kampong Cham province, Vy is 45 years old and a mother of six children. For her living, she grows tobacco and corn as the main source of income. Moreover, she can earn extra income via sesame and peanut growing. 

She has been involved this business for ages and it earns her about 41,900 KHR per day. This is first time for Vy with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of three to get new loan. 

As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy more sesame, fertilizer and plow the farm. She hopes that she can improve her business and her family's living conditions so that they are better than before.

loans.use: To buy more sesame, fertilizer and plow the farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Seang Hy's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer living in Kampong Cham province, Seang Hy is 35 years old and a mother of three schoolchildren. To support her family, she grows rice and sells snacks to earn more income. She has been involved this business for ages and earns her about 27,300 KHR per day. 

For Seang Hy, this is her fourth cycles with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans completely. In a group of two, she is the group leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and pesticide to support her rice farm. She hopes that she can improve her family condition so it is better than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide to support her rice farm.
